original: ci rigs par bsdu bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni re zhig khams bco brgyad ni de dag nyid yin pas de dag ni 'di dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: ci rigs par bsdu bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni re zhig khams bco brgyad ni de dag nyid yin pas de dag ni 'di dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The eighteen elements are included in the aggregates as appropriate.

original: de bzhin du gang la sa'i khams la sogs pa drug 'byung ba de dag las kyang dang po'i gzhi ni reg bya'i khams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang la sa'i khams la sogs pa drug 'byung ba de dag las kyang dang po'i gzhi ni reg bya'i khams kyis bsdus so //
translated: The first six elements, such as the earth element, are included in the tangible-object element.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni snang ba dang mun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su 'dus so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni snang ba dang mun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su 'dus so //
translated: The space element is included in the form element because it is the nature of light and darkness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni sems kyi khams bdun du 'dus so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni sems kyi khams bdun du 'dus so //
translated: The consciousness element is included in the seven mental elements.üîΩThe six elements such as the desire element are included in the desire element.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa drug las 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dir 'dod pa'i 'dod chags yin par bzhed de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa drug las 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dir 'dod pa'i 'dod chags yin par bzhed de /
translated: The desire element is desire for the desire realm, and it is asserted here to be desire for the desire realm.

original: de yang sems las byung ba yin la gnod sems kyi khams la sogs pa yang sems las byung ba kho na yin pas de dag ni chos kyi khams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de yang sems las byung ba yin la gnod sems kyi khams la sogs pa yang sems las byung ba kho na yin pas de dag ni chos kyi khams kyis bsdus so //
translated: Since it is a mental factor, and since the malice element and so on are also mental factors, they are included in the phenomena element.

original: bde ba'i khams la sogs pa drug kyang de nyid du 'dus so //
analyzed: bde ba'i khams la sogs pa drug kyang de nyid du 'dus so //
translated: The six elements of sensation, etc., are included in the element of factors.

original: tshor ba'i khams la sogs pa bzhi las gsum ni chos kyi khams su 'dus so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i khams la sogs pa bzhi las gsum ni chos kyi khams su 'dus so //
translated: Three of the four elements of sensation, etc., are included in the element of factors.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun du 'dus so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun du 'dus so //
translated: The element of consciousness is included in the seven elements of consciousness.üîΩThree of the elements of the realm of desire, etc., are included in the eighteen elements.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa gsum las 'dod pa'i khams ni khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa gsum las 'dod pa'i khams ni khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
translated: The realm of desire is included in the eighteen elements.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni dri dang ro dang sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag ma gtogs pa khams bcu bzhir 'dus so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni dri dang ro dang sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag ma gtogs pa khams bcu bzhir 'dus so //
translated: The realm of form is included in the fourteen elements, with the exception of odor, taste, the nose, and tongue consciousnesses.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag tu 'dus so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag tu 'dus so //
translated: The formless realm is included in the mental faculty, factors, and mind consciousness elements.

original: gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa gsum las gnyis kyi bsdu ba ni bshad zin to //üîΩ'gog pa'i khams ni chos kyi @52a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa gsum las gnyis kyi bsdu ba ni bshad zin to // 'gog pa'i khams ni chos kyi @52a * //
translated: The inclusion of two of the three elements of the realm of form, etc., has been explained.

original: khams su 'dus so //
analyzed: khams su 'dus so //
translated: The element of cessation is included in the element of factors.

original: 'das pa'i khams la sogs pa gsum ni so sor khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i khams la sogs pa gsum ni so sor khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
translated: Three of the elements of the past, etc., are each included in the eighteen elements.

original: ngan pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa kho na yin pas 'di dag gi bsdu ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ngan pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa kho na yin pas 'di dag gi bsdu ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The three realms of badness, etc., are the desire realm, etc., so their inclusion is explained.

original: dge ba'i khams la sogs pa gsum las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i khams dag ni gzugs dang sgra dang chos kyi khams dag dang sems kyi khams bdun du 'dus so //
analyzed: dge ba'i khams la sogs pa gsum las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i khams dag ni gzugs dang sgra dang chos kyi khams dag dang sems kyi khams bdun du 'dus so //
translated: Among the three elements of virtue, etc., the elements of virtue and nonvirtue are included in the form, sound, and phenomena elements and the seven mental elements.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i khams ni khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i khams ni khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
translated: The neutral element is included in the eighteen elements.

original: slob po dang mi slob pa'i khams la sogs pa gsum las dang po gnyis ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag tu 'dus so //
analyzed: slob po dang mi slob pa'i khams la sogs pa gsum las dang po gnyis ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag tu 'dus so //
translated: Among the three elements of learner, post-learner, and neither learner nor post-learner, the first two are included in the mind, phenomena, and mental consciousness elements.

original: gsum pa ni khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
translated: The third is included in the eighteen elements.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa zag pa med pa'i khams las dang po ni khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa zag pa med pa'i khams las dang po ni khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
translated: Among the two elements of contaminated and uncontaminated, the first is included in the eighteen elements.

original: gnyis pa ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag tu 'dus so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag tu 'dus so //
translated: The second is included in the mind, phenomena, and mental consciousness elements.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams las dang po ni khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams las dang po ni khams bco brgyad du 'dus so //
translated: The first is included in the eighteen elements.üîΩThe second is included in the phenomena element.

original: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams su 'dus te de dag ni khams drug cu rtsa gnyis yin no //üîΩder gang dag ces bya ba ni khams mang po'i bar ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams su 'dus te de dag ni khams drug cu rtsa gnyis yin no // der gang dag ces bya ba ni khams mang po'i bar ro //
translated: Those are the sixty-two elements.üîΩAmong those, the characteristics of two have not been explained.

original: de dag las gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ma bshad na zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams la sogs pa dang / 'di dag gi ni mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: de dag las gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ma bshad na zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams la sogs pa dang / 'di dag gi ni mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristics of the earth element and so on have been explained:

original: 'dzin pa la sogs las su grub //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sogs las su grub //
translated: They are established as the function of support and so on.

original: sra gsher dro nyid g-yo ba rnams //
analyzed: sra gsher dro nyid g-yo ba rnams //
translated: Hardness, moisture, heat, and movement

original: zhes bya ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad zin to //
translated: have been explained.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtshan nyid kyang //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtshan nyid kyang //
translated: The characteristic of the space element has also been explained:

original: de la nam mkha' mi sgrib pa //üîΩzhes bshad zin la /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' mi sgrib pa // zhes bshad zin la /
translated: Space is nonobstructive.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid kyang //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid kyang //
translated: The characteristic of the consciousness element has also been explained:

original: rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa //üîΩzhes smos pa'i phyir bshad zin ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa //üîΩzhes smos pa'i phyir bshad zin ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Consciousness is the individual‚Äôs awareness.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ni bshad pa bden na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ni bshad pa bden na /
translated: If the characteristics of all consciousnesses are explained,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams go ci 'dir rnam par shes pa cung zad cig kho na yin no zhes bya bar bsam pa yin nam 'on te thams cad yin zhes bya bar rnam par ma phye la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams go ci 'dir rnam par shes pa cung zad cig kho na yin no zhes bya bar bsam pa yin nam 'on te thams cad yin zhes bya bar rnam par ma phye la /
translated: then why is it not distinguished here that the consciousness element is just a certain type of consciousness, or that it is all consciousness?

original: nam mkha' la yang 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid can bshad kyi nam mkha'i khams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid can bshad kyi nam mkha'i khams ni ma yin no //
translated: And the characteristic of the unconditioned is explained as space, but it is not the space element.

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar nam @52b mkha' las gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar nam @52b mkha' las gzhan yin te /
translated: Undoubtedly, it is different from space.

original: mdo las dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam pa'i blo 'dis /
analyzed: mdo las dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam pa'i blo 'dis /
translated: Because a sutra declares, ‚ÄúMonks, this person consists of six elements.‚Äù

original: gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ma bshad na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ma bshad na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: With this in mind, he says, ‚ÄúIf the characteristics of the two are not explained.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ci nam mkha' nyid nam mkha'i khams yin la rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams yin par rig par bya'am zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ci nam mkha' nyid nam mkha'i khams yin la rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams yin par rig par bya'am zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúShould space alone be understood as the space element, and all consciousness as the consciousness element?‚Äù

original: kha dang sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rna ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: kha dang sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rna ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmouth, nose, etc.‚Äù includes the ears, etc.

original: snang dang mun pa dag yin lo //
analyzed: snang dang mun pa dag yin lo //
translated: Light and darkness.

original: zhes bya ba la lo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni pha rol pa'i gzhung lugs rjod par byed pa yin te rang gi gzhung lugs ni nam mkha' thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas med pa tsam yin no zhes bya bar bsam pa yin par mngon no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la lo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni pha rol pa'i gzhung lugs rjod par byed pa yin te rang gi gzhung lugs ni nam mkha' thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas med pa tsam yin no zhes bya bar bsam pa yin par mngon no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates the opponent‚Äôs view, while the SautrƒÅntika view is that space is simply the absence of tangible form.

original: mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo yod pa'i mun pa dang nyin mo'i 'od kyi mtshan nyid kyi snang ba yin par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo yod pa'i mun pa dang nyin mo'i 'od kyi mtshan nyid kyi snang ba yin par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The nature of night and day. The nature of night is darkness, and the nature of day is light, because light and darkness are considered to be the characteristics of night and day.

original: bstan pa 'di ni phal che ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di ni phal che ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: This explanation is from the perspective of the majority of cases.

original: thogs pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir brtsegs par gnas pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: thogs pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir brtsegs par gnas pa'i gzugs te /
translated: Obstructive form is form that obstructs, because it is capable of being obstructed.

original: de ni de'i nye 'khor ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i nye 'khor ro //
translated: That is its spatial division.

original: lo zhes bya ba ni brtsegs pa la gnas pa ni brtsegs par gnas pa ste shin tu gnod par byed pa'am gnod par bya ba yin pas na brtsegs pa yin no //
analyzed: lo zhes bya ba ni brtsegs pa la gnas pa ni brtsegs par gnas pa ste shin tu gnod par byed pa'am gnod par bya ba yin pas na brtsegs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúA lo‚Äù means ‚Äúa place where there is a pile,‚Äù that is, a place where there is a collection of things.

original: de ni de'i nye 'khor ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i nye 'khor ro //
translated: It is the surrounding area of that place.üîΩ‚ÄúA lo‚Äù means ‚Äúa place where there is a pile,‚Äù that is, a place where there is a collection of things.

original: zhes bya ba ni brtsegs pa rtsig pa la sogs pa de'i nye 'khor yin zhing nye bar gnas pa yin te /üîΩde la ltos nas rnam par gzhag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brtsegs pa rtsig pa la sogs pa de'i nye 'khor yin zhing nye bar gnas pa yin te / de la ltos nas rnam par gzhag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the surrounding area of that place.üîΩThis is the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika explanation of the term ‚Äúnonobstructive form.‚Äù

original: rnam par bshad pa 'di la yang lo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bye brag tu smra ba'i rnam par bshad pa yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang gi gzhung lugs ni gang 'og nas 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa 'di la yang lo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bye brag tu smra ba'i rnam par bshad pa yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro // rang gi gzhung lugs ni gang 'og nas 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The SautrƒÅntika explanation of the term ‚Äúnonobstructive form‚Äù is given in the next section.

original: des smras pa /üîΩ'di la gzugs gzhan thogs pa med pas de la gzugs gzhan mi thogs pa'i phyir de ni thogs med kyang yin la /
analyzed: des smras pa / 'di la gzugs gzhan thogs pa med pas de la gzugs gzhan mi thogs pa'i phyir de ni thogs med kyang yin la /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says:üîΩIn this world, other forms are obstructed, but this form is not obstructed by other forms.

original: brtsegs par gnas pa'i gzugs gzhan gyi nye 'khor yang yin te /
analyzed: brtsegs par gnas pa'i gzugs gzhan gyi nye 'khor yang yin te /
translated: It is also the surrounding area of other forms that are in a pile.

original: phyogs 'di la ni de ni thogs med kyang yin la de ni nye 'khor yang yin pas thogs med nye 'khor yin no zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o //üîΩzag dang bcas pa'i rnam shes ni //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la ni de ni thogs med kyang yin la de ni nye 'khor yang yin pas thogs med nye 'khor yin no zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o // zag dang bcas pa'i rnam shes ni //
translated: In this context, it is the unobstructed part and it is the surrounding part, so it is called the unobstructed part.üîΩThe consciousness that is associated with the contaminants

original: @53a * // zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rgyu'i rnam par shes pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te ci'i phyir snyam na /
analyzed: @53a * // zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rgyu'i rnam par shes pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro // gal te ci'i phyir snyam na /
translated: is the consciousness that is the cause of birth.üîΩIf one asks why,

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: the root text states,

original: 'di ltar khams drug po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams drug po 'di dag ni /
translated: because these six elements

original: skye ba'i rten yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: skye ba'i rten yin par 'dod de /
translated: are asserted to be the basis of birth.

original: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / khams drug la brten nas ma'i mngal du bu 'jug go zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / khams drug la brten nas ma'i mngal du bu 'jug go zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The s≈´tras say, ‚ÄúMonks, this person consists of six elements,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe embryo enters the womb in dependence on the six elements.‚Äù

original: de dag ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nas 'chi ba'i sems kyi bar du skye ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de dag ni skye ba bskyed par byed pa dang / gso bar byed pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir gzhir gyur pa ste /üîΩ'di la skyed par byed pa ni rnam par shes pa'i khams yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nas 'chi ba'i sems kyi bar du skye ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de dag ni skye ba bskyed par byed pa dang / gso bar byed pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir gzhir gyur pa ste / 'di la skyed par byed pa ni rnam par shes pa'i khams yin te /
translated: They are the basis because they generate, sustain, and increase birth, from the mind of birth linking to the mind of death.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sa bon yin no //üîΩgso bar byed pa ni 'byung ba dag yin te /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sa bon yin no // gso bar byed pa ni 'byung ba dag yin te /
translated: The consciousness element generates birth because it is the seed of birth linking.

original: de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'phel par byed pa ni nam mkha'i khams yin te /
analyzed: de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro // 'phel par byed pa ni nam mkha'i khams yin te /
translated: The four primary elements sustain birth because they are its support.

original: go 'byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir 'di dag la khams nyid yin par brjod de //
analyzed: go 'byed pa'i phyir ro // de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag la khams nyid yin par brjod de //
translated: The space element increases birth because it provides room for the body to grow.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba 'dzin pas na khams dag yin no //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba 'dzin pas na khams dag yin no //
translated: Therefore they are called elements because they hold the seed of birth, they hold the primary elements, and they hold the increase of birth.üîΩThe five sense objects are form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir skye ba'i rten ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir skye ba'i rten ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case for uncontaminated factors.

original: bstan yod 'dir ni gzugs gcig pu //
analyzed: bstan yod 'dir ni gzugs gcig pu //
translated: The one element that is visible is form alone.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What does this mean?

original: khyad par gang zhig dang ldan na dngos po de de ltar bstan par nus pa'i khyad par de ni bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gang zhig dang ldan na dngos po de de ltar bstan par nus pa'i khyad par de ni bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is capable of being indicated by pointing to a particular place is called visible.

original: yang na tshig gis gzhan gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa ni bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na tshig gis gzhan gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa ni bstan pa yin la /
translated: Or else, that which produces the visual consciousness of another is visible.

original: de dang lhan cig 'jug pa ni bstan yod de gzugs kyi khams gcig pu yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'jug pa ni bstan yod de gzugs kyi khams gcig pu yin no //
translated: The one element that is visible is form alone.

original: 'dir khams bco brgyad dag las gzugs kyi khams gcig kho nas bstan du yod pa'o zhes dmigs kyis bstsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir khams bco brgyad dag las gzugs kyi khams gcig kho nas bstan du yod pa'o zhes dmigs kyis bstsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, among the eighteen elements, only the form element is visible, because it is specifically mentioned.

original: lhag ma rnams ni bstan du med pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bstan du med pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The others are not visible.

original: bstan du yod pa nyid 'dis kyang gtso bo yin par bshad pa yin par zlos pa'i nyes par thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan du yod pa nyid 'dis kyang gtso bo yin par bshad pa yin par zlos pa'i nyes par thal ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not the fault of repetition, since it explains that the primary characteristic is the existence of form.üîΩ

original: de ni grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not the fault of repetition, since the existence of form is the primary characteristic.

original: bstan du yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag 'di dag kyang phal cher mdo las gsungs pa kho na yin pas rab tu bstan te /
analyzed: bstan du yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag 'di dag kyang phal cher mdo las gsungs pa kho na yin pas rab tu bstan te /
translated: These specific characteristics such as being visible are taught in the s≈´tras.

original: @53b 'di ltar mdo las /
analyzed: @53b 'di ltar mdo las /
translated: The s≈´tras state:

original: dge slong mig ni nang gi skye mched yin te /
analyzed: dge slong mig ni nang gi skye mched yin te /
translated: Monks, the eye is an internal sense base,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs dang / gzugs can bstan du med pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs dang / gzugs can bstan du med pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: a form derived from the four great elements, visible, resistant.

original: dge slong lus ni nang gi skye mched yin te zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong lus ni nang gi skye mched yin te zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Monks, the body is an internal sense base.

original: dge slong yid ni nang gi skye mched yin te /
analyzed: dge slong yid ni nang gi skye mched yin te /
translated: Monks, the mind is an internal sense base.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not a form, invisible, and resistant.

original: dge slong gzugs dag ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gzugs dag ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
translated: Monks, forms are an external sense base.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du yod pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du yod pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is physical, demonstrable, and impeded, and is derived from the four great elements.

original: dge slong sgra dag ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
analyzed: dge slong sgra dag ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
translated: Monks, sounds are external bases.

original: 'byung ba chen po 'di dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med cing thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po 'di dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med cing thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They are physical, undemonstrable, and impeded, and are derived from the four great elements.

original: dge slong reg bya dag ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
analyzed: dge slong reg bya dag ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
translated: Monks, tangibles are external bases.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: They are physical, undemonstrable, and impeded, and are derived from the four great elements.

original: dge slong skye mched rnams ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
analyzed: dge slong skye mched rnams ni phyi'i skye mched yin te /
translated: Monks, the sense-spheres are external bases.

original: skye mched bcu gcig gis ma bsdus pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gcig gis ma bsdus pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: They are undemonstrable and impeded, and are not included in the eleven sense-spheres.

original: de dag kyang mdzod kyi gnas dang po yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du khams rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba kho nar ston te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdzod kyi gnas dang po yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du khams rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba kho nar ston te /
translated: The first chapter of the Abhidharmakosa is completed.

original: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The elements are classified in the first chapter of the Abhidharmakosa, because they are distinguished by form and consciousness.

original: thogs dang bcas pa gzugs can bcu //
analyzed: thogs dang bcas pa gzugs can bcu //
translated: 10. The ten that are impeded are material.

original: zhes bya ba la gzugs can smos pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gzugs can smos pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúmaterial‚Äù is mentioned in order to exclude the immaterial.

original: gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba ste de 'di dag la yod pas gzugs can rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba ste de 'di dag la yod pas gzugs can rnams so //
translated: Form is that which can be broken up. It is material because it exists in that form.

original: bcu zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams la sogs pa lnga dang / de dag gi yul gyi khams lnga kho na yin no //
analyzed: bcu zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams la sogs pa lnga dang / de dag gi yul gyi khams lnga kho na yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúten‚Äù refers to the five elements of eye, etc., and the five elements that are their objects.

original: chos kyi khams ji ltar brtsal bar byas pa yin /üîΩde la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir de yang gzugs can no zhes brjod par nus so zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi khams ji ltar brtsal bar byas pa yin / de la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir de yang gzugs can no zhes brjod par nus so zhe na /
translated: How is the element of mental objects investigated?üîΩIt can be said that it is material because non-informative form exists in it.

original: gzugs can zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir de brtsal ba byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs can zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir de brtsal ba byas pa yin te /
translated: It is investigated because it is specified as ‚Äúmaterial.‚Äù

original: khams gang dag gzugs can gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de dag kho na gzung bar bya ba yin na /üîΩchos kyi khams ni gzugs @54a * //
analyzed: khams gang dag gzugs can gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de dag kho na gzung bar bya ba yin na / chos kyi khams ni gzugs @54a * //
translated: Those elements that are of the nature of form are also apprehended.

original: can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin no //
translated: But the element of mental objects is of the nature of both form and non-form.üîΩIt is the obstruction to the arising of another in its own place.

original: rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba'i gegs byed pa ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang na thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gcig yod pa der gzugs can gnyis pa skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba'i gegs byed pa ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang na thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gcig yod pa der gzugs can gnyis pa skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the place where there is one thing that is resistant, a second thing that is resistant does not arise.

original: dper na lag pa'am rdo ba la lag pa rdugs shing thogs pa ste /
analyzed: dper na lag pa'am rdo ba la lag pa rdugs shing thogs pa ste /
translated: For example, a hand is obstructed and resistant to a hand or to a stone.

original: lag pa'i gnas sam rdo ba'i gnas su lag pa mi 'byung ba'am rdo ba yang de gnyis la ste rdo ba lag pa dang rdo ba dag gi gnas su mi 'byung ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: lag pa'i gnas sam rdo ba'i gnas su lag pa mi 'byung ba'am rdo ba yang de gnyis la ste rdo ba lag pa dang rdo ba dag gi gnas su mi 'byung ba lta bu yin no //
translated: A hand does not arise in the place occupied by a hand or in the place occupied by a stone. A stone does not arise in the place occupied by a hand or in the place occupied by a stone.

original: chu la sogs la zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul chu la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chu la sogs la zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul chu la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In water, etc. means in its own place, which is water, etc.

original: mi phal che'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba phal che ba smos pa ni nya ba la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi phal che'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba phal che ba smos pa ni nya ba la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúmost‚Äù is mentioned because it excludes fishermen, etc.

original: gnyi gar ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni nges par mngal du 'chi ba rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyi gar ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni nges par mngal du 'chi ba rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: There are some who die in both ways, such as those who die in the womb.

original: rnam pa de dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa de rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa de rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúthese‚Äù refers to the modes of death.

original: pha bang ni kha rkub dag yin no //
analyzed: pha bang ni kha rkub dag yin no //
translated: The buttocks are the seat.

original: byi la la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa smos pas ni chom rkun pa'i mi la sogs pa dang / stag la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: byi la la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa smos pas ni chom rkun pa'i mi la sogs pa dang / stag la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúcat, etc.‚Äù includes thieves, etc. and tigers, etc.

original: gang zhig gang la byed pa de ni de'i yul yin la zhes bya ba ni byed pa ni rtsal yin te mig dang rna ba la sogs pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa ni byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la byed pa de ni de'i yul yin la zhes bya ba ni byed pa ni rtsal yin te mig dang rna ba la sogs pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa ni byed pa yin no //
translated: The object of a faculty is that in relation to which a faculty functions. The eye, ear, etc. function with regard to form, sound, etc. by seeing, hearing, etc.

original: de yang rang gi sems dang sems las byung ba dag la rten gyi ngo bo'i nus pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rang gi sems dang sems las byung ba dag la rten gyi ngo bo'i nus pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the object-field is the special power of the mind and mental activities, which is the cause of their arising.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis khar ba la brten pa'i tshul du 'dzin pa de ni dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis khar ba la brten pa'i tshul du 'dzin pa de ni dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The object-field is that which is grasped by the mind and mental activities, as if it were held by a stick.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i kho na'i yin la yul ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'ba' zhig gis ma yin gyi mig la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i kho na'i yin la yul ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'ba' zhig gis ma yin gyi mig la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: Thus, the object-field is only of the mind and mental activities, but the domain is not only of the mind and mental activities, but also of the eye, etc.

original: de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na gang zhig shing ngam rtsig pa gang las gzhan du mi 'jug pa de ni de la thogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na gang zhig shing ngam rtsig pa gang las gzhan du mi 'jug pa de ni de la thogs pa yin no //
translated: Because it does not operate elsewhere. In the world, that which does not operate elsewhere is an obstruction.

original: de bzhin mig la sogs pa yang yul gzhan du byed pa mi byed kyi rang gi yul kho na la byed de //
analyzed: de bzhin mig la sogs pa yang yul gzhan du byed pa mi byed kyi rang gi yul kho na la byed de //
translated: In the same way, the eye, etc., do not operate on other objects, but only on their own objects.

original: de lta bas na de la thogs pa yin no zhes @54b bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de la thogs pa yin no zhes @54b bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are impeded.üîΩOr, it is said that impeding is impeding in this regard, etc.

original: yang na 'di la gtod pa ni thogs pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yul 'di la gtod par byed pa ni gtod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di la gtod pa ni thogs pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yul 'di la gtod par byed pa ni gtod pa'o //
translated: Impeding is impeding in this regard.

original: rang gi yul la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi yul la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is that which engages its own object.

original: de lta bas na bcu po dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na bcu po dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the ten are impeded by obstruction, etc.

original: thogs dang bcas pa gzugs can bcu //
analyzed: thogs dang bcas pa gzugs can bcu //
translated: The ten are impeded by obstruction.

original: zhes bya ba 'dir khams bcu po dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dir khams bcu po dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: In this context, the ten elements are asserted to be impeded by obstruction because they are impeded by obstruction.üîΩIn this regard, the four possibilities of the defilement of mind and mental factors are:

original: de la sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang yul dang dmigs pa la thogs pa dag gi thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pas dri ma mu bzhi ste mu bzhi ni rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang yul dang dmigs pa la thogs pa dag gi thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pas dri ma mu bzhi ste mu bzhi ni rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The four possibilities are the four alternatives.

original: tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste zhes bya ba ni gal te dri ba'i cha phyi ma bzung nas lan 'debs par byed na de ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste zhes bya ba ni gal te dri ba'i cha phyi ma bzung nas lan 'debs par byed na de ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúor it is connected with the latter part of the statement‚Äù means that if the answer is given by taking the latter part of the question into consideration, then the answer is connected with the latter part of the statement.

original: gal te cha snga ma bzung na lan 'debs par byed na de ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba yin no //üîΩde dag ni yul la thogs pas kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: gal te cha snga ma bzung na lan 'debs par byed na de ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba yin no // de dag ni yul la thogs pas kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
translated: If the answer is given by taking the former part of the question into consideration, then the answer is connected with the former part of the statement.üîΩThey are also obstructed with regard to their object-field.

original: de dag ni yul la thogs pa dang dmigs pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni yul la thogs pa dang dmigs pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The mind and mental factors are obstructed with regard to their object-field and with regard to their point of mental application.

original: dbang po lnga ni dmigs pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni dmigs pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: The five sense faculties are not obstructed with regard to their object-field,

original: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have an object-field.

original: gang la yid skye bar 'dod pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rten tam dmigs pa gang la yid skye bar 'dod pa la bar chad kyi sgrib pa gzhan dag gis thogs shing mi skye bar byed nus pa de kho na thogs pa dang bcasüîΩpa yin te /
analyzed: gang la yid skye bar 'dod pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rten tam dmigs pa gang la yid skye bar 'dod pa la bar chad kyi sgrib pa gzhan dag gis thogs shing mi skye bar byed nus pa de kho na thogs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: That which is capable of obstructing the arising of mind in relation to a basis or object is said to possess resistance.

original: bar chad kyi sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad kyi sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It possesses resistance because it possesses resistance that is characterized by obstruction to the arising of mind.

original: gzhan dag na re rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It possesses resistance because it possesses resistance that is characterized by obstructing the arising of another object in its own domain.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: dbang po lnga dang yul lnga'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang yul lnga'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: They are the nature of the five sense faculties and the five object-fields.üîΩThe opposite of that is asserted to be nonresistant.

original: bzlog pa ni thogs pa med par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni gang yid skye bar 'dod pa la gzhan dag gis thogs par bya mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni thogs pa med par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni gang yid skye bar 'dod pa la gzhan dag gis thogs par bya mi nus pa ste /
translated: That which is incapable of being obstructed by others in relation to the arising of mind is nonresistant.

original: dper na yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams la yid kyi rnam par @55a * //
analyzed: dper na yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams la yid kyi rnam par @55a * //
translated: For example, the mental element and the phenomena element are not the mental faculty.üîΩ

original: shes pa skye ba la gzhan dag gis bar chad kyi sgrib pa bya bar mi nus pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: shes pa skye ba la gzhan dag gis bar chad kyi sgrib pa bya bar mi nus pa lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, the mental faculty and the entity constituent are not capable of being obstructed by others in the generation of mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir sems kyi khams bdun dang chos kyi khams ni thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi khams bdun dang chos kyi khams ni thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore it is established that the seven mental constituents and the entity constituent are by nature unobstructed.üîΩEight are neutral.

original: lung ma bstan brgyad ces bya ba ni brgyad kyi lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o zhes nges par bzung ba yin te /üîΩdge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir na lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: lung ma bstan brgyad ces bya ba ni brgyad kyi lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o zhes nges par bzung ba yin te / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir na lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: The eight are neutral alone.üîΩThey are neutral because they are not declared to be virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: gang dag dge ba dang mi dge ba ma gtogs pa de dag kho na la lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: gang dag dge ba dang mi dge ba ma gtogs pa de dag kho na la lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar 'dod kyi /
translated: Those that are not declared to be virtuous or nonvirtuous are declared to be neutral.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung du bstan pa'i phyir dge ba yang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid du lung du ma bstan pa ma yin la mi dge ba yang dge ba dang lung
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung du bstan pa'i phyir dge ba yang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid du lung du ma bstan pa ma yin la mi dge ba yang dge ba dang lung
translated: Virtue and nonvirtue are not respectively nonvirtue and neutral states, because they are respectively declared to be virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: du ma bstan pa nyid du lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma bstan pa nyid du lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: Nonvirtue is not virtuous or neutral, because it is declared to be nonvirtue.

original: sgra 'jug pa ni brdar btags pa la 'jug pa yin no //üîΩgzhan rnams gsum zhes bya ba ni khams zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /üîΩgzhan dag ni rnam pa gsum kho na yin gyi rnam pa gcig kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa ni brdar btags pa la 'jug pa yin no // gzhan rnams gsum zhes bya ba ni khams zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te / gzhan dag ni rnam pa gsum kho na yin gyi rnam pa gcig kyang ma yin la /
translated: The usage of terms is based on conventional designation.üîΩThe others are three.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyang ma yin no zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyang ma yin no zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: The others are only three types, they are not one type and they are not two types.üîΩThis is a definitive statement.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni dge ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems kyi khams bdun ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang /
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni dge ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems kyi khams bdun ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang /
translated: The seven mental elements that are concomitant with nonattachment alobha, nonaversion advesa, nonignorance amoha, shame hrƒ´,üîΩembarrassment apatrƒÅpya,

original: khrel yod pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: khrel yod pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni dge ba yin no //
translated: and the two roots of virtue are virtuous.üîΩThose that are concomitant with attachment raga, aversion dvesa, ignorance moha, shamelessness ahrikya,

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dag mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dag mi dge ba yin no //
translated: and lack of embarrassment anapatrƒÅpya are nonvirtuous.

original: smad pa las 'das shing ngan song las rgal bas na dge ba'o //
analyzed: smad pa las 'das shing ngan song las rgal bas na dge ba'o //
translated: They are virtuous because they transcend blame and transcend the lower realms.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na shes rab ni rtsva ku sha dang 'dra bar rno bas ku sha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na shes rab ni rtsva ku sha dang 'dra bar rno bas ku sha zhes bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, wisdom is called kusha because it is sharp like kusha grass.

original: de len cing kun tu len pas na dge ba'o //
analyzed: de len cing kun tu len pas na dge ba'o //
translated: They are virtuous because they take and fully take that.

original: gzhan ma chags pa la sogs pa dang chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma chags pa la sogs pa dang chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The other elements, which are not associated with nonattachment and so on, are neutral.

original: chos kyi khams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ma chags pa la sogs @55b pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gang 'di bshad zin pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi khams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ma chags pa la sogs @55b pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gang 'di bshad zin pa yin no //
translated: The dharmadhƒÅtu is explained in detail: The nature of nonattachment and so on has already been explained.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni tshor ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni tshor ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Those associated with nonattachment and so on are feeling and so on.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa kun nas bslang ba ni thob pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa kun nas bslang ba ni thob pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yin no //
translated: Those motivated by nonattachment and so on are obtainment, the primary elements, and so on, nonindicative form, and so forth.

original: gzhan ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin te chos kyi khams rnam pa bzhi ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin te chos kyi khams rnam pa bzhi ni dge ba yin no //
translated: The other is analytical cessation. The four types of the phenomena element are virtuous.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: Those that are the nature of attachment and so on, those associated with attachment and so on, and those motivated by attachment and so on are nonvirtuous.

original: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ma chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas bslang ba yang ma yin pa dang / nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang ci rigs par de dag gis thob pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ma chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas bslang ba yang ma yin pa dang / nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang ci rigs par de dag gis thob pa dang /
translated: The other is neutral.

original: skye ba la sogs pa yin te chos kyi khams 'di ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa yin te chos kyi khams 'di ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The other is neutral means that the phenomena element is neutral because it is not by nature nonattachment and so on, nor is it concomitant with nonattachment and so on, nor is it motivated by nonattachment and so on, nor is it space or nonanalytical cessation, nor is it the obtainment of those or their birth and so on.üîΩThe other is neutral.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i gzugs dang sgra'i khams de dag las gzhan pa lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i gzugs dang
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i gzugs dang sgra'i khams de dag las gzhan pa lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i gzugs dang
translated: The other is neutral means that the form and sound elements motivated by virtuous and nonvirtuous minds are neutral when motivated by neutral minds.

original: sgra'i khams lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa dag dang rnam par rig byed kyis ma bsdus pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i khams lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa dag dang rnam par rig byed kyis ma bsdus pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The sound element that is included in the informative form of body and speech and that which is not included in informative form is neutral.

original: 'dod khams gtogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: 'dod khams gtogs pa thams cad do //
translated: All are included in the desire realm.

original: zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad tsam gyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung gi re res thams cad bsdus pa ni ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir / gzugs kyi khams na bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad tsam gyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung gi re res thams cad bsdus pa ni ma yin no // de'i phyir / gzugs kyi khams na bcu bzhi'o //
translated: This means that all are included in the desire realm alone because they are included in the eighteen elements alone. It is ascertained that way, but each one does not include all.üîΩTherefore it says,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In the form realm, there are fourteen.üîΩBecause those two are oral food,

original: de gnyis ni kham gyi zas yin pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba ni dri dang ro de gnyis te dri yang kham gyi zas phra mo yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni kham gyi zas yin pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba ni dri dang ro de gnyis te dri yang kham gyi zas phra mo yin no //
translated: those two are smell and taste. Smell is also subtle oral food.

original: de lta na ni 'o na reg bya'i khams kyang med par thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni kham gyi zas yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams 'di na reg bya'i khams med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na reg bya'i khams kyang med par thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni kham gyi zas yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams 'di na reg bya'i khams med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that the element of tactility would not exist there, because it is oral food.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa na //
analyzed: kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa na //
translated: Oral food exists in the desire realm.

original: skye mched gsum gyi bdag @56a * //üîΩnyid do // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched gsum gyi bdag @56a * // nyid do // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It has the nature of three bases.

original: dri dang ro dag kyang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang dag zas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag de na yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dri dang ro dag kyang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang dag zas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag de na yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It follows that smell and taste would also not exist there, because they are not the nature of food.

original: reg bya yod du bcug kyang zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: reg bya yod du bcug kyang zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: Even if you allow that tactility exists there,

original: longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod pa ste /
translated: it is experienced as

original: dbang po'i rten gyi dngos po dang gzhi'i dngos po dang bgo ba'i dngos por ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i rten gyi dngos po dang gzhi'i dngos po dang bgo ba'i dngos por ro //
translated: a basis of the sense faculties, a basis of the body, and clothing.

original: gzhan dag na re ni zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len to //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len to //
translated: Bhadanta ≈örƒ´lƒÅta says:

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa dang lhan cig skyes te /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa dang lhan cig skyes te /
translated: ‚ÄúAccompanied by pliancy‚Äù means that pliancy is generated simultaneously with it.

original: lus las su rung ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus las su rung ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúAccompanied by physical pliancy‚Äù means that physical pliancy is generated simultaneously with it.

original: 'dir slob dpon gyi btsun pa dpal lan gyi gzhung lugs khyad du bsad de /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyi btsun pa dpal lan gyi gzhung lugs khyad du bsad de /
translated: Here, the master Bhadanta ≈örƒ´lƒÅta‚Äôs system is disregarded.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs glags dang bcas par mthong nas rnam par gtan la dbab pa brtsam pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs glags dang bcas par mthong nas rnam par gtan la dbab pa brtsam pa'i phyir /
translated: Seeing that the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika system is flawed, he composed this ascertainment.

original: de ltar na ni 'o na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /üîΩbye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis ni shugs kyis ni 'di skad du gzugs kyi khams na dri dang ro dag med de /
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'o na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te / bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis ni shugs kyis ni 'di skad du gzugs kyi khams na dri dang ro dag med de /
translated: If that is so, then, he says, ‚Äúit is not so.‚Äù

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir pho'i dbang po bzhin no zhes bya ba dam bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir pho'i dbang po bzhin no zhes bya ba dam bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas implicitly assert that smell and taste do not exist in the form realm because they are like the male organ, which has no purpose there.

original: phyogs der slob dpon sun 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: phyogs der slob dpon sun 'byin par byed de /
translated: The master refutes that position.

original: phyogs 'di ni chos can gyi khyad par las bzlogs pas skyon chags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon can yin no //
analyzed: phyogs 'di ni chos can gyi khyad par las bzlogs pas skyon chags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon can yin no //
translated: This is a fault because this position is characterized by the reversal of the distinction of the subject, and so it is faulty.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi dri dang ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi dri dang ro //
translated: Smell and taste do not exist in the form realm.

original: zhes bya ba rang 'dzin par byed pa yod pa can ni chos can yin par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rang 'dzin par byed pa yod pa can ni chos can yin par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If you assert that the subject is that which has the capacity to apprehend its own self,

original: de rang 'dzin par byed pa med pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rang 'dzin par byed pa med pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then it would follow that it would not have the capacity to apprehend its own self.

original: dper na pho dang mo'i dbang po dgos pa med pa nyid kyis rang 'dzin par byed pa med pa can dag yin pa ltar dri dang ro zhes bya ba'i yul can yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na pho dang mo'i dbang po dgos pa med pa nyid kyis rang 'dzin par byed pa med pa can dag yin pa ltar dri dang ro zhes bya ba'i yul can yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the male and female faculties are without the capacity to apprehend their own selves because they are without purpose, so too would the objects called smell and taste.

original: gang gis na chos can las bzlog pa 'di gsal bar 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa yang gsal bar yod de /
analyzed: gang gis na chos can las bzlog pa 'di gsal bar 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa yang gsal bar yod de /
translated: The inference that clarifies this reversal of the subject is also clear:

original: gzugs kyi khams na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag med de /
translated: The nose and tongue faculties do not exist in the form realm

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir pho dang mo'i dbang po bzhin no //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir pho dang mo'i dbang po bzhin no //
translated: because they are without purpose, like the male and female faculties.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs pa 'ga' zhig gis lan gdab pa'i phyir dgos pa yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs pa 'ga' zhig gis lan gdab pa'i phyir dgos pa yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Some VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas reply: There is a purpose, because the nose and tongue sense faculties are needed to beautify the body and to express speech.üîΩIf the nose and tongue sense faculties did not exist, the body would not be beautified and verbal expression would not occur.

original: sna dang lce'i dbang po @56b de dag med par ni rten mdzes pa nyid dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed du yang mi 'gyur te mthong bas gnod pa 'dis ni thal bar 'gyur ba zlog par byed de /
analyzed: sna dang lce'i dbang po @56b de dag med par ni rten mdzes pa nyid dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed du yang mi 'gyur te mthong bas gnod pa 'dis ni thal bar 'gyur ba zlog par byed de /
translated: This is a consequence that contradicts what is seen.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa la mthong bas gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa la mthong bas gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, inference is contradicted by what is seen.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gzugs kyi khams na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag yod de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag yod de /
translated: The nose and tongue sense faculties exist in the form realm.

original: dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po bzhin no //
analyzed: dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po bzhin no //
translated: Because they have a purpose, they are like the eye sense faculty.

original: slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis /
translated: Vasubandhu says:

original: gal te dgos pa der zad na //üîΩzhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: gal te dgos pa der zad na //üîΩzhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: If that is the only purpose,üîΩthen the nose and tongue sense faculties would not exist in the formless realm.

original: rten kho na sa lus mdzes pa dang tshig smra bar 'gyur gyi dbang pos ni ma yin pas dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: rten kho na sa lus mdzes pa dang tshig smra bar 'gyur gyi dbang pos ni ma yin pas dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: Since the basis alone is the beautiful body and the speaker of words, not the sense faculty, he demonstrates that the reason ‚Äúbecause it has a purpose‚Äù is not established.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs pa zhig gis dbang po med pa'i rten mi srid de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs pa zhig gis dbang po med pa'i rten mi srid de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: A VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says, ‚ÄúIt is impossible for a basis to exist without a sense faculty,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzugs kyi khams na dbang po med pa'i sna dang lce'i dbang po'i rten mi srid de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na dbang po med pa'i sna dang lce'i dbang po'i rten mi srid de /
translated: In the form realm, it is impossible for a basis of the nose and tongue sense faculties to exist without a sense faculty.

original: rten yin pa'i phyir pho'i dbang po'i rten bzhin no //
analyzed: rten yin pa'i phyir pho'i dbang po'i rten bzhin no //
translated: Because it is a basis, like the basis of the male faculty.

original: 'dis ni dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pa nyid du 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pa nyid du 'jog par byed do //
translated: This establishes that it has a purpose.

original: slob dpon gyis de ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir mi srid par rigs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir mi srid par rigs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The Master says, ‚ÄúIt is logical that it is impossible because it has no purpose,‚Äù and so on.

original: pho'i dbang po'i rten de ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir mi srid par rigs kyi sna dang lce'i dbang po'i rten ni lus mdzes par bya ba dang mngon par brjod par dgos pa'i phyir dgos pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: pho'i dbang po'i rten de ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir mi srid par rigs kyi sna dang lce'i dbang po'i rten ni lus mdzes par bya ba dang mngon par brjod par dgos pa'i phyir dgos pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable that the support of the male organ is impossible because it is useless. But the support of the nose and tongue organs is useful for beautifying the body and for speech.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni dbang po med par yang srid par rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni dbang po med par yang srid par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that these two organs can exist without the other two organs.

original: 'dir sgrub pa yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir sgrub pa yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, we must also state the proof.

original: gzugs kyi khams na dbang po med pa'i sna dang lce'i dbang po'i rten srid de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na dbang po med pa'i sna dang lce'i dbang po'i rten srid de /
translated: In the form realm, the support of the nose and tongue organs exists without the organs,

original: dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po'i rten bzhin no //
analyzed: dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po'i rten bzhin no //
translated: because it is useful, like the support of the eye organ.

original: 'dis ni dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid ma grub pa de nyid rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid ma grub pa de nyid rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: This establishes that the usefulness of the nose and tongue organs is not established.

original: de ltar 'dir bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs pa dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid du smra ba 'ga' zhig bkag pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis de lta na ni 'o na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag kyang med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs pa dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid du smra ba 'ga' zhig bkag pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis de lta na ni 'o na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag kyang med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that the nose and tongue sense faculties do not exist there because they have no purpose,

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir dgos pa med par yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /üîΩdper na mngal @57a * //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir dgos pa med par yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te / dper na mngal @57a * //
translated: this is a mere semblance of refutation because it is said that they exist even though they have no purpose.

original: du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi dbang po dgos pa med par mngon par 'grub pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi dbang po dgos pa med par mngon par 'grub pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the sense faculties of those who die in the womb are formed even though they have no purpose.

original: de dag gis ni gzugs mthong ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ni gzugs mthong ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not see form and so on.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams na dgos pa med kyang sna dang lce'i dbang po mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams na dgos pa med kyang sna dang lce'i dbang po mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the nose and tongue sense faculties are formed in the form realm even though they have no purpose.

original: 'dis ni gzugs kyi khams na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag med de /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs kyi khams na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag med de /
translated: This shows that the nose and tongue sense faculties do not exist in the form realm.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir pho'i dbang po bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dgos pa med pa nyid ma nges pa yin par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir pho'i dbang po bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dgos pa med pa nyid ma nges pa yin par rab tu ston to //
translated: because it has no purpose, like the male faculty.

original: slob dpon gyi dgos pa med pa ni yin mod kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dgos pa med pa ni yin mod kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: But the Master says: ‚ÄúGranted that it has no purpose,‚Äù etc.

original: dgos pa med par dbang po grub pa ni yin mod kyi 'dus byas rnams ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa med par dbang po grub pa ni yin mod kyi 'dus byas rnams ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: Granted that it has no purpose, but it is not without a cause, because conditioned dharmas have causes.

original: gang yang yul las srid pa dang bral ba de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po las kyang sred pa dang bral ba yin te zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu med par rab tu ston par byed do //
analyzed: gang yang yul las srid pa dang bral ba de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po las kyang sred pa dang bral ba yin te zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu med par rab tu ston par byed do //
translated: And, ‚ÄúWhoever is free from craving for objects is certainly free from craving for faculties,‚Äù this shows that it is without a cause.

original: de'i phyir sgrub pa ni 'di skad du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub pa ni 'di skad du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the proof should be stated in this way:

original: gzugs kyi khams na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag med de /
translated: In the form realm, there are no nose and tongue faculties,

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir rgyu med pa'i myu gu bzhin nam pho'i dbang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir rgyu med pa'i myu gu bzhin nam pho'i dbang po lta bu'o //
translated: because they have no cause, like a sprout without a cause, or like the male faculty.

original: yang na pho'i dbang po yang ci ste 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni slob dpon nyid rnam par rtog pa slong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na pho'i dbang po yang ci ste 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni slob dpon nyid rnam par rtog pa slong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The Master himself raises the doubt.

original: bsam pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the intention?

original: gal te dgos pa med pa dang rgyu med par yang sna dang lce'i dbang po dag 'byung na ni pho'i dbang po yang ci ste 'grub par mi 'gyur snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dgos pa med pa dang rgyu med par yang sna dang lce'i dbang po dag 'byung na ni pho'i dbang po yang ci ste 'grub par mi 'gyur snyam pa yin no //
translated: If the nose and tongue sense faculties arise without a need and without a cause, why is the male organ not formed?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi phyogs ni gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can gyi rgyud ni sna dang lce'i dbang pho dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi phyogs ni gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can gyi rgyud ni sna dang lce'i dbang pho dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position is that the mindstreams of sentient beings in the form realm possess nose and tongue sense faculties

original: gzugs can yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can gyi rgyud bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can gyi rgyud bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: because they possess form, like the mindstreams of sentient beings in the desire realm.

original: slob dpon ni pho'i dbang po yang ci ste grub par mi 'gyur zhes zer te 'dis ni phyogs te chos can gyi khyad par las bzlog pa yin par ston par byed de /
analyzed: slob dpon ni pho'i dbang po yang ci ste grub par mi 'gyur zhes zer te 'dis ni phyogs te chos can gyi khyad par las bzlog pa yin par ston par byed de /
translated: The Master says, ‚ÄúOr else, why is the male organ not formed?‚Äù This shows that the position is reversed, that is, the subject is reversed.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can gyi rgyud pho'i dbang po med pa can ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can gyi rgyud pho'i dbang po med pa can ni chos can yin la /
translated: Beings of the form realm who do not possess the male faculty are the subject.

original: de las bzlog pa ni pho'i dbang po yod pa can nyid yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni pho'i dbang po yod pa can nyid yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is the possession of the male faculty.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis lan gdab pa'i phyir @57b mi mdzes pa byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis lan gdab pa'i phyir @57b mi mdzes pa byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: To respond to that, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say, ‚ÄúBecause it is ugly.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni pho'i dbang po med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni pho'i dbang po med de /
translated: The male faculty does not exist in the form realm

original: mi mdzes par byed pa'i phyir zhar ba dang zha bo bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mdzes par byed pa'i phyir zhar ba dang zha bo bzhin no //
translated: because it is ugly, like a hunchback or a dwarf.üîΩThis inference is invalidated by our own position,

original: rjes su dpag pa de la gnod dang / kho bo cag gi dam bcas pa 'di bzlog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de la gnod dang / kho bo cag gi dam bcas pa 'di bzlog pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is not the case that our thesis is refuted.

original: rigs pa can gyi grub pa'i mtha' las kyang /üîΩgal te mthong bas mi gnod na //
analyzed: rigs pa can gyi grub pa'i mtha' las kyang / gal te mthong bas mi gnod na //
translated: Even in the NyƒÅya philosophical school,üîΩit says, ‚ÄúIf it is not invalidated by seeing,

original: zhes bya ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: it is not invalidated by inference.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa rnams kyi ci'i phyir mi mdzes par 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa rnams kyi ci'i phyir mi mdzes par 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Master says, ‚ÄúWhy is it ugly for those whose genitals are concealed?‚Äù

original: mdoms su spa ba ni mdoms kyi sba ba'o //
analyzed: mdoms su spa ba ni mdoms kyi sba ba'o //
translated: The sheathed genitals are the sheathed penis.

original: mdoms ni gang gis ni pho'i dbang po dkris pa yin no //
analyzed: mdoms ni gang gis ni pho'i dbang po dkris pa yin no //
translated: The penis is that by which the male organ is covered.

original: sba ba ni pho'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: sba ba ni pho'i dbang po'o //
translated: The sheath is the male organ.

original: sbubs ni gang du mdoms kyi sba ba de gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sbubs ni gang du mdoms kyi sba ba de gnas pa'o //
translated: The sheath is that in which the sheathed penis is located.

original: gang dag la mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa de yod pa de dag ni mdoms kyis ba ba sbubs su nub pa rnams te de dag gi ci ste mi mdzes par 'gyur mdzes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang dag la mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa de yod pa de dag ni mdoms kyis ba ba sbubs su nub pa rnams te de dag gi ci ste mi mdzes par 'gyur mdzes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who have a sheathed penis are those who have a penis that is sheathed. What is the problem if they have a sheathed penis? It is only a good thing.

original: 'dis ni mi mdzes par byed pa nyid ma grub par ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi mdzes par byed pa nyid ma grub par ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that the argument that the Buddha has a sheathed penis is not established.

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni //
translated: It is not that the Buddha has a sheathed penis because it is a useful organ.

original: bye brag tu smra ba mi mdzes par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes smra ba rnams kyis ni don gyi shugs kyis na 'di skad du pho'i dbang po ni dgos pa'i dbang gis bskyed par bya ba yin no zhes dam bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba mi mdzes par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes smra ba rnams kyis ni don gyi shugs kyis na 'di skad du pho'i dbang po ni dgos pa'i dbang gis bskyed par bya ba yin no zhes dam bcas pa yin no //
translated: But by the force of the meaning, they are committed to the assertion that the male faculty is generated by the power of need.

original: de yang rjes su dpags pas phyogs su mi rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpags pas phyogs su mi rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: That is illogical because it is illogical to infer that

original: chos can gyi ngo bo nyid las bzlog pas skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can gyi ngo bo nyid las bzlog pas skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is faulty because it contradicts the nature of the subject.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: smras pa / pho'i dbang po ni dgos pa'i dbang gis bskyed par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / pho'i dbang po ni dgos pa'i dbang gis bskyed par bya ba yin la /
translated: They say: The male faculty is generated by the power of need

original: rang gi rgyus bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi rgyus bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is generated by its own cause.

original: zhar ba dang zha bo bzhin no //
analyzed: zhar ba dang zha bo bzhin no //
translated: It is like a blind person or a cripple.üîΩVaibhasikas say: Then it contradicts the sutra that states:

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis 'o na ni mdo las dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin zhing med pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis 'o na ni mdo las dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin zhing med pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: They are not incomplete and they are not lacking faculties.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can gyi rgyud ni sna dang lce'i dbang po med pa can yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni phyogs yin no //üîΩphyogs de ni phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir skyon @58a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can gyi rgyud ni sna dang lce'i dbang po med pa can yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni phyogs yin no // phyogs de ni phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir skyon @58a * //
translated: The position is that the mindstreams of sentient beings in the form realm lack nose and tongue sense faculties.

original: dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: This position is flawed because it contradicts the prior position.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn stated:

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ni gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can rnams dbang po ma tshang ba med cing med pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ni gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can rnams dbang po ma tshang ba med cing med pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The sentient beings who experience the form realm are not incomplete and they are not lacking.

original: dbang po ma tshang ba med pa ni zhar ba dang zha bo la sogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang ba med pa ni zhar ba dang zha bo la sogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not incomplete because they do not have such physical defects as blindness and lameness.

original: med pa ma yin pa ni mig la sogs pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ma yin pa ni mig la sogs pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not lacking because they are not lacking eyes and so on.

original: slob dpon gyis de ni dbang po gang dag srid pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de ni dbang po gang dag srid pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Vasubandhu says, Those faculties that are possible.

original: mdo'i don gzugs kyi khams de na sna dang lce'i dbang po ma gtogs pa'i mig la sogs pa gang dag srid pa de dag gis dbang po med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo'i don gzugs kyi khams de na sna dang lce'i dbang po ma gtogs pa'i mig la sogs pa gang dag srid pa de dag gis dbang po med pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is that the form realm is not devoid of eyes and so on, which are possible there, except for the nose and tongue faculties.

original: zhes bya bar bzung ba'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: zhes bya bar bzung ba'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction.

original: 'di skad du brjod do zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu sma ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'di skad du brjod do zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu sma ba rnams so //
translated: This is what they say:

original: yod pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzugs kyi khams de na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag ni yod pa nyid kyi dri dang ro dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzugs kyi khams de na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag ni yod pa nyid kyi dri dang ro dag ni ma yin no //
