translated: The Vaibhasikas say: The nose and tongue faculties exist in the form realm, but smell and taste do not.

original: sems can rnams ni lus kyi sgo ste rang gi rgyud kyi sgo nas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched drug la sred pa kun tu sbyor cing 'byung la /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni lus kyi sgo ste rang gi rgyud kyi sgo nas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched drug la sred pa kun tu sbyor cing 'byung la /
translated: Beings are attached to the six sense bases such as the eyes through their body and their continuum.

original: las kyang des mngon par brlan pa yin pas gzugs kyi khams kyi sna dang lce'i dbang po dag ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: las kyang des mngon par brlan pa yin pas gzugs kyi khams kyi sna dang lce'i dbang po dag ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Since karma is moistened by that attachment, the nose and tongue faculties of the form realm have a cause.

original: de bas na rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams na 'di dag yod pa kho na ste rgyu dang bcas pa'i myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams na 'di dag yod pa kho na ste rgyu dang bcas pa'i myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, they exist in the realm of form, because they have a cause, like the sprout, etc.

original: 'dis ni gzugs kyi khams na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag med de /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs kyi khams na sna dang lce'i dbang po dag med de /
translated: This shows that the argument that the nose and tongue organs do not exist in the realm of form,

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes sgrub pa smras pa gang yin pa de ma grub po zhes bya bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes sgrub pa smras pa gang yin pa de ma grub po zhes bya bar ston par byed do //
translated: because they have no cause, is not established.

original: pho'i dbang po ni 'khrig pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: pho'i dbang po ni 'khrig pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: The male organ is the cause of sexual intercourse.

original: ci zhe na srid pa kun tu spyod ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci zhe na srid pa kun tu spyod ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: What is the cause? The cause of the experience of existence.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can rnams ni 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can rnams ni 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
translated: The sentient beings who experience the realm of form are free from the passion of sexual intercourse.

original: de lta bas na de la srid pa sngon du 'gro ba'i las med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de la srid pa sngon du 'gro ba'i las med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no action preceded by the experience of existence in that realm.

original: de lta bas na rgyu med pa'i phyir de na pho'i dbang po med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu med pa'i phyir de na pho'i dbang po med de /
translated: Therefore, the male organ does not exist there, because it has no cause.

original: rgyu med pa'i myu gu la sogs pa lta bu yin pas gzugs kyi khams na khams bcu bzhi'o zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i myu gu la sogs pa lta bu yin pas gzugs kyi khams na khams bcu bzhi'o zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is established that there are fourteen elements in the form realm.

original: gzugs med gtogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs med gtogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The formless realm is only

original: yid dang ni /
analyzed: yid dang ni /
translated: the mind element,üîΩthe entity element,

original: chos dang yid kyi rnam shes khams //
analyzed: chos dang yid kyi rnam shes khams //
translated: and the mind-consciousness element.

original: @58b dag kho na gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ba'i phyir khams gzhan dag ni med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: @58b dag kho na gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ba'i phyir khams gzhan dag ni med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The formless realm is definitely only those three elements because the other elements do not exist there.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skye ba de'i phyir de na gzugs can gyi rang bzhin gyi khams bcu po mig la sogs pa lnga dang gzugs la sogs pa lnga yang med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skye ba de'i phyir de na gzugs can gyi rang bzhin gyi khams bcu po mig la sogs pa lnga dang gzugs la sogs pa lnga yang med do //
translated: Since those who are free of attachment to form are born there, the ten elements that are the nature of form, the five such as the eyes and the five such as form, do not exist there.

original: de dag la brten pa dang dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yang med do zhes bya ba ni gang dag la go rims bzhin du rten dang dmigs pa mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa de dag yod pa de dag ni de dag laüîΩbrten pa dang dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag la brten pa dang dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yang med do zhes bya ba ni gang dag la go rims bzhin du rten dang dmigs pa mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa de dag yod pa de dag ni de dag la brten pa dang dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Those that exist in the order in which they are stated as the support and object of the eye, etc., and form, etc., are the elements that are supported by and focus on those.

original: de na dmigs pa la sogs pa rten rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams med pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i khams de dag kyang med do //üîΩde gsum zag bcas zag pa med //
analyzed: de na dmigs pa la sogs pa rten rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams med pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i khams de dag kyang med do // de gsum zag bcas zag pa med //
translated: Since the support, such as the eye, and the object, such as form, do not exist there, the elements of consciousness such as eye consciousness also do not exist there.üîΩThe three are contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: ces bya ba ni 'di gsum kho na zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin no zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'di gsum kho na zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin no zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: This passage determines that only these three are contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: lhag ma rnams ni zag bcas so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni zag bcas so //
translated: The remainder are contaminated.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ci'i phyir brjod /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ci'i phyir brjod /
translated: Why is this stated?

original: 'di gsum kho na zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin no zhes nges par bzung bas lhag ma rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa ma yin nam zhe na ma grub bo //
analyzed: 'di gsum kho na zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin no zhes nges par bzung bas lhag ma rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa ma yin nam zhe na ma grub bo //
translated: The remaining ones are not established as being with-outflows.

original: ji lta zhe na lhag ma rnams zag pa dang bcas pa kho na zhig yin nam zag pa med pa kho na zhig yin snyam du the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na lhag ma rnams zag pa dang bcas pa kho na zhig yin nam zag pa med pa kho na zhig yin snyam du the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How is that? One would doubt whether the remaining ones are only with-outflows or only without-outflows.

original: de dag bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to eliminate that doubt,

original: lhag ma rnams ni zag bcas so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni zag bcas so //
translated: the remaining ones are with-outflows.

original: zhes bya ba 'di brjod do //üîΩrtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di brjod do // rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa ni //
translated: This is stated.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yin //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yin //
translated: The five consciousnesses are with initial and sustained thought.

original: zhes bya ba la ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa kho na'o zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa kho na'o zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in ‚Äúwith initial and sustained thought only‚Äù is a definite article.

original: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo //
translated: The last three are of three kinds.

original: zhes bya ba ni tha ma dag kho na rnam pa gsum mo zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tha ma dag kho na rnam pa gsum mo zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in ‚Äúthe last three are of three kinds‚Äù is a definite article.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni chos kyi khams mtshungs pa dang ldan pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni chos kyi khams mtshungs pa dang ldan pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: Other than investigation and analysis means that investigation and analysis are the nature of the phenomena element that is concomitant with the mind.

original: de gnyis 'dir bsdus par thal bar 'gyur bas yongs su spang @59a * //
analyzed: de gnyis 'dir bsdus par thal bar 'gyur bas yongs su spang @59a * //
translated: Since it would follow that those two are included here, they must be excluded.

original: bar bya'o // rtog pa ni rnam pa gzhan gnyis pa'i nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar bya'o // rtog pa ni rnam pa gzhan gnyis pa'i nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Investigation is included in the other two types.

original: dpyod pa yang bsam gtan khyad par can las skyes pa ni rnam pa gsum pa'i nang du 'du'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa yang bsam gtan khyad par can las skyes pa ni rnam pa gsum pa'i nang du 'du'o //
translated: Analysis that arises in the special meditative stabilization is included in the third type.

original: de las gzhan pa ni rnam pa gsum char gyi nang du yang mi 'du'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni rnam pa gsum char gyi nang du yang mi 'du'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is explained that analysis that is other than that is not included in any of the three types.

original: yid kyi khams la sogs pa chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa la thug pa'i bar 'di dag 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi nyer bsdogs dang bcas pa na ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag yin te rtog pa dang
analyzed: yid kyi khams la sogs pa chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa la thug pa'i bar 'di dag 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i dngos gzhi nyer bsdogs dang bcas pa na ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag yin te rtog pa dang
translated: These elements from the mind element up to the phenomena element that is concomitant with the mind are associated with investigation and analysis in the desire realm and in the actual basis of the first absorption and its access concentration.

original: dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with investigation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan khyad par can na ni rtog pa med pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa yin la dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dpyod pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan khyad par can na ni rtog pa med pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa yin la dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dpyod pa tsam yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the special meditative development, there is no investigation because there is no thought, but there is mere investigation because it is associated with investigation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnyis pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnyis pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Therefore, from the second meditative concentration onwards,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi ni rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi ni rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa yin no //
translated: up to the summit of existence, there is neither investigation nor analysis.

original: chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par khams gsum pa'i gzugs dang sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang 'dus ma byas rnams so //üîΩbsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par khams gsum pa'i gzugs dang sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang 'dus ma byas rnams so // bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa ni /
translated: The entire element of mental objects which is not associated with the mind refers to the form element, the non-associated formative forces and the unconditioned factors of the three realms, as is appropriate.

original: rtog pa med pa'i phyir rtog pa yang med la /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i phyir rtog pa yang med la /
translated: The investigation in the special meditative concentration is not investigation because there is no thought.

original: dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dpyod pa yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dpyod pa yang med pa yin no //
translated: It is not analysis because there is no second analysis.

original: dpyod pa rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gi nang du mi 'du na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dpyod pa ni re zhig rnam pa dang po rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i nang duüîΩni mi 'du ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gi nang du mi 'du na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dpyod pa ni re zhig rnam pa dang po rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i nang du ni mi 'du ste /
translated: If it is not included in these three types of investigation, then investigation of the desire realm and the level of the first absorption is not included in the first type called investigation with investigation and analysis.üîΩüîΩ

original: de ni rtog pa dang bcas pa yin mod kyi dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin te /üîΩdpyod pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnyis pa rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam zhes bya ba'i nang du yang mi 'du ste rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgsum pa rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med ces bya ba'i nang du yang mi 'du ste /
analyzed: de ni rtog pa dang bcas pa yin mod kyi dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin te / dpyod pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro // gnyis pa rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam zhes bya ba'i nang du yang mi 'du ste rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro // gsum pa rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med ces bya ba'i nang du yang mi 'du ste /
translated: If it is not included in these three types of investigation, then investigation of the desire realm and the level of the first absorption is not included in the first type, which is called investigation with investigation and analysis.üîΩIt is not included in the second type, which is called without investigation but with analysis, because it is concomitant with investigation.

original: de ni dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: It is not included in the third type, which is called without investigation and without analysis, because it is concomitant with investigation and because there is no second type of investigation.

original: dpyod pa med pa yin mod kyi rtog pa med pa ni ma yin @59b te /
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa yin mod kyi rtog pa med pa ni ma yin @59b te /
translated: It is true that it is without investigation, but it is not without conception.

original: rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is associated with conception.

original: de ci skad du brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci skad du brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is it called?

original: de'i phyir dpyod pa med cing rtog pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpyod pa med cing rtog pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be without investigation and only with conception.

original: dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dpyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dpyod pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without investigation because it lacks a second investigation.

original: rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rtog pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rtog pa tsam mo //
translated: It is only with conception because it is associated with conception.üîΩFor that very reason, means because on the level with investigation and analysis, there is only conception without investigation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa na dpyod pa med cing rtog pa tsam zhes bya ba dpyod pa de lta bu ni rnam pa bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa na dpyod pa med cing rtog pa tsam zhes bya ba dpyod pa de lta bu ni rnam pa bzhi pa yin no //
translated: Such investigation is the fourth type.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gnyi ga spangs zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ni ma bshad pa gzugs can gyi khams bcu yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gnyi ga spangs zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ni ma bshad pa gzugs can gyi khams bcu yin no //
translated: The rest are both abandoned, means the rest are the ten physical elements that have not been explained.

original: de dag rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam zhig gam rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa zhig yin snyam du the tshom za bas lhag ma rnams ni gnyi ga spangs pa kho na'o zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam zhig gam rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa zhig yin snyam du the tshom za bas lhag ma rnams ni gnyi ga spangs pa kho na'o zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
translated: Since they doubt whether those are non-conception and mere analysis or non-conception and non-analysis, they ascertain that the remaining meditative attainments are only both abandoned.

original: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩji ltar na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya zhes na zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi /
analyzed: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ji ltar na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya zhes na zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi /
translated: This means that they are only non-conception and non-analysis.üîΩHow are they called non-conception?

original: sngon po'o snyam du ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po'o snyam du ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is said that one knows blue through possessing eye consciousness, but one does not think ‚Äúblue.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes grag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes grag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said that conception is of three types.

original: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs rjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs rjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúsaid‚Äù indicates that this is the system of others.

original: rang gi bsams pa ni sems pa dang shes rab kyi khyad par yin pas ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa chos gzhan ni med do snyam pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bsams pa ni sems pa dang shes rab kyi khyad par yin pas ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa chos gzhan ni med do snyam pa yin te /
translated: I think that since intention and wisdom are the specific mental factors, there is no other mental factor called conception.

original: 'di ltar 'dis phung po ltan pa las rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dis phung po ltan pa las rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: Thus, what is conception?

original: kun tu rtsol ba yid kyi brjod pa de sems pa dang shes rab kyi khyad par gnag sems rting ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu rtsol ba yid kyi brjod pa de sems pa dang shes rab kyi khyad par gnag sems rting ba'o //
translated: It is the mental expression of thorough seeking, which is a specific type of intention and wisdom.

original: dpyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dpyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is discernment?üîΩIt is the mental expression of discernment, which is a specific type of intention and wisdom.

original: so sor rtog pa yid kyi brjod pa ste sems pa dang shes rab kyi khyad par de bzhin du gang sems zhi ba ba'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa yid kyi brjod pa ste sems pa dang shes rab kyi khyad par de bzhin du gang sems zhi ba ba'o zhes bshad de /
translated: It is the pacification of the mind.

original: gtan la mi 'bebs pa'i gnas skabs na ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: gtan la mi 'bebs pa'i gnas skabs na ni sems pa'o //
translated: When it is in a state of non ascertainment, it is intention.

original: gtan la 'bebs pa'i gnas skabs na ni shes rab bo zhes rnam par gzhag go /
analyzed: gtan la 'bebs pa'i gnas skabs na ni shes rab bo zhes rnam par gzhag go /
translated: When it is in a state of ascertainment, it is wisdom.

original: // / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: // / bam po drug pa /
translated: The five facultiesüîΩThe five faculties are faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de bas na de dag la ngo bo nyid kyi rtog pa yod kyi zhes bya ba la de bas na zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad dam de lta bas na zhes bya ba'i don yin no //üîΩngo bo nyid kho @60a * //
analyzed: de bas na de dag la ngo bo nyid kyi rtog pa yod kyi zhes bya ba la de bas na zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad dam de lta bas na zhes bya ba'i don yin no // ngo bo nyid kho @60a * //
translated: Therefore means by way of a verbal particle or it has the meaning of ‚Äúin that way.‚Äù

original: nas rnam par rtog pa rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: nas rnam par rtog pa rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni rtog pa yin no //
translated: Conceptualization by way of own-nature is conceptualization because it is the characteristic of gross conceptualization by way of own-nature.

original: de rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po 'di rnams la mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas yod de de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po 'di rnams la mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas yod de de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: It exists in the five collections of consciousness by way of association. Therefore, they are said to be with conceptualization.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag med de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag med de /
translated: Others are not because they do not have the conceptualization of determination and memory.

original: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be without conceptualization.

original: dper na rta rkang gcig pa la rkang med ces bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na rta rkang gcig pa la rkang med ces bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, a one-footed horse is called ‚Äúlegless.‚Äù

original: rkang pa gsum bcad nas rkang pa gcig yod kyang rkang med ces bya ba de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa gcig yod pa la yang rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gsum bcad nas rkang pa gcig yod kyang rkang med ces bya ba de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa gcig yod pa la yang rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as a man with one foot is called footless, so too, one who has one conceptualization is called nonconceptual.

original: de ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni yid kyi shes rab mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba dang skyes nas thob pa'o //
analyzed: de ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni yid kyi shes rab mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba dang skyes nas thob pa'o //
translated: This is conceptualization as investigation. Mental wisdom that is not in equipoise, whether it arises from hearing or reflection or is obtained at birth.

original: de ni yid la yod pas na yid kyi'o //
analyzed: de ni yid la yod pas na yid kyi'o //
translated: It is mental because it exists in the mind.

original: g-yeng zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa ste dmigs pa sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: g-yeng zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa ste dmigs pa sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Distraction means various, that is, having various objects.

original: yang na zab pa dang bral ba ste yang dang yang ru dmigs pa la brten pa'i g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zab pa dang bral ba ste yang dang yang ru dmigs pa la brten pa'i g-yeng ba'o //
translated: Or it is shallow, that is, distraction that is based on an object again and again.

original: ci'i phyir nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called conceptualization as investigation?

original: dmigs pa de dang de la ming du ltos nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang gzugs dang tshor ba dang mi rtog pa dang sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs par nges par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa de dang de la ming du ltos nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang gzugs dang tshor ba dang mi rtog pa dang sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs par nges par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages its object by relying on names and because it ascertains its object as form, feeling, non-conception, suffering and so on.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba ste ming la mi ltos par dmigs pa la 'jug pas 'di ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba ste ming la mi ltos par dmigs pa la 'jug pas 'di ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: That which is equipoise is derived from meditation because it engages its object without relying on names and it is not called conceptualization that ascertains.

original: yid kyi dran pa nyid mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa thams cad ces bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dran pa nyid mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa thams cad ces bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Mental memory is all that is equipoise and not equipoise.

original: de ni mtshan nyid dran pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid dran pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the memory of characteristics?

original: sems kyis mngon par brjod pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ming la mi ltos par dmigs pa'i don nyams su myong ba tsam la 'jug pa yin no zhes grag go //
analyzed: sems kyis mngon par brjod pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ming la mi ltos par dmigs pa'i don nyams su myong ba tsam la 'jug pa yin no zhes grag go //
translated: It is mental expression because it engages the mere experience of an object that is not dependent on names.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshigs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni nyams su myong ba @60b don mngon par brjod pa la 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshigs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni nyams su myong ba @60b don mngon par brjod pa la 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin par mi 'dod do //
translated: The five consciousnesses are not considered to be memory-constructions because they do not engage in verbal expression of the experienced object.

original: dmigs bcas sems kyi khams bdun no //
analyzed: dmigs bcas sems kyi khams bdun no //
translated: The seven are the seven mental elements.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdun kho na dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na bdun yin no zhes gnyi gar nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdun kho na dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na bdun yin no zhes gnyi gar nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: The seven are only those that have an object, and only those that have an object are the seven.üîΩThe half of the dharmas element is also that which has an object.

original: chos kyi phyed kyang dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad zin pa las ma gtogs par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi phyed kyang dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad zin pa las ma gtogs par brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is a statement that excludes what has already been explained.

original: 'dir yang chos kyi phyed kho na dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na yang chos kyi phyed yin no zhes gnyi gar nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang chos kyi phyed kho na dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na yang chos kyi phyed yin no zhes gnyi gar nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: Here also, only the half of the dharmas element has an object, and only that which has an object is the half of the dharmas element.

original: gang gi phyir bdun kho na dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang chos kyi phyed kho na dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya bar nges par bzung ba yod pa de'i phyir //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdun kho na dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang chos kyi phyed kho na dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya bar nges par bzung ba yod pa de'i phyir //
translated: Because it is ascertained that only seven have objects and only half of the phenomena element has objects,

original: lhag ma gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs ldan pa ma yin pa ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya bar grub po zhes bya bar bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs ldan pa ma yin pa ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya bar grub po zhes bya bar bshad pa yin no /
translated: it is explained that the remaining ten physical elements and the part of the phenomena element that is not associated with form are established as not having objects.

original: 'di ltar nges par ma bzung na ni don 'di grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nges par ma bzung na ni don 'di grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not ascertained in this way, this meaning would not be established.

original: ma zin dgu zhes bya ba ni dgu ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: ma zin dgu zhes bya ba ni dgu ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúnine are not‚Äù ascertains that nine are not.

original: brgyad pa'i phyed dang bcas te zhes bya ba ni lhan cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i phyed dang bcas te zhes bya ba ni lhan cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The statement ‚Äúalong with half of the eighth‚Äù means ‚Äútogether with.‚Äù

original: brgyad po de dag rnams zhes bya ba ni sems kyi khams bdun po de dag dang gang gi phyed dmigs pa dang bcas par bshad pa'i chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: brgyad po de dag rnams zhes bya ba ni sems kyi khams bdun po de dag dang gang gi phyed dmigs pa dang bcas par bshad pa'i chos kyi khams so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthose eight‚Äù refers to the seven mental elements and the part of the phenomena element that was explained as having objects.

original: brgyad smos pa ni chos kyi khams kyi phyed bsdus par shes par 'gyur na mi rung bas chos kyi khams mtha' dag bsdu ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: brgyad smos pa ni chos kyi khams kyi phyed bsdus par shes par 'gyur na mi rung bas chos kyi khams mtha' dag bsdu ba'i don yin te /
translated: The reason for mentioning eight is that it is inappropriate to understand that half of the phenomena element is included, so it is for the purpose of including the entire phenomena element.

original: brgyad po de dag dang gzhan sgra dang dgu ni ma zin pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: brgyad po de dag dang gzhan sgra dang dgu ni ma zin pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The other nine, such as sound, are not conjoined.

original: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la dgu ni mig la sogs pa lnga dang sgra ma gtogs pa gzugs la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la dgu ni mig la sogs pa lnga dang sgra ma gtogs pa gzugs la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The other nine are of two types. The other nine are the five sense organs and the four objects such as form, excluding sound.

original: de dag ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
translated: They are of two types alone.üîΩThey are only conjoined and not conjoined.

original: zin pa dang ma zin pa kho na yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gis zin pa kho na mi ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i don du //
analyzed: zin pa dang ma zin pa kho na yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gis zin pa kho na mi ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i don du //
translated: The meaning of this is that they are not only conjoined.

original: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The other nine are of two types.

original: zhes bya ba mdor byas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba mdor byas so //
translated: This is summarized in the verse.

original: phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis phan tshun mthun par @61a * //
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis phan tshun mthun par @61a * //
translated: They are mutually compatible through benefit and harm.

original: byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams la sogs pa la phan pa dang gnod pa mig sman dang lag pas bsnun pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis kyang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la phan pa dang gnod pa dag tu 'gyur la
analyzed: byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams la sogs pa la phan pa dang gnod pa mig sman dang lag pas bsnun pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis kyang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la phan pa dang gnod pa dag tu 'gyur la
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they function‚Äù means that the eye element and so on are also beneficial or harmful to the mind and mental factors through the characteristics of eye medicine and striking with the hand, and so on.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la phan pa dang gnod pa yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba'i mtshan nyid dag gis kyang mig gi khams la sogs pa la phan pa dang gnod pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la phan pa dang gnod pa yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba'i mtshan nyid dag gis kyang mig gi khams la sogs pa la phan pa dang gnod pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: And the mind and mental factors are also beneficial or harmful to the eye element and so on through the characteristics of mental pleasure and mental pain.

original: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rten gyi dngos pos nye bar bzung ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rten gyi dngos pos nye bar bzung ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the mind and mental factors are said to be appropriated as a basis.

original: bdag gir byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gir byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means they are possessed.

original: 'jig rten na sems pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni srog dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten na sems pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni srog dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is called ‚Äòendowed with mind‚Äô in the world‚Äù means ‚Äúendowed with life force.‚Äù

original: reg bya rnam pa gnyis yin te //
analyzed: reg bya rnam pa gnyis yin te //
translated: Tangible objects are of two types.

original: zhes bya ba ni reg bya kho na rnam pa gnyis yin la rnam pa gnyis kho na reg bya yin no zhes gnyi gar nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni reg bya kho na rnam pa gnyis yin la rnam pa gnyis kho na reg bya yin no zhes gnyi gar nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: This means that tangible objects are definitely of two types, and only two types are tangible objects.

original: lhag ma gzugs can dgu po ni //
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs can dgu po ni //
translated: The remaining nine physical constituents

original: 'byung gyur ces bya ba 'dir yang gnyi gar nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byung gyur ces bya ba 'dir yang gnyi gar nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: are also definitely of two types.

original: chos khams phyogs gcig kyang /
analyzed: chos khams phyogs gcig kyang /
translated: One portion of the constituent of mental objects

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa yin zhes bya ba 'dir yang gnyi gar nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa yin zhes bya ba 'dir yang gnyi gar nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: is also definitely of two types.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag gnyi gar nges par bzung ba de'i phyir //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag gnyi gar nges par bzung ba de'i phyir //
translated: Since these are definitely of two types,

original: lhag ma sems kyi khams bdun dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa chos kyi khams ni gnyi ga ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma sems kyi khams bdun dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa chos kyi khams ni gnyi ga ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: the remaining mental constituents, the seven mental constituents, and the constituent of mental objects, excluding non-informative form, are established as being neither.

original: 'byung ba rnam pa bzhi nyid dang sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par bzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bzhi nyid du nges par bzung ba'i phyir reg bya'i khams la sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams dang 'byung ba bzhi yod pa
analyzed: 'byung ba rnam pa bzhi nyid dang sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par bzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bzhi nyid du nges par bzung ba'i phyir reg bya'i khams la sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams dang 'byung ba bzhi yod pa
translated: The four great elements exist in the element of tactility, because the four great elements are definitely ascertained as four.

original: yin no // de la 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa ni 'byung ba dag ma yin no //
analyzed: yin no // de la 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa ni 'byung ba dag ma yin no //
translated: Smoothness, etc., and the eyes, etc., are not the great elements.

original: sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par bzung ba'i phyir sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams dag gi nang du mig la sogs pa chos gzhan 'du bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par bzung ba'i phyir sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams dag gi nang du mig la sogs pa chos gzhan 'du bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Other phenomena, such as the eyes, etc., are not included among the earth, water, fire, and wind elements, because the characteristics of solidity, etc., are definitely ascertained.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni sa'i khams @61b dang chu'i khams dang me'i khams dang rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni sa'i khams @61b dang chu'i khams dang me'i khams dang rlung gi khams so //
translated: The four great elements are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the earth element?

original: sra ba nyid do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sra ba nyid do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Solidity. This is the extensive explanation.

original: de dag kyang reg bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sra ba la sogs pa de dag reg bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang reg bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sra ba la sogs pa de dag reg bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is because those such as solidity are tactile objects.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni reg bya yin la kha dog la sogs pa ni blta bya dang mnyan bya dang bsnam bya dang myang bya yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni reg bya yin la kha dog la sogs pa ni blta bya dang mnyan bya dang bsnam bya dang myang bya yin no //
translated: In this way, they are tactile objects, but color, etc. are visible objects, audible objects, olfactory objects, and taste objects.

original: de dag reg bya yin par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de dag reg bya yin par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that they are tactile objects?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mig la sogs pas kyang sra ba la sogs pa mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas kyang sra ba la sogs pa mi 'dzin to //
translated: The eye, etc. do not apprehend solidity, etc.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do they apprehend?

original: lus kyi dbang po kho nas te /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po kho nas te /
translated: They apprehend only the tactile object.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni reg bya yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni reg bya yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that they are tactile objects.

original: gal te kha dog la sogs pa de dag kyang reg bya yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te kha dog la sogs pa de dag kyang reg bya yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that those such as color are also tactile objects,

original: de'i phyir lus kyi dbang pos kyang kha dog la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus kyi dbang pos kyang kha dog la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said: the body faculty does not apprehend color, etc.üîΩWhat does it apprehend?

original: ci zhe na 'dzin pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci zhe na 'dzin pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: It apprehends only the tactile object.

original: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo gzhan las kyang rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo gzhan las kyang rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The sutra also states this extensively means that other sutras also teach this extensively.üîΩHow?

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: The sutra states:

original: dge slong reg bya rnams ni phyi'i skye mched yin te 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'di rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong reg bya rnams ni phyi'i skye mched yin te 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa gzugs can bstan du med pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'di rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: Monks, tactile objects are external bases, the four great elements and the form that is derived from the four great elements, is undemonstrable and impeded.

original: lhag ma mig la sogs pa'i skye mched ni 'byung ba dag ma yin zhes gsal bar kun tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma mig la sogs pa'i skye mched ni 'byung ba dag ma yin zhes gsal bar kun tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The remaining bases such as the eyes are not the elements.

original: 'o na mdo las gang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las gang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then how do you interpret the sutra that states:

original: mig gi sha'i gong bu la sra ba dang mkhrang bar gyur pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni mkhrang ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mig gi sha'i gong bu la sra ba dang mkhrang bar gyur pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni mkhrang ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The flesh of the eye is that which is solid and solidified in the flesh of the eye.

original: mig gi dbang po ni sra ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no snyam du bsams nas rgol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ni sra ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no snyam du bsams nas rgol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: They argue, thinking that the eye faculty has the essential nature of solidity.üîΩIt is merely the lump of flesh that exists without distinction from that which is so described.

original: de dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa'i sha'i gong bu la de skad du bstan par zad do zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa'i rten la de skad ces brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa'i sha'i gong bu la de skad du bstan par zad do zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa'i rten la de skad ces brjod pa yin no //
translated: The support that exists without distinction from the eye faculty is so described.

original: mig gi rten la yang mig nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi rten la yang mig nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The eye is figuratively designated in dependence on the support of the eye.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sha'i gong bu zhes smos kyi de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sha'i gong bu zhes smos kyi de lta ma yin te /
translated: For that very reason, it is called a lump of flesh.

original: gal te dbang po kho na yin par bzhed na mig la zhes bya ba kho na zhig @62a * //üîΩbshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang po kho na yin par bzhed na mig la zhes bya ba kho na zhig @62a * // bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the eye were asserted to be the faculty alone, it would be called the eye.üîΩThe eye is figuratively designated in dependence on the support of the eye.üîΩThis person consists of six elements, etc.

original: mi 'di ni khams drug pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mngal du 'jug pa'i sgo las sam nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: mi 'di ni khams drug pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mngal du 'jug pa'i sgo las sam nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: This is stated in the Descent into the Womb Sutra or in the context of the embryonic states of kalala, etc.

original: 'byung ba tsam yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa med do zhes bya ba'i klan ka'i dogs pa bsdu bar /
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa med do zhes bya ba'i klan ka'i dogs pa bsdu bar /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are merely elements, he raises the objection, ‚ÄúThere is no derivative form.‚Äù

original: sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the basis of sentient beings‚Äô substance, he says,

original: sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to demonstrate the basis of sentient beings‚Äô substance.

original: sa la sogs pa bzhi ni sems can gyi gzhi yin te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa bzhi ni sems can gyi gzhi yin te /
translated: The four, earth, etc., are the basis of sentient beings

original: de rnams la sogs pa reg pa'i skye mched lnga po dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyid kyi khams kyang sems kyi gzhi yin te /
analyzed: de rnams la sogs pa reg pa'i skye mched lnga po dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro // yid kyi khams kyang sems kyi gzhi yin te /
translated: because the five sense spheres that are derivative form arise from them.

original: de las yid kyi rig pa'i skye mched 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las yid kyi rig pa'i skye mched 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind element is the basis of the mind because the sense sphere of mental consciousness arises from it.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sa'i khams la sogs pa bzhi ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rten yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sa'i khams la sogs pa bzhi ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rten yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Alternatively, the four, earth, etc., are the basis of derivative form because they are the cause of derivative form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rten yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rten yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The consciousness element is the basis of the mental factors because it is the cause of the mental factors.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems can gyi gzhi yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can gyi gzhi yin no //
translated: For this very reason, it is the basis of sentient beings.

original: ji ltar shes she na /üîΩyang reg pa'i skye mched drug ces gsungs pa'i phyir te mdo de nyid las phyis reg pa'i skye mched ni drug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na / yang reg pa'i skye mched drug ces gsungs pa'i phyir te mdo de nyid las phyis reg pa'i skye mched ni drug ste /
translated: How do we know that?üîΩBecause it says, ‚Äúthe six bases of contact.‚Äù

original: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched nas yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched nas yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The same sutra later says, ‚ÄúThe six bases of contact are the base of eye contact up to the base of mental contact.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir dge slong mi 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir yin gyi 'byung ba tsam du gnas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong mi 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir yin gyi 'byung ba tsam du gnas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, the statement, ‚ÄúMonks, this person consists of six elements,‚Äù is made in order to teach the basis of sentient beings‚Äô substance, not in order to teach the mere elements.

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i khams las tha dad pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i khams las tha dad pa ma yin yang /
translated: Even though the mental faculty is not different from the element of consciousness,

original: yang yid kyi skye mched smos pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa yang khams bzhi las tha dad pa ma yin bzhin du yang brjod par gyur pa zhig ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang yid kyi skye mched smos pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa yang khams bzhi las tha dad pa ma yin bzhin du yang brjod par gyur pa zhig ma yin nam /
translated: why is the mental faculty mentioned separately from the four elements, just as the eye faculty and so on are?

original: de'i phyir yang reg pa'i skye mched smos pas 'byung ba las gyur pa logs shig na yod pa nyid du ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang reg pa'i skye mched smos pas 'byung ba las gyur pa logs shig na yod pa nyid du ma grub po zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the sense bases of contact are mentioned, it is not established that the derivative form exists separately.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because

original: gal te sa'i khams la sogs pa kho na reg pa'i skye mched dag yin par gyur na de dag nyid kyi reg pa'i skye mched ces bya ba kho na bshad par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te sa'i khams la sogs pa kho na reg pa'i skye mched dag yin par gyur na de dag nyid kyi reg pa'i skye mched ces bya ba kho na bshad par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ni ma yin no //
translated: if the earth element and so on were the sense bases of contact, they would be explained as the sense bases of contact alone, but that is not the case.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the case?

original: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched nas yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched nas yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: The sense bases of contact from the eye sense base of contact to the mind sense base of contact are stated.

original: de'i phyir sa'i khams la sogs pa ma gtogs pa mig la sogs pa yod do zhes bya @62b bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa'i khams la sogs pa ma gtogs pa mig la sogs pa yod do zhes bya @62b bar shes so //
translated: Therefore we understand that the eye and so on exist separately from the earth element and so forth.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni mig la sogs pa'i reg pa'i skye mched smos pa'i zhar la yang brjod par zad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni mig la sogs pa'i reg pa'i skye mched smos pa'i zhar la yang brjod par zad do //
translated: The consciousness element is also mentioned incidentally when the sense bases of contact from the eye sense base to the mind sense base are mentioned.

original: reg pa'i skye mched ces bya ba'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched ces bya ba'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term sense base of contact?

original: sems las byung ba rag pa'i rten //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rag pa'i rten //
translated: The basis of the mental factors is the mind.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: the basis of the possession of mental factors.üîΩBecause it would follow that mental factors would not exist.

original: sems las byung ba rnams med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te dge slong mi 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes gsungs pa sgra ji bzhin kho nar rdzas rnams bzung gi de la brten pa'i rdzas gzhan dag ma yin na
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te dge slong mi 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes gsungs pa sgra ji bzhin kho nar rdzas rnams bzung gi de la brten pa'i rdzas gzhan dag ma yin na
translated: If the statement, ‚ÄúThis monk is the six elements,‚Äù is taken literally, only the substances are grasped, not the other substances that are based on them.

original: des na 'dir rnam par shes pa'i khams tsam smos pa'i phyir de la brten pa sems las byung ba rnams ma bsdus par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'dir rnam par shes pa'i khams tsam smos pa'i phyir de la brten pa sems las byung ba rnams ma bsdus par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, here it would follow that mental factors, which are based on it, would not be included because only the consciousness element is mentioned.

original: gal te 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no fault because it is intended,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: phyogs 'di ni nyes pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs 'di ni nyes pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this position is faulty.

original: sems las byung ba rnams ni sems kyi khyad par kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyes pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams ni sems kyi khyad par kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyes pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The position that mental factors are only specific states of mind is flawed because it contradicts our own philosophical tenets.

original: de'i phyir sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin no zhes khas blang bar yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin no zhes khas blang bar yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is also unreasonable to accept that mind itself is mental factors.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mdo las 'du shes dang sems pa'i chos 'di ni sems las byung ba sems la brten pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las 'du shes dang sems pa'i chos 'di ni sems las byung ba sems la brten pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a sutra states, ‚ÄúThe phenomena of discernment and intention are mental factors that depend on mind.‚Äù

original: 'dir bsgrub pa yang 'byung ste /üîΩ'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni sems las don gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub pa yang 'byung ste / 'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni sems las don gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
translated: A proof is also stated here:üîΩDiscernment and feeling are different from mind because they are taught separately as aggregates.

original: phung po bstan pa logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po bstan pa logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po bzhin no //
translated: They are like the form aggregate.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na 'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni rang gi rten las don gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na 'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni rang gi rten las don gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Alternatively, discernment and feeling are different from their basis because they are taught separately as aggregates.

original: de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is based on that.

original: gang zhig rang gi rten la brten pa de ni rang gi rten las don gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi rten la brten pa de ni rang gi rten las don gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is based on its basis is different in meaning from its basis,

original: dper na rtsig pa la brten pa'i ri mo lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rtsig pa la brten pa'i ri mo lta bu'o //
translated: like a painting based on a wall.üîΩBecause a mind with attachment, etc., occurs.

original: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems 'dod chags dang bcas pas 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //üîΩsems 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems 'dod chags dang bcas pas 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so // sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows a mind with attachment as having attachment, just as it is.üîΩHe knows a mind without attachment as without attachment, just as it is.

original: sems zhe sdang dang bcas pa la zhe sdang dang bcas pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba rgyas @63a * //
analyzed: sems zhe sdang dang bcas pa la zhe sdang dang bcas pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba rgyas @63a * //
translated: He knows a mind with aversion as having aversion, just as it is.

original: par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: 'dir sgrub pa ni sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba sems 'dod chags dang phan tshun don gzhan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sgrub pa ni sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba sems 'dod chags dang phan tshun don gzhan pa nyid yin no //
translated: Here, the statement ‚Äúthe mind is associated with attachment‚Äù indicates that the mind and attachment are mutually different.

original: lhan cig ldan par bstan pas bstan pa'i phyir nag pa bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig ldan par bstan pas bstan pa'i phyir nag pa bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: The compound ‚Äúblack and white‚Äù is used to indicate that they are associated.üîΩThe ten physical elements are aggregations.

original: gzugs can bcu ni bsags pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba ni bcu kho na rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs can bcu ni bsags pa'o // zhes bya ba ni bcu kho na rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The ten physical elements are aggregations of atoms.

original: nges par bzung ba 'dis na khams gzhan dag ni bsags pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'grub po //
analyzed: nges par bzung ba 'dis na khams gzhan dag ni bsags pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'grub po //
translated: This statement is made in order to establish that the other elements are not aggregations.

original: phyi rol gyi ni khams bzhi yin //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni khams bzhi yin //
translated: The four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.üîΩThe four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgra ma gtogs pa gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgra ma gtogs pa gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four external elements are form, smell, taste, and tactility, excluding sound.üîΩThe four external elements are the four external elements.

original: dgra sta dang shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dgra sta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcod par byed pa yin la shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dgra sta dang shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dgra sta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcod par byed pa yin la shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba yin te /
translated: The four external

original: srid pa'i phyir de skad ces bshad kyi res 'ga' ni dgra sta zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gcad par bya ba yin te //üîΩ'brel ba 'byung ba can zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di la 'brel par 'byung ba ni rnam par ma bye bar 'byung ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'dus pa'i rgyun 'brel bar 'byung ba can yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i phyir de skad ces bshad kyi res 'ga' ni dgra sta zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gcad par bya ba yin te // 'brel ba 'byung ba can zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di la 'brel par 'byung ba ni rnam par ma bye bar 'byung ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'dus pa'i rgyun 'brel bar 'byung ba can yin te /
translated: It is explained in this way because it exists, but sometimes an axe and so on is the cutter.üîΩThe term ‚Äúhaving a related origin‚Äù is explained in the Abhidharmako≈õa:

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i rgyun zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i rgyun zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This has a related origin because it has the nature of arising without differentiation. It has a related origin that is a collection because it is a collection of form and so on.

original: de rnam par 'byed pa skyed pa gang yin pa ni rnam par 'byed pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnam par 'byed pa skyed pa gang yin pa ni rnam par 'byed pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: That which generates the differentiation of that is the generator of the differentiation.

original: de ni gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gcod pa yin no //
translated: That is the cutter.

original: dngos po skad cig ma rnams dgra sta la sogs pa med kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba kho na yin mod kyi rgyun 'gag pa ni dgra sta la sogs pa yin pas dgra sta la sogs pas gcod par byed pa yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dngos po skad cig ma rnams dgra sta la sogs pa med kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba kho na yin mod kyi rgyun 'gag pa ni dgra sta la sogs pa yin pas dgra sta la sogs pas gcod par byed pa yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: Although things that are momentary are severed even without an axe and so on, the continuum is severed by an axe and so on.

original: rgyu tshogs pa'i khyad par gyi dbang gis 'bras bu'i khyad par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa'i khyad par gyi dbang gis 'bras bu'i khyad par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The difference in the effect arises from the difference in the collection of causes.

original: de la khams bzhi po kho na gcod par byed pa dang gcad par bya ba yin no zhes nges par bzung ste /
analyzed: de la khams bzhi po kho na gcod par byed pa dang gcad par bya ba yin no zhes nges par bzung ste /
translated: The four primary elements alone are the cutter and the cut.

original: de ltar nges par bzung bas khams gzhan dag ni gnyi ga ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba grub po //
analyzed: de ltar nges par bzung bas khams gzhan dag ni gnyi ga ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba grub po //
translated: By this restriction, it is established that the other primary elements are neither.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: For that very reason, the body faculty and so on are not cut.

original: 'dir ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa la zhes brjod par bya ba yin pa las /
analyzed: 'dir ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa la zhes brjod par bya ba yin pa las /
translated: Here, it should be said that the eye faculty and so on are not cut,

original: ci'i phyir lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa zhes smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa zhes smos she na /
translated: but why is it said that the body faculty and so on are not cut?

original: 'di ltar gal te 'chad par 'gyur na lus kyi dbang po la bcad pa yongs su gsal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'chad par 'gyur na lus kyi dbang po la bcad pa yongs su gsal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If it is explained in this way, it would be clear that the body faculty is cut.

original: de'i phyir @63b lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang po dag brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir @63b lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang po dag brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the faculties such as the body faculty are mentioned.

original: yan lag ma lus par bcad cing yan lag dag nying lag bcad na de dag la gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir te lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa de dag gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag ma lus par bcad cing yan lag dag nying lag bcad na de dag la gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir te lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa de dag gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the limbs are cut off, and the limbs are cut off again, they cannot be cut again, because the body faculty and so on cannot be cut again.

original: de dag la gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de dag la gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that they cannot be cut again?

original: de'i phyir yang smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dbang po rnams la ni gnyis su 'gyur ba med de bcad pa'i yan lag lus dang bral ba la dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams la ni gnyis su 'gyur ba med de bcad pa'i yan lag lus dang bral ba la dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculties cannot be cut again, because when a limb is cut off, the faculty is separated from the body.

original: yan lag bcad pa lus dang bral ba gang yin pa de la dbang po med do zhes bya ba 'di yang ji lta shes she na /
analyzed: yan lag bcad pa lus dang bral ba gang yin pa de la dbang po med do zhes bya ba 'di yang ji lta shes she na /
translated: How do you know that the faculty is separated from the body when a limb is cut off?

original: 'di ltar de dag dang reg bya la sogs pa la brten nas lus la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag dang reg bya la sogs pa la brten nas lus la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye'o //
translated: Because the body faculty and so on do not arise in dependence on the tactile objects of the cut-off limb.

original: 'o na ji ltar sna'i rtse mo bcad de yang sbyar bas lus kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sna'i rtse mo bcad de yang sbyar bas lus kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed ce na /
translated: But how is it that the body faculty arises when the tip of the nose is cut off and then joined again?

original: sna'i drung ba dang 'brel pas yang lus kyi dbang po skye ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sna'i drung ba dang 'brel pas yang lus kyi dbang po skye ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because the nose sense faculty is connected to the body sense faculty and the body sense faculty is generated.

original: gal te de la lus kyi dbang po med na ji ltar 'di na rmigs bu la sogs pa'i mjug ma bcad pa dag 'gul zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de la lus kyi dbang po med na ji ltar 'di na rmigs bu la sogs pa'i mjug ma bcad pa dag 'gul zhe na /
translated: If the body sense faculty does not exist there, how is it that the tails of lizards and so on move when cut off?

original: de ni rlung gi khams kyi 'gyur ba yin gyi lus kyi dbang po'i las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rlung gi khams kyi 'gyur ba yin gyi lus kyi dbang po'i las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: That is a transformation of the wind constituent, but it should be understood that it is not the function of the body sense faculty.

original: gcod par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcod par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a cutter,üîΩbecause it is clear like the light of a gem.

original: nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dper na nor bu'i 'od dang pa'i phyir gcod par byed pa ma yin pa ltar dbang po rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dper na nor bu'i 'od dang pa'i phyir gcod par byed pa ma yin pa ltar dbang po rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the light of a gem is not a cutter because it is clear, so too the sense faculties are not cutters because they are clear.

original: de bzhin bsreg bya 'jal byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin bsreg bya 'jal byed pa'o //
translated: It is like that with the burned and the weighed.

original: zhes bya ba'i de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni phyi'i khams bzhi po de dag nyid de dang 'dra ba'i don du rab tu ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni phyi'i khams bzhi po de dag nyid de dang 'dra ba'i don du rab tu ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúlike‚Äù indicates that the four external elements are similar to the internal elements.

original: shing la sogs pa mes byas pa'i 'gyur ba ni sreg pa yin la de yang dbang po dag la med de /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa mes byas pa'i 'gyur ba ni sreg pa yin la de yang dbang po dag la med de /
translated: The modification of wood, etc. by fire is burning, and that does not exist for the sense faculties.

original: nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are clear like the light of a gem.

original: de dag ni shing la sogs pa lta bu'am pags pa la sogs pa lta bur 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de dag ni shing la sogs pa lta bu'am pags pa la sogs pa lta bur 'gyur ba med do //
translated: They are not modified like wood, etc. or like skin, etc.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de dang 'brel pa las rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa las rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are interrupted through their connection with that.

original: khams bzhi po de dag nyid srang la sogs par gyur pa ni 'jal bar byed pa yin gyi dbang po rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khams bzhi po de dag nyid srang la sogs par gyur pa ni 'jal bar byed pa yin gyi dbang po rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The four elements in the form of a scale, etc. are the measurer, not the sense faculties,

original: de bzhin du gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are clear in the same way.

original: khams lus can ma yin pa rnams ni lus med pa nyid kyi phyir bcad pa la sogs pa mi srid pas de dag gi bcad pa la sogs pa bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: khams lus can ma yin pa rnams ni lus med pa nyid kyi phyir bcad pa la sogs pa mi srid pas de dag gi bcad pa la sogs pa bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: The non-bodily elements cannot be cut, etc. because they are non-bodily. Therefore, their cutting, etc. should not be considered.

original: sgra yang ma yin te chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes @64a * //
analyzed: sgra yang ma yin te chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes @64a * //
translated: Sound is not, because it is discontinuous.

original: bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: gcod par byed pa dang gcod par bya ba 'am bsreg par bya ba'am 'jal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gcod par byed pa dang gcod par bya ba 'am bsreg par bya ba'am 'jal bar byed pa ste /
translated: Or, it is the agent of cutting, the object of cutting, the object of burning, or the object of weighing.

original: rgyun chags par mi 'dug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsreg dang gzhal la mi mthun smra //
analyzed: rgyun chags par mi 'dug pa'i phyir ro // sreg dang gzhal la mi mthun smra //
translated: Because it does not remain in a continuous series.üîΩSome say: Fire is the agent of burning and weighing.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgra yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgra yang ma yin te /
translated: Some say: Fire is not the agent of burning and weighing, because it is intermittent.

original: chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di 'og ma la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di 'og ma la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to the following as well.

original: kha cig ni bsam pa ni khams bzhi po de dag nyid sreg par byed pa yang yin la 'jal bar byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni bsam pa ni khams bzhi po de dag nyid sreg par byed pa yang yin la 'jal bar byed pa yang yin te /
translated: Some say: The four elements are both the agent of burning and the object of burning,

original: sreg par byed pa ni me dang rtsi drag po la sogs pa yin la de la yang khams bzhi po spyir thal ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sreg par byed pa ni me dang rtsi drag po la sogs pa yin la de la yang khams bzhi po spyir thal ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because fire, strong oil, etc., are the agent of burning, and the four elements are the general cause of the transformation of ashes, etc.

original: gzhal bar bya ba ni lan tshva la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba ni lan tshva la sogs pa yin la /
translated: That which is to be weighed is salt, etc.

original: de la yang spyir srang mda'i mgo dma' bar byed pa'i rgyu yin no snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang spyir srang mda'i mgo dma' bar byed pa'i rgyu yin no snyam pa yin no //
translated: And the four elements are the general cause of lowering the head of the scale.üîΩSome say: The four elements are both the agent of weighing and the object of weighing.

original: me'i khams kho na sreg par byed pa yin la lci ba nyid kho na gzhal bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni me'i khams me 'bar ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa bya ba la shas che ba kho na sreg par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: me'i khams kho na sreg par byed pa yin la lci ba nyid kho na gzhal bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni me'i khams me 'bar ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa bya ba la shas che ba kho na sreg par byed pa yin te /
translated: The fire element is that which burns, since it is predominant in the action of burning, such as in the burning of fire.

original: sa'i khams la sogs pa ni rang gi bya ba la shas che ba nyid yin yang sreg par byed pa nyid ma yin pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i khams la sogs pa ni rang gi bya ba la shas che ba nyid yin yang sreg par byed pa nyid ma yin pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Although the earth element and so on are predominant in their own actions, they are not seen to burn.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs lci ba nyid bya ba la shas che ba kho na gzhal bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs lci ba nyid bya ba la shas che ba kho na gzhal bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Heaviness alone is that which is weighed, since it is predominant in the action of weighing among derivative form.

original: snang ba la sogs pa rdzas yang ba la gzugs la sogs pa bya ba la shas che ba nyid yin yang gzhal bar bya ba nyid ma yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa rdzas yang ba la gzugs la sogs pa bya ba la shas che ba nyid yin yang gzhal bar bya ba nyid ma yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Although lightness and so on are predominant in the action of form and so on, they are not seen to be that which is weighed.

original: nang gi lnga zhes bya ba la nang gi zhes bya ba smos pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi lnga zhes bya ba la nang gi zhes bya ba smos pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five internal are the five elements of the eye and so on.

original: lnga smos pa ni yid kyi bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga smos pa ni yid kyi bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five sense consciousnesses are called ‚Äúarisen from the cause of karmic maturation‚Äù because they are the results of the cause of karmic maturation.

original: nang gi lnga ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba kho na yin gyi rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ngo //
analyzed: nang gi lnga ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba kho na yin gyi rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ngo //
