translated: The five internal sense faculties are definitely said to be arisen from the cause of karmic maturation and arisen from enhancement, but they are not said to be arisen from natural outflow.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no natural outflow that is not included in those two.

original: rgyu mthun pa ni rgyu dang 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba dag kyang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni yin mod kyi de dag rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa ni rgyu dang 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba dag kyang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni yin mod kyi de dag rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba
translated: Natural outflow is similar to its cause, therefore it is natural outflow that is arisen from the cause of karmic maturation and arisen from enhancement.

original: nyid kho nas bsdus pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o zhes bya bar mi bzung ba'i phyir ni gang dag rang gi rgyu dang 'dra ba yang yin la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba yang ma yin pa de dag rgyu
analyzed: nyid kho nas bsdus pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o zhes bya bar mi bzung ba'i phyir ni gang dag rang gi rgyu dang 'dra ba yang yin la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba yang ma yin pa de dag rgyu
translated: They are not to be held as originating from natural outflow, because they are included in the class of the effect of uniform outflow alone.

original: mthun @64b pa las byung ba yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: mthun @64b pa las byung ba yin par 'dod do //
translated: Those that are similar to their cause but do not originate from karmic maturation or enhancement are held to originate from natural outflow.

original: mig la sogs pa ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: The eye element and so on are not like that.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba dag yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba dag yin te /
translated: They originate from karmic maturation and enhancement.

original: de'i phyir de dag las ma gtogs pa rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag las ma gtogs pa rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di smos so //
translated: Therefore this is said: because apart from those, there is no natural outflow.

original: yang de dag la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba med do zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: yang de dag la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba med do zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that they do not originate from natural outflow?

original: shi ba la rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shi ba la rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not continue after death.

original: mig gi khams la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du shi ba la rjes su 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: mig gi khams la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du shi ba la rjes su 'jug pa med do //
translated: The eye element and so on do not continue after death, like form and so on.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o /
translated: That arisen from the cause of karmic maturation is the effect of karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: That arisen from the cause of karmic maturation is arisen from karmic maturation.üîΩBecause the middle term is elided, it is like saying ‚Äúox-cart.‚Äù

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ba glang gi shing rta zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ba lang gi shing rta zhes bya ba bzhin te /
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ba glang gi shing rta zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ba lang gi shing rta zhes bya ba bzhin te /
translated: Because the term cause is elided, it is like saying ‚Äúox-cart.‚Äù

original: dper na ba lang dag dang ldan pa'i shing rta la ba lang gi shing rta zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang dag dang ldan pa'i shing rta la ba lang gi shing rta zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying ‚Äúox-cart‚Äù for a cart drawn by oxen.üîΩOr, karma that has reached the time of its result is the cause of karmic maturation.

original: yang na 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las ni zhes bya ba ni mjug thogs su 'bras bu rnam par smin pa skye ba'i skad cig ma la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las ni zhes bya ba ni mjug thogs su 'bras bu rnam par smin pa skye ba'i skad cig ma la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is karma that exists in the moment when the result of karmic maturation arises immediately after it.

original: yang na rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni las kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa yang rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni las kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa yang rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, the cause is figuratively designated as the result.

original: de skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause that has the characteristic of karma, which is not by nature karmic maturation, is called karmic maturation because it generates karmic maturation.üîΩFor example, figuratively designating the result as the cause.

original: dper na 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig la sogs pa reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin zhes bya ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig la sogs pa reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin zhes bya ba lta bu yin te /
translated: The six sense bases of contact, such as the eyes, are called prior karma.

original: sngon gyi skye ba la yod pas ni sngon gyi nyid sngon gyi las yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi skye ba la yod pas ni sngon gyi nyid sngon gyi las yin no //
translated: Since they exist in a prior birth, they are prior karma.üîΩAlthough those sense bases of contact are not by nature prior karma, they are called prior karma because they arise from prior karma.

original: reg pa'i skye mched de dag ni sngon gyi las kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin yang de las skyes pa'i phyir sngon gyi las yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang bzlog ste nye bar btags pa yin par blta'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched de dag ni sngon gyi las kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin yang de las skyes pa'i phyir sngon gyi las yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang bzlog ste nye bar btags pa yin par blta'o //
translated: In the same way, here the opposite is figuratively designated.

original: zas dang legs par bya ba dag gnyid log pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par dag gis rgyas par byas pa rnams ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag go zhes bya ba la khyad par gyi sgra ni re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zas dang legs par bya ba dag gnyid log pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par dag gis rgyas par byas pa rnams ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag go zhes bya ba la khyad par gyi sgra ni re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Those that are augmented by food, proper behavior, sleep, and specific meditative attainments are called ‚Äúarisen from enhancement.‚Äù The word ‚Äúspecific‚Äù should be applied to each of the four.

original: de la zas dang gnyid log pa dag ni 'jig rten na grags pa zad do //üîΩlegs par bya ba ni lus bsku ba dang / sman mar btang @65a * //
analyzed: de la zas dang gnyid log pa dag ni 'jig rten na grags pa zad do // legs par bya ba ni lus bsku ba dang / sman mar btang @65a * //
translated: Food and sleep are well known in the world.üîΩProper behavior is by nature the anointing of the body, the application of medicinal oils,

original: ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Meditative attainment is characterized by a one-pointed mind.

original: nye bar bsags pa ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsags pa ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: Augmentation is the accumulation of that.

original: bsags pa la yod pa ni rgyas pa las byung ba ste dmag la yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bsags pa la yod pa ni rgyas pa las byung ba ste dmag la yod pa bzhin no //
translated: That which exists in augmentation is arisen from enhancement, just as an army exists in an army.

original: yang na bsags pa nyid rgyas pa las byung ba ste 'dul ba las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na bsags pa nyid rgyas pa las byung ba ste 'dul ba las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: Or augmentation itself is arisen from enhancement, just as that arisen from training exists in training.

original: gzhan dag na re tshangs par spyod pas kyang zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa dbang po nye bar zhi ba rnams kyis lus rgyas par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re tshangs par spyod pas kyang zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa dbang po nye bar zhi ba rnams kyis lus rgyas par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Others say: ‚ÄúEven by pure conduct‚Äù means that the body is seen to be nourished by those who have pure conduct and calm faculties.üîΩIt is merely non-harmful, not nourishing.

original: des ni mi gnod pa tsam du zad kyi zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pas ni lus nyam chung bar 'gyur ba tshangs par spyod pas ni lus nyam chung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni mi gnod pa tsam du zad kyi zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pas ni lus nyam chung bar 'gyur ba tshangs par spyod pas ni lus nyam chung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Immoral conduct causes the body to become weak, but pure conduct does not cause the body to become weak.

original: de lta bas na smras pa tshangs par spyod pa des ni mi gnod pa tsam du zad kyi rgyas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na smras pa tshangs par spyod pa des ni mi gnod pa tsam du zad kyi rgyas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that pure conduct is merely non-harmful, not nourishing.

original: rgyas pa ni zas la sogs pas yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni zas la sogs pas yin pa nyid do //
translated: Nourishing is only by food and so on.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir /
translated: Then why?

original: rab tu byung ba tshangs par spyod pa kha cig gis lus nyam chung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba tshangs par spyod pa kha cig gis lus nyam chung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Some renunciant pure conduct practitioners have weak bodies.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa las 'gyur bar zad do //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa las 'gyur bar zad do //
translated: That is due to having desire, torment, and so on.

original: phyir bzhin du kun du srung ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'i rgyud ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyud la bskor te gnas pas kun tu bsrung ba yin te //
analyzed: phyir bzhin du kun du srung ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'i rgyud ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyud la bskor te gnas pas kun tu bsrung ba yin te //
translated: It is protected like the external body, because the continuum of the effect of development is protected by the continuum of the effect of retribution.

original: sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni lus nyam chung ba ma yin pa'i sgra gsang mtho ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni lus nyam chung ba ma yin pa'i sgra gsang mtho ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Sound is derived from development, because the sound of one whose body is not weak is loud.

original: 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gis sgra bsgrags par bya'o zhes bya bar 'dod na ni 'byung la mi 'dod na ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gis sgra bsgrags par bya'o zhes bya bar 'dod na ni 'byung la mi 'dod na ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: It is produced at will, because if one wishes to make a sound, it is produced; if one does not wish to, it is not produced.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i chos ni mi 'dod bzhin du yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i chos ni mi 'dod bzhin du yang 'byung ste /
translated: A dharma that is the effect of retribution is produced even if one does not wish it.

original: de lta bas na sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore sound is not the effect of retribution.

original: 'di la sgrub pa yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la sgrub pa yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: We must also state the proof.

original: sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: Sound is not the effect of retribution,üîΩbecause it is produced at will.

original: 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir sems las byung ba tshul bzhin yid la byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir sems las byung ba tshul bzhin yid la byed pa bzhin no //
translated: because it arises as one wishes, like the mental factor proper attention.

original: gang zhig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa de ni 'dod dgur 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa de ni 'dod dgur 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: But that which arises from karmic maturation does not arise as one wishes,

original: dper na mig gi dbang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po lta bu'o //
translated: like the eye faculty.

original: 'o na gang bstan bcos las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'dis ni dam bcas pa rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na gang bstan bcos las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'dis ni dam bcas pa rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: This passage shows that the assertion contradicts the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika tenets.üîΩSome say: This is a three step process.üîΩThe karmic maturation of the path of abandoning harsh speech in the throat is the primary elements that are its nature.

original: kha cig na re brgyud pa 'di ni gsum pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mgrin par tshig rtsub po spong ba'i las kyi lam gyi rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo @65b nyid kyi 'byung ba dag 'grub la de dag las sgra 'byung ba
analyzed: kha cig na re brgyud pa 'di ni gsum pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mgrin par tshig rtsub po spong ba'i las kyi lam gyi rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo @65b nyid kyi 'byung ba dag 'grub la de dag las sgra 'byung ba
translated: Sound arises from those.

original: yin no // phyogs gnyis pa la yang las dag las ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'byung ba rnams 'grub /
analyzed: yin no // phyogs gnyis pa la yang las dag las ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'byung ba rnams 'grub /
translated: In the second position, primary elements that arise from karmic maturation are established from karma.

original: de las ni zas kyis rgyas pa'am ting nge 'dzin gyis rgyas pa'i sgo nas rgyas pa las byung ba rnams 'grub /
analyzed: de las ni zas kyis rgyas pa'am ting nge 'dzin gyis rgyas pa'i sgo nas rgyas pa las byung ba rnams 'grub /
translated: From that, those derived from enhancement are established, either through enhancement by food or through enhancement by concentration.

original: de dag las ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba sngon gyi 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa gsar du byung ba rnams 'grub /
analyzed: de dag las ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba sngon gyi 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa gsar du byung ba rnams 'grub /
translated: From those, those derived from natural outflow are established, except for those that are new natural outflows from former primary elements.

original: de dag las ni sgra 'grub po zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag las ni sgra 'grub po zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: From those, sound is established.

original: de'i phyir sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore sound is derived from the ripening cause.

original: tshig kyang pa spangs pas tshangs pa'i dbyangs nyid 'grub po zhes bya ba ni brgyud de 'grub pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig kyang pa spangs pas tshangs pa'i dbyangs nyid 'grub po zhes bya ba ni brgyud de 'grub pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The line ‚Äúand also because the word pa is abandoned, Brahma‚Äôs voice is established‚Äù is stated from the perspective of indirect establishment.

original: 'dis ni dam bcas pa de'i rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal pa nyid yongs su spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni dam bcas pa de'i rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal pa nyid yongs su spong bar byed do //
translated: This completely eliminates the contradiction with his own tenets.

original: gal te sgra bzhin du rigs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni sgra ni 'dod dgur 'byung bas rnam par smin pa'i rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin par bshad do //
analyzed: gal te sgra bzhin du rigs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni sgra ni 'dod dgur 'byung bas rnam par smin pa'i rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin par bshad do //
translated: Sound is said not to arise from karmic maturation because it arises at will, and it is contrary to reason that it arises from karmic maturation.

original: gal te lus kyi tshor ba de yang de dang 'dra bar 'dod dgur 'byung ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni 'dod dgur 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te lus kyi tshor ba de yang de dang 'dra bar 'dod dgur 'byung ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni 'dod dgur 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: If bodily feeling were to arise at will, it would not arise from karmic maturation, but it does not arise at will.

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the eye and so on.

original: de lta bas na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is reasonable to say that it arises from karmic maturation.

original: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen nye bar gtod pa med par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen nye bar gtod pa med par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It arises without the condition of pleasure or pain being present.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go zhes bya ba ni skal pa mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag kho nas bskyed pa yin gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyus ni ma yinüîΩzhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go zhes bya ba ni skal pa mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag kho nas bskyed pa yin gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyus ni ma yin zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: This passage indicates that they are generated only by homogeneous and omnipresent causes and not by the cause of karmic maturation.üîΩThose generated by the cause of karmic maturation are derived from karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyus pa bskyed pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyus bskyed pa kho na yin gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho nas skyed pa ni ma yin zhes bya bar nges parüîΩbzung ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyus pa bskyed pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyus bskyed pa kho na yin gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho nas skyed pa ni ma yin zhes bya bar nges par bzung ba yin te /
translated: This passage indicates that they are generated only by the cause of karmic maturation and not generated by the cause of karmic maturation alone.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus kyang bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus kyang bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Those derived from karmic maturation are also generated by the homogeneous cause.

original: 'dir yang thogs pa med pa brgyad ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ngo //üîΩde dag @66a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang thogs pa med pa brgyad ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ngo // de dag @66a * //
translated: Here too, the eight unobstructed factors arise from natural outflow and from karmic maturation alone.

original: bsags pa med pa'i phyir rgyas pa las byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsags pa med pa'i phyir rgyas pa las byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not derived from enhancement,üîΩbecause they are not derived from the accumulation of atoms.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are not derived from enhancement, because they are not by nature an accumulation of atoms.üîΩThe others are of three types.

original: gzhan rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag kho na rnam pa gsum yin no zhes bya ba nges par bzung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag kho na rnam pa gsum yin no zhes bya ba nges par bzung ngo //
translated: The others are of three types.

original: de la / rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
analyzed: de la / rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
translated: Karmic maturation and neutral phenomena

original: sems can zhes bya /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya /
translated: are called sentient beings.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa dag kho na yin no //
translated: Because it says this, those that arise from karmic maturation are only those that exist without distinction from the faculties.

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang rgyas pa las byung ba ni dbang po tha dad par 'dug pa dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang rgyas pa las byung ba ni dbang po tha dad par 'dug pa dag kyang yin no //
translated: Those that arise from natural outflow and those that arise from enhancement are also those that exist separately from the faculties.

original: yang dbang po dang tha dad par 'gyur ba dag la yang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yod do zhes bya bar ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: yang dbang po dang tha dad par 'gyur ba dag la yang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yod do zhes bya bar ji ltar shes she na /
translated: Also, how do you know that those that are not different from the faculties arise from natural outflow?

original: shi ba la yang de rjes su 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shi ba la yang de rjes su 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is seen that they continue to exist even when one dies.

original: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But they are not asserted to be derived from karmic maturation, because they are not counted as sentient beings.

original: rdzas dang ldan pa gcig cig kho na rdzas dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: rdzas dang ldan pa gcig cig kho na rdzas dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: It is certain that only one that possesses substance possesses substance.

original: brtan pa'i phyir rdzas so zhes bya ba ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa'i phyir rdzas so zhes bya ba ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Substance means stable, because it does not disintegrate.

original: skad cig ma gcig rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig skal ba mi mnyam pas bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig skal ba mi mnyam pas bskyed pa yin no //
translated: One moment would not arise from natural outflow, because it is generated by dissimilar states.

original: skad cig ma snga ma zag pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir skad cig yin gyi don 'di skad cig ma gzhan du rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba yin par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma zag pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir skad cig yin gyi don 'di skad cig ma gzhan du rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba yin par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: It is momentary because the previous moment is not the uncontaminated nature. But it is not maintained that this object is momentary in the sense that it is destroyed in another moment.

original: de lta ma yin na khams tha ma dag kho na skad cig ma yin no zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i khams rnams ni skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khams tha ma dag kho na skad cig ma yin no zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i khams rnams ni skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then it would follow that only the final elements are momentary, because they are ascertained to be momentary, and the other elements are not momentary.

original: yang ji ltar sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs la yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams cig car du 'byung ba rnam par shes pa gnyis 'phrad par mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs la yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams cig car du 'byung ba rnam par shes pa gnyis 'phrad par mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: How is it that two consciousnesses are not asserted to occur simultaneously in the aggregate of perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering, where the mind element and the mind consciousness element occur simultaneously?

original: de gnyis cig car 'byung ngo zhes ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: de gnyis cig car 'byung ngo zhes ni mi zer ro //
translated: We do not say that those two occur simultaneously.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we say?

original: 'dir rnam par shes pa la khams gnyis nyid du rnam par gzhag te ming gnyis su brjod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par shes pa la khams gnyis nyid du rnam par gzhag te ming gnyis su brjod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, consciousness is posited as two elements and is called by two names.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams yin no zhes bya bar smos @66b so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams yin no zhes bya bar smos @66b so //
translated: Therefore, the mind element and the mind-consciousness element are the mind associated with perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.üîΩThe remaining factors that arise simultaneously with it are the phenomena element.

original: lhag ma de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni chos kyi khams so zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i tshogs de la sems las gzhan pa'i chos lhag ma de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: lhag ma de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni chos kyi khams so zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i tshogs de la sems las gzhan pa'i chos lhag ma de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: The remaining factors that arise simultaneously with that perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering are the phenomena element, which is other than mind.

original: 'di lta ste zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa la sogs pa mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang de dag gi thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa ni chos kyi khams yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa la sogs pa mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang de dag gi thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa ni chos kyi khams yin no //
translated: They are uncontaminated vows, feeling, discernment, intention, and so on that are concomitant with it, as well as their obtainment, arising, and so on.

original: ldan pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni sngar ma thob pa'i thob pa 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ldan pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni sngar ma thob pa'i thob pa 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúobtainment of possession‚Äù means the obtainment of that which was not previously obtained.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yang yin nam zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yang yin nam zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso eye consciousness‚Äù means what?

original: ldan pa thob pa zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ldan pa thob pa zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with the term ‚Äúobtainment of possession.‚Äù

original: so so thob ces bya ba 'dis ni mu dang po dang gnyis pa dag bstan to //
analyzed: so so thob ces bya ba 'dis ni mu dang po dang gnyis pa dag bstan to //
translated: The term ‚Äúindividually‚Äù indicates the first and second possibilities.

original: lhan cig tu yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni mu gsum pa bstan to //
analyzed: lhan cig tu yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni mu gsum pa bstan to //
translated: The term ‚Äúalso together‚Äù indicates the third possibility.

original: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par sla ba'i phyir ma bstan to //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par sla ba'i phyir ma bstan to //
translated: The fourth is not mentioned because it is easy to understand that it is not included in the explanation.

original: yang na yang zhes bya ba'i sgra so so yang ma yin lhan cig kyang ma yin pa yang yod do zhes 'di yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na yang zhes bya ba'i sgra so so yang ma yin lhan cig kyang ma yin pa yang yod do zhes 'di yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: Or the term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that there is a fourth possibility that is neither individually nor together.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na rim gyis mig gi dbang po thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa'i gang zag rim gyis te nur nur po la sogs pa'i rim gyis sam 'chi ba'i rim gyis mig gi dbang po 'thob po //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na rim gyis mig gi dbang po thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa'i gang zag rim gyis te nur nur po la sogs pa'i rim gyis sam 'chi ba'i rim gyis mig gi dbang po 'thob po //
translated: In the desire realm, a person gradually obtains the eye faculty through the stages of kalala and so on, or through the stages of death.

original: gang dang ldan pa yin ci 'dod pa'i khams kho na yin nam zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: gang dang ldan pa yin ci 'dod pa'i khams kho na yin nam zhe na smras pa /
translated: If one possesses the eye element, is it only in the desire realm?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: khyad par med par te 'dod pa dang ldan pa 'ang rung gzugs dang ldan pa 'ang rung 'thob pa na'o //
analyzed: khyad par med par te 'dod pa dang ldan pa 'ang rung gzugs dang ldan pa 'ang rung 'thob pa na'o //
translated: One obtains the eye element without distinction in the desire realm or the form realm.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs sam de bzhin du rim gyis 'chi ba dang mig med pa 'chi ba na mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs sam de bzhin du rim gyis 'chi ba dang mig med pa 'chi ba na mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: One does not possess the eye element in the state of kalala and so on, or when one dies in that way, or when one dies without eyes.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs sam de bzhin du 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na de med pa'i phyir skye mched drug 'byung ba'i gnas skabs sam srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs de'i tshe de dang ldan pa 'thob po //
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs sam de bzhin du 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na de med pa'i phyir skye mched drug 'byung ba'i gnas skabs sam srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs de'i tshe de dang ldan pa 'thob po //
translated: because it does not exist in the state of kalala, etc., or in the state of death.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not obtain the visual consciousness element when one obtains the six sense spheres,

original: 'di ltar 'di ni sngar srid pa bar mar nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe na dge ba dang nyon mongs pa dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de dang ldan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni sngar srid pa bar mar nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe na dge ba dang nyon mongs pa dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de dang ldan pa kho na yin no //
translated: because one is already endowed with it in the past and future when one is in the intermediate existence at the moment of conception in the womb.

original: 'di ni gnas skabs khyad par can gyi dbang du bya ba yin gyi thob pa dang ldan pa thob pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas skabs khyad par can gyi dbang du bya ba yin gyi thob pa dang ldan pa thob pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
translated: This is said with reference to a special state, not with reference to the state of obtaining possession.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i @67a * //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i @67a * //
translated: The visual consciousness element is not obtained when one obtains the eye element,üîΩbecause one is already endowed with it in the past and future when one is in the intermediate existence at the moment of conception in the womb.

original: khams dang yan la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa de la de na mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir de dang sngon mi ldan pa las bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par
analyzed: khams dang yan la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa de la de na mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir de dang sngon mi ldan pa las bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par
translated: The extensive presentation of the elements and sense faculties is as follows:

original: shes pa ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon du byed pa de'i tshe na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: shes pa ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon du byed pa de'i tshe na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob bo //
translated: When those born in the second absorption and so on manifest the unobscured neutral eye consciousness of the first absorption level, since eye consciousness does not exist there, they obtain the eye consciousness element that they did not previously possess.

original: mig gi khams dang ni mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi khams dang ni mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa ma yin te /
translated: They obtain the eye consciousness element but not the eye element,

original: thob zin pa dang 'dra bar ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob zin pa dang 'dra bar ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they obtain the eye consciousness element as if they had already obtained it.

original: de dag nas shi 'phos nas 'og mar skye ba na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag nas shi 'phos nas 'og mar skye ba na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When they die and are reborn in lower levels.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa nas shi 'phos nas 'og ma bsam gtan dang po dang 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba srid pa bar mar nyid mtshams sbyor ba na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can 'das pa dang ma
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa nas shi 'phos nas 'og ma bsam gtan dang po dang 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba srid pa bar mar nyid mtshams sbyor ba na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can 'das pa dang ma
translated: It is possible that when one who has died in the second absorption and so on is reborn in the lower first absorption or desire realm, the virtuous or afflicted eye element of the intermediate existence links with the eye element of the prior existence.üîΩ

original: 'ongs pa dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob po /
analyzed: 'ongs pa dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob po /
translated: It is possible that one who dies in the second absorption and so on and is born in the desire realm or the first absorption links with an intermediate existence and obtains the past and future virtuous and afflicted eye consciousness elements.

original: mig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
translated: But one does not obtain the eye element.

original: thob zin pa bzhin du ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob zin pa bzhin du ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one possesses it as though it had already been obtained.üîΩThere is obtainment of both.

original: gnyi ga dang ldan pa thob pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos pa na sngon mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag dang mi ldan pa las srid pa bar ma nying mtshams sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kho na mig gi khams
analyzed: gnyi ga dang ldan pa thob pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos pa na sngon mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag dang mi ldan pa las srid pa bar ma nying mtshams sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kho na mig gi khams
translated: One who dies in the formless realm and links with the intermediate existence of a desire realm god or a desire realm human possesses the eye element but does not possess the eye consciousness element.

original: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ldan pa 'thob ste srid pa bar ma pa rnams ni dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ldan pa 'thob ste srid pa bar ma pa rnams ni dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin no //
translated: One obtains the virtuous and afflicted eye element that is present in the future and present, because intermediate beings do not have incomplete faculties.

original: gnyi ga dang ma yin pa yod de rnam pa de dag las ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu gsum bshad pa'i chos rnam pa gsum ma gtogs par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga dang ma yin pa yod de rnam pa de dag las ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu gsum bshad pa'i chos rnam pa gsum ma gtogs par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: There is no obtainment of both, because it is not included in those two modes.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba ni gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa ldan pa mi 'thob po //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba ni gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa ldan pa mi 'thob po //
translated: One who dies in the formless realm and is born there does not obtain the obtainment of both.

original: de na ni mi ldan pa nyid yod kyi ldan pa thob pa ni med do //
analyzed: de na ni mi ldan pa nyid yod kyi ldan pa thob pa ni med do //
translated: There is no obtainment of both because there is no obtainment of the obtainment of both.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du mi byed pa yang gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa ldan pa mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du mi byed pa yang gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa ldan pa mi 'thob bo //
translated: One born in the second absorption and so on who does not manifest eye consciousness also does not obtain the obtainment of both.

original: ji lta zhe na mig gi khams dang ni ldan pa 'thob mod kyi mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na mig gi khams dang ni ldan pa 'thob mod kyi mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: How is that? One obtains the eye element, but not the non-possession of the eye element.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni mi ldan mod kyi ldan pa @67b 'thob pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni mi ldan mod kyi ldan pa @67b 'thob pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not obtain the eye consciousness element, but one does not obtain possession of it,

original: de mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not actualized.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni gnas pa mig dang ldan pa cig car shi bas ni srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba cha gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa las ldan pa mi 'thob ste de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni gnas pa mig dang ldan pa cig car shi bas ni srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba cha gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa las ldan pa mi 'thob ste de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who dies simultaneously with the possession of the eye sense faculty in the desire realm does not obtain possession of both parts, i.e., the eye sense faculty and the eye consciousness element, because he is possessed of them.

original: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa nge mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa nge mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one possesses the eye element, does one also possess the eye consciousness element?

original: so so dang // lhan cig tu 'ang 'thob pa yod ces bya ba'i mdo 'di nyid kyis mu bzhi pa 'di yang bsgre bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: so so dang // lhan cig tu 'ang 'thob pa yod ces bya ba'i mdo 'di nyid kyis mu bzhi pa 'di yang bsgre bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This s≈´tra also indicates that the four possibilities should be applied to this.

original: 'thob pa ni rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'thob pa ni rnyed pa yin no //
translated: Obtainment is acquisition.

original: res 'ga' ni brjod par 'dod pa'i sgo nas thob pa tsam la yang bya ste mu bzhi pa'i dang po la ni rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni brjod par 'dod pa'i sgo nas thob pa tsam la yang bya ste mu bzhi pa'i dang po la ni rnyed pa yin no //
translated: In the first alternative, it is obtained.

original: gnyis pa la ni thob pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni thob pa tsam yin no //
translated: In the second, it is merely obtained.

original: mu dang po ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa ni dbang po rnams ma tshang ba ma yin pas mig gi dbang po dang ni gdon mi za bar ldan la /
analyzed: mu dang po ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa ni dbang po rnams ma tshang ba ma yin pas mig gi dbang po dang ni gdon mi za bar ldan la /
translated: The first alternative is when one is born in the second absorption and so on, one is not incomplete in faculties, one definitely possesses the eye faculty,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni mi ldan te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni mi ldan te /
translated: but one does not possess the eye consciousness element,

original: de na med pa'i phyir dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na med pa'i phyir dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist there and because the eye consciousness of the first absorption level is not manifest.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na mig ma thob pa dang nyams pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di la mig ma thob pa 'am nyams pa yod pas mig ma thob pa dang nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na mig ma thob pa dang nyams pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di la mig ma thob pa 'am nyams pa yod pas mig ma thob pa dang nyams pa'o //
translated: The second alternative is when one is born in the desire realm and has not obtained the eye sense faculty or has lost it.

original: mig ma thob pa ni nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: mig ma thob pa ni nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: One who has not obtained the eye sense faculty is in the embryonic states of kalala and so on.

original: mig nyams pa ni mig med par gyur pa ste de ni 'dod pa'i khams na srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba na thob pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang ldan gyi mig gi khams dang ni ma yin te
analyzed: mig nyams pa ni mig med par gyur pa ste de ni 'dod pa'i khams na srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba na thob pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang ldan gyi mig gi khams dang ni ma yin te
translated: Those with impaired eyes are those who have no eyes. They possess virtuous or afflicted eye consciousness obtained in the desire realm when linking in the intermediate existence, but they do not possess the eye element because

original: / de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that does not exist.

original: mig thob pa dang ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la mig thob pa dang ma nyams pa yod pas na mig thob pa dang ma nyams pa ste /
analyzed: mig thob pa dang ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la mig thob pa dang ma nyams pa yod pas na mig thob pa dang ma nyams pa ste /
translated: Those who obtain eyes and do not lose them are those who obtain eyes and do not lose them.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i khams na mig gi khams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i khams na mig gi khams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: They possess the eye element and eye consciousness in the desire realm.

original: de bzhin du sngar thob pa dang / de'i tshe lung du ma bstan pa dang yang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar thob pa dang / de'i tshe lung du ma bstan pa dang yang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, they possess those two that were previously obtained and also those that are neutral at that time.

original: bsam gtan dang por skyes pa yang de gnyis dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang por skyes pa yang de gnyis dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Those born in the first absorption possess those two.

original: de la rang gi sa pa yang gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir la gzhan gyis pa'i mig kyang srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa lta ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsam @68a * //
analyzed: de la rang gi sa pa yang gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir la gzhan gyis pa'i mig kyang srid pa'i phyir ro // bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa lta ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsam @68a * //
translated: Because the eye sense faculty of one's own level definitely exists and because the eye sense faculty of another level is possible.

original: gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste de yang gdon mi za bar 'di gnyis dang ldan no //
analyzed: gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste de yang gdon mi za bar 'di gnyis dang ldan no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone born in the second absorption and so on sees‚Äù means that when the eye consciousness of the first absorption manifests, one definitely possesses both the eye sense faculty and form of the first absorption.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skyed pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skyed pa'o //
translated: The fourth possibility is that which is not included in those, that is, that which is generated in the formless realm.

original: ci rigs par brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba na gang mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin nam gang gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin pa de mig gi khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rigs par brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba na gang mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin nam gang gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin pa de mig gi khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone should investigate as appropriate‚Äù means that if one obtains the eye sense faculty when one does not possess the eye sense faculty, does one also obtain the form element? Or if one obtains the form element, does one also obtain the eye sense faculty?

original: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dag so so dang lhan cig tu yang 'thob pa yod /
analyzed: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dag so so dang lhan cig tu yang 'thob pa yod /
translated: There is acquisition of the eye element and the form element separately and together.

original: re zhig so so ni mig gi khams dang yin la gzugs kyi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: re zhig so so ni mig gi khams dang yin la gzugs kyi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: First, there is acquisition of the eye element but not the form element.

original: rim gyis mig gi dbang po thob pa na'o //
analyzed: rim gyis mig gi dbang po thob pa na'o //
translated: When the eye sense faculty is obtained gradually.

original: gzugs kyi khams dang yin la mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba'i mu 'di ni med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang yin la mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba'i mu 'di ni med do //
translated: There is no possibility of acquisition of the form element but not the eye element.

original: lhan cig tu yang ni gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa ldan pa thob pa yang yod de /
analyzed: lhan cig tu yang ni gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa ldan pa thob pa yang yod de /
translated: There is acquisition of both together when one who is not a possessor obtains them.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang gzags kyi khams su skye ba na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang gzags kyi khams su skye ba na'o //
translated: When one who dies in the formless realm is born in the desire realm or form realm.

original: gnyi ga dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gnyi ga dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is acquisition of neither when one who is a possessor of both obtains them.

original: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: This excludes the above possibilities.

original: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is one who possesses the eye element also a possessor of the form element?

original: tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste re zhig gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de ni gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin no //
analyzed: tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste re zhig gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de ni gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin no //
translated: The first term is to be connected with each of the following terms. One who possesses the eye element also possesses the form element.

original: gzugs kyi khams dang yin la mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang yin la mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod la /
translated: One possesses the form element but not the eye element.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na mig ma thob pa dang mig thob pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na mig ma thob pa dang mig thob pa nyams pa'o //
translated: The embryo in the kalala stage, etc., who has not yet obtained the eye sensefaculty or who has lost the eye sensefaculty.

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin nam /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin nam /
translated: One who does not possess the visual consciousness element but obtains possession of it, does he also obtain possession of the form element?

original: gang gzugs kyi khams dang yin pa de rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi khams dang yin pa de rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or, one who possesses the form element, does he also possess the visual consciousness element?

original: de bzhin du de gnyis ni so so dang / lhan cig tu yang thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du de gnyis ni so so dang / lhan cig tu yang thob pa yang yod do //
translated: In the same way, there is possession of these two elements separately and together.

original: re zhig so so ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yin la gzugs kyi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: re zhig so so ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yin la gzugs kyi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: One possesses the visual consciousness element but not the form element.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa na'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa na'o //
translated: when one who is born in the second absorption, etc., manifests eye consciousness.

original: gzugs kyi khams dang yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa @68b yang yod de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa @68b yang yod de /
translated: There is the eye element but not the eye consciousness element

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba na'o //
translated: when one who has died in the formless realm is born in the second absorption, etc.

original: lhan cig tu yang ni gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa yang yod de /
analyzed: lhan cig tu yang ni gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa yang yod de /
translated: There is simultaneous obtainment of both,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na'o //
translated: when one who has died in the formless realm is born in the desire realm or the Brahma world.

original: gnyi ga dang ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //üîΩgang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnyi ga dang ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o // gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang ma yin nam /
translated: There is neither, when those instances are excluded.üîΩIs one who possesses the eye consciousness element also one who possesses the form element?

original: gang gzugs kyi khams dang yin pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi khams dang yin pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or is one who possesses the form element also one who possesses the eye consciousness element?

original: tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste re zhig gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de ni gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin no //
analyzed: tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste re zhig gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de ni gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin no //
translated: One who obtains the eye constituent also obtains the form constituent.

original: gzugs dang yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gzugs dang yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: One may obtain the form constituent but not the eye constituent.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du mi byed pa na'o /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du mi byed pa na'o /
translated: One born in the second absorption and above who does not manifest eye consciousness.

original: mig dang rnam par shes pa dang gzugs rnams kyi 'thob pa dang ldan pa bsam pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rna ba dang / rnam shes khams dag so so dang // lhan cig tu yang 'thob pa yod //
analyzed: mig dang rnam par shes pa dang gzugs rnams kyi 'thob pa dang ldan pa bsam pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rna ba dang / rnam shes khams dag so so dang // lhan cig tu yang 'thob pa yod //
translated: Just as one should understand the obtainment and possession of the eye, eye consciousness, and form constituents, so too should one understand the obtainment and possession of the ear and ear consciousness constituents.üîΩThe Abhidharmakosa states, ‚ÄúOne obtains the nose and so on individually and also together.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa rna ba dang rnam par shes pa dang sgra'i khams rnams kyi 'thob pa dang ldan pa yang bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa rna ba dang rnam par shes pa dang sgra'i khams rnams kyi 'thob pa dang ldan pa yang bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the obtainment and possession of the nose, nose consciousness, and smell constituents.

original: nang gi bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni gnyi gar nges par bzung ba yin te nges par bzung ba kho nas gzugs la sogs pa gzhan ni phyi'i yin na zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: nang gi bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni gnyi gar nges par bzung ba yin te nges par bzung ba kho nas gzugs la sogs pa gzhan ni phyi'i yin na zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: The twelve internal are ascertained as both, because by the mere ascertainment, it is established that the others, such as form, are external.

original: bdag gi dbang du byas pa ni gang gi'o //
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du byas pa ni gang gi'o //
translated: Those that are made for the self are internal.

original: yang na bdag gi ched du byas pa ni nang gi'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag gi ched du byas pa ni nang gi'o //
translated: Or, those that are made for the sake of the self are internal.

original: yang na nang gi nyid dam mngal yod pas na nang gi'o //
analyzed: yang na nang gi nyid dam mngal yod pas na nang gi'o //
translated: Or, those that are internal themselves, because they contain wombs, are internal.

original: ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba rnams ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten ni bdag yin no zhes bya rtogs par byed de ngar 'dzin pa'i rten ni sems yin pas bdag ces nye bar 'dogs so //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba rnams ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten ni bdag yin no zhes bya rtogs par byed de ngar 'dzin pa'i rten ni sems yin pas bdag ces nye bar 'dogs so //
translated: Because they are the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù means that those who advocate the self understand the self to be the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù because the mind is the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù it is designated as the self.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: smras pa tshigs su bcad pa las /üîΩmkhas pas bdag nyid shin tu ni //
analyzed: smras pa tshigs su bcad pa las / mkhas pas bdag nyid shin tu ni //
translated: It is said in a verse:üîΩThe wise attain heaven

original: dul bas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dul bas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: through complete self-control.

original: yang sems bdag ces bya ba'i sgrar brjod do zhes bya ba yang ji ltar shes she na de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos to /
analyzed: yang sems bdag ces bya ba'i sgrar brjod do zhes bya ba yang ji ltar shes she na de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos to /
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn says, ‚ÄúIn another s≈´tra, it is said:üîΩIn another verse,

original: tshigs su bcad pa gzhan @69a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gzhan @69a * //
translated: it is said:

original: las / sems dul ba ni legs pa ste //
analyzed: las / sems dul ba ni legs pa ste //
translated: A tamed mind is excellent.

original: sems dul bas ni bde ba 'dren //üîΩzhes gsungs so //üîΩdes na don ni chos gang dag nang sems su bya ba 'am nang sems kyi dbang du byas nas rten gyi ngo bor nye bar gyur par 'dug pa de dag ni nang gi yin la gang dag yul gyi ngo bor 'dug pa de dag ni phyi'i yin no
analyzed: sems dul bas ni bde ba 'dren // zhes gsungs so // des na don ni chos gang dag nang sems su bya ba 'am nang sems kyi dbang du byas nas rten gyi ngo bor nye bar gyur par 'dug pa de dag ni nang gi yin la gang dag yul gyi ngo bor 'dug pa de dag ni phyi'i yin no
translated: A tamed mind leads to happiness.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is this: Those phenomena that are internal activities of the mind or that are under the control of the mind and exist as the basis are internal. Those that exist as objects are external.

original: nye bar gyur pa yang ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar gyur pa yang ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúexist‚Äù?

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa de gyur pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa de gyur pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
translated: Because consciousness arises in conformity with them.

original: mig la sogs pa kho na la rnam par shes pa yod par mngon gyi gzugs la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa kho na la rnam par shes pa yod par mngon gyi gzugs la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness exists in the eye and so on, but not in form and so on,

original: 'di ltar sems ni dbang po dang 'brel pa'i lus kyi phyogs na yod par yongs su gcod pa'i yul gyi phyogs na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems ni dbang po dang 'brel pa'i lus kyi phyogs na yod par yongs su gcod pa'i yul gyi phyogs na ni ma yin no //
translated: because the mind is ascertained to exist in the body, which is related to the sense faculties, but not in the object.

original: de lta na 'o na ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: If that is so, then the six elements of consciousness are not tenable,

original: re zhig 'dir rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag ni yul dang dbang po dang dus mnyam pa'i phyir da ltar gyi kho na yin par bzung ste rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni da ltar gyi yul can yin la /
analyzed: re zhig 'dir rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag ni yul dang dbang po dang dus mnyam pa'i phyir da ltar gyi kho na yin par bzung ste rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni da ltar gyi yul can yin la /
translated: because the five elements of consciousness are only present, since their objects, sense faculties, and consciousnesses are simultaneous. The five collections of consciousness are present, since they have present objects.

original: 'dir yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang da ltar gyi kho na yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'dir yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang da ltar gyi kho na yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Here, the element of mental consciousness is also present.

original: gang gi phyir rten yid kyi khams kyang 'das ma thag pa las rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rten yid kyi khams kyang 'das ma thag pa las rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: Because the basis, the mental faculty, is also posited as the immediately past mind element.

original: yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag ni dus kyi bye brag kho na'i sgo nas tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yin pa de'i phyir de dag ni nang gi yin par mi 'gyur te de dag yid kyi khams nyid du ma gyur
analyzed: yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag ni dus kyi bye brag kho na'i sgo nas tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yin pa de'i phyir de dag ni nang gi yin par mi 'gyur te de dag yid kyi khams nyid du ma gyur
translated: The mental element and the mind consciousness element are established as distinct only on the basis of time. Therefore they are not internal because they are not the support of mind.

original: cing 'das pa nyid du ma gyur pa ni sems kyi rten du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cing 'das pa nyid du ma gyur pa ni sems kyi rten du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are not the mental element, they are not the past mental element, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe yin pa de'i tshe yang de dag nyid de dag yin te mtshan nyid las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ci zhig bsgrubs she na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yin pa de'i tshe yang de dag nyid de dag yin te mtshan nyid las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ci zhig bsgrubs she na /
translated: What is established by the statement ‚ÄúWhen they are, they are just those, because they do not transcend their characteristics‚Äù?

original: 'dis ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rten gyi ngo bos nang gi nyid yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi 'di dag kyang rten gyi ngo bo yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rten gyi ngo bos nang gi nyid yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi 'di dag kyang rten gyi ngo bo yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: This establishes that because they are internal by the nature of being the support of future mind, they are also the support of present mind.

original: gal te yang rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'das pa'i dus na yid kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid yod pa gang yin pa de ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus dag na yang
analyzed: gal te yang rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'das pa'i dus na yid kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid yod pa gang yin pa de ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus dag na yang
translated: If you think that the future and present consciousnesses exist in the past, then the past would be the present.

original: yod pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the above passage is that the characteristic of the mental element that exists in the past also exists in the future and present.

original: mtshan @69b nyid ni dus rnams su 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid yongs su 'dor pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan @69b nyid ni dus rnams su 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid yongs su 'dor pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The characteristic does not change in the three times means that its essence is never lost.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni chos zhes bya ba ni rten pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni chos zhes bya ba ni rten pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: The term element is used to indicate that it is associated with support.

original: gang zhig rnam par shes pa gang gi yul du nges la zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul du nges pa nas chos rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yul gyi bar du nges la gal te de la
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par shes pa gang gi yul du nges la zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul du nges pa nas chos rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yul gyi bar du nges la gal te de la
translated: For example, form is ascertained as the object of eye consciousness, up to phenomena being ascertained as the object of mental consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa 'am skye pa'i chos can yin pa yin pa nas gal te de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du skyes pa 'am skye ba'i chos can gyi yul de ni rten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde'i dmigs pa yang rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ma gtogs pa ste rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni rnam
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa 'am skye pa'i chos can yin pa yin pa nas gal te de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du skyes pa 'am skye ba'i chos can gyi yul de ni rten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o // de'i dmigs pa yang rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ma gtogs pa ste rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni rnam
translated: If eye consciousness arises or has the attribute of arising in relation to that, up to if mental consciousness arises or has the attribute of arising in relation to that, that object is called ‚Äúhaving a basis.‚ÄùüîΩIts focal object is all phenomena except for its own nature and its coemergent states.

original: par shes pa de'i dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: par shes pa de'i dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: All phenomena except for its own nature and its coemergent states are the intrinsic reality of the focal object of that consciousness.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir te sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid la sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid kyis reg par 'gyur ba yang med la /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir te sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid la sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid kyis reg par 'gyur ba yang med la /
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to act on itself, the tip of the finger itself does not touch the tip of the finger itself.

original: ral gri'i so so de nyid kyis gcod par 'gyur ba yang med do //
analyzed: ral gri'i so so de nyid kyis gcod par 'gyur ba yang med do //
translated: It is contradictory for something to act on itself, just as the tip of a finger cannot touch itself and a sword cannot cut itself.

original: shin tu nye ba'i phyir de dang lhan cig 'byung ba mtshungs par ldan pa 'am mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa dag kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: shin tu nye ba'i phyir de dang lhan cig 'byung ba mtshungs par ldan pa 'am mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa dag kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it co-existent primary minds and secondary mind since they are too close to each other.

original: mig la yod pa'i mig rtsi ni des mi 'dzin to //üîΩsems kyi skad cig ma de yang sems kyi skad cig ma gzhan gyi dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma snga ma la rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos gang dag dmigs par ma gyur pa de dag kyang dmigs par gyur pas
analyzed: mig la yod pa'i mig rtsi ni des mi 'dzin to // sems kyi skad cig ma de yang sems kyi skad cig ma gzhan gyi dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma snga ma la rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos gang dag dmigs par ma gyur pa de dag kyang dmigs par gyur pas
translated: Eye ointment does not grasp the eye.üîΩAlso, the second moment of consciousness is the focal object of the first moment of consciousness.

original: skad cig ma gnyis kyi dmigs par ni chos thams cad 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis kyi dmigs par ni chos thams cad 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus all phenomena become the focal objects of two moments.

original: de lta bas na chos kyi khams ni rtag tu rten pa dang bcas pa yin te chos kyi khams ni yid kyi kho na yin par nges so //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos kyi khams ni rtag tu rten pa dang bcas pa yin te chos kyi khams ni yid kyi kho na yin par nges so //
translated: Thus the element of mental objects is always associated with a support, and the element of mental objects is definitely only mental.

original: lhag ma ni /üîΩde dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin //
analyzed: lhag ma ni / de dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin //
translated: The restüîΩare both.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that they are also associated with a support.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rten pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dag kho na rten pa dang bcas pa dang mtshungs pa yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //üîΩchos kyi @70a * //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rten pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dag kho na rten pa dang bcas pa dang mtshungs pa yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa yin no // chos kyi @70a * //
translated: This passage determines that only the remaining elements are both associated with a support and similar to it.

original: khams kho na rten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir lhag ma rnams rten pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin pas rten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa dag tu 'grub par 'gyur pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: khams kho na rten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir lhag ma rnams rten pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin pas rten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa dag tu 'grub par 'gyur pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since it is determined that only the element of mental objects is associated with a support, it is not established that the remaining elements are both associated with a support and similar to it.

original: 'grub par mi 'gyur te rten pa dang bcas pa dag kho na ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur mod kyi de dang mtshungs pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur bas de bzlog pa'i phyir lhag ma ni /
analyzed: 'grub par mi 'gyur te rten pa dang bcas pa dag kho na ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur mod kyi de dang mtshungs pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur bas de bzlog pa'i phyir lhag ma ni /
translated: But since it would be only those that are similar to it, in order to reverse that, the root text says,

original: de dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin //
translated: Those that are similar to it are also.

original: zhes bya ba 'di brtsams te rten pa dang bcas pa dag kho na yang ma yin la de dang mtshungs pa dag kho na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di brtsams te rten pa dang bcas pa dag kho na yang ma yin la de dang mtshungs pa dag kho na yang ma yin no //
translated: Those that are associated with support are not only those that are similar to it.

original: gang zhig rang gi las mi byed //
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi las mi byed //
translated: Those that do not perform their own functionüîΩare similar to it.

original: ces bya ba ni de dang mtshungs pa dag yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te de dang mtshungs pa dag ces bya ba'i mjug thogs su bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de dang mtshungs pa dag yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te de dang mtshungs pa dag ces bya ba'i mjug thogs su bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is applied to those that are similar to it. This is explained immediately after the phrase those that are similar to it.

original: gang zhig rang gi las byed pa ni rten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi las mi byed pa de kho na de dang mtshungs pa yin la de dang mtshungs pa kho na rang gi las mi byed pa yin no
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi las byed pa ni rten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi las mi byed pa de kho na de dang mtshungs pa yin la de dang mtshungs pa kho na rang gi las mi byed pa yin no
translated: That which does not perform its own function is just similar to that. That which is just similar to that does not perform its own function.

original: zhes nges par bzung ba dang / don gyi shugs kyis na rang gi las byed pa ni rten pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes nges par bzung ba dang / don gyi shugs kyis na rang gi las byed pa ni rten pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: By the force of the meaning, that which performs its own function is supported.

original: gzugs rnams mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mthong bar 'gyur zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs rnams mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mthong bar 'gyur zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúseeing forms‚Äù should be expressed as ‚Äúthat which will see.‚Äù

original: de lta na de ring 'das pa dang khar rtsang 'das pa dang yang yongs su bsdus par 'gyur gyi de lta ma yin nam khyab pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de ring 'das pa dang khar rtsang 'das pa dang yang yongs su bsdus par 'gyur gyi de lta ma yin nam khyab pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the past of today and the past of yesterday would also be included, and that would not be the case, since the definition of the present is exclusive.

original: yang na ji skad kho nar 'byung ba de ni mtshon pa tsam du zad par blta bar bya ste de ring 'das pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ji skad kho nar 'byung ba de ni mtshon pa tsam du zad par blta bar bya ste de ring 'das pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Or else, just as it is stated, it should be viewed as an illustration, and the past of today should also be mentioned.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi bar la yang rang gi yul la byed pas brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul la rtsal gyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi bar la yang rang gi yul la byed pas brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul la rtsal gyis brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, it should be said that the ear, nose, tongue, and body are engaged in their own objects.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩrna ba gang gis sgra rnams thos pa 'am nyan par 'gyur ba'i rna ba de ni rten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ste thams cad la skyar bar bya'o /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / rna ba gang gis sgra rnams thos pa 'am nyan par 'gyur ba'i rna ba de ni rten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ste thams cad la skyar bar bya'o /
translated: How is that?

original: // / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: The ear by which one hears or listens to sounds is said to be engaged. This should be applied to all.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa dang 'brel ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa dang 'brel ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Conscious and unconscious means connected and not connected with consciousness.

original: gcig gi mig rten pa dang bcas pa de ni @70b thams cad kyi rten pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig gi mig rten pa dang bcas pa de ni @70b thams cad kyi rten pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The eye that is engaged for one is engaged for all.
