original: de dang mtshungs pa rnams kyang de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni gcig gi mig de dang mtshungs pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi de dang mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa rnams kyang de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni gcig gi mig de dang mtshungs pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi de dang mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that whatever is similar to the eye of one is similar to the eye of all.

original: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dri la sogs pa gang dag lhas byin gyi lce'i dbang po la sogs pa dang phrad nas 'dzin pa de dag mchod sbyin gyis mi 'dzin te rang gi sna'i dbang po la sogs pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dri la sogs pa gang dag lhas byin gyi lce'i dbang po la sogs pa dang phrad nas 'dzin pa de dag mchod sbyin gyis mi 'dzin te rang gi sna'i dbang po la sogs pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they apprehend by contact, those smells, etc. that Devadatta apprehends by contact with his tongue faculty, etc. are not apprehended by Yaj√±a because his nose faculty, etc. are located elsewhere.

original: de bas na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because they are not shared in common.

original: 'di dag ni mig la sogs pa bzhin du bsgre ba'i rigs te gcig gi dri rten pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi yin la de dang mtshungs pa yang de bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: 'di dag ni mig la sogs pa bzhin du bsgre ba'i rigs te gcig gi dri rten pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi yin la de dang mtshungs pa yang de bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'i /
translated: It is logical to extend this to smell, etc. in the same way that it was extended to the eye, etc. and it should be said: Whatever smell is possessed of a support for one, it is for all. The same applies to those similar to it.

original: gzugs ji ltar dri la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes ni brjod par mi bya'o //üîΩgcig gi sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba'i dri la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag nyid gzhan dag gis yang yin pa srid pa de ni yod kyi zhes bya ba ni gal te de dag lhas byin gyi sna'i dbang po
analyzed: gzugs ji ltar dri la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes ni brjod par mi bya'o // gcig gi sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba'i dri la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag nyid gzhan dag gis yang yin pa srid pa de ni yod kyi zhes bya ba ni gal te de dag lhas byin gyi sna'i dbang po
translated: But it should not be said that form is like odor and so on.üîΩIt is possible that the same odor, etc.üîΩgenerate nose consciousness, etc. in one person and also in another person.

original: la sogs pa dang phrad par gyur na ni lhas byin gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: la sogs pa dang phrad par gyur na ni lhas byin gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur la /
translated: If they come into contact with Devadatta‚Äôs nose faculty, etc., they generate Devadatta‚Äôs consciousness.

original: ji ste mchod sbyin gyi sna'i dbang po la sogs pa dang phrad na ni mchod sbyin gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ste mchod sbyin gyi sna'i dbang po la sogs pa dang phrad na ni mchod sbyin gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If they come into contact with Yajnadatta‚Äôs nose faculty, etc., they generate Yajnadatta‚Äôs consciousness.

original: yang na gzhan dag gi yang yin zhes bya ba ni de la yod pa'i srin bu phra mo la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang skyed par 'gyur gyi dri la sogs pa de dag gang gis sna'i dbang po la sogs pa dang phrad pa'i lhas byin de
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag gi yang yin zhes bya ba ni de la yod pa'i srin bu phra mo la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang skyed par 'gyur gyi dri la sogs pa de dag gang gis sna'i dbang po la sogs pa dang phrad pa'i lhas byin de
translated: Or else, the sense faculty of another person also generates consciousness, since subtle worms and so on that exist in that object also generate consciousness.

original: kho na'i rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //üîΩdbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun rten pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun rten dang yul dang brten pa'i ngo bor mngon du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: kho na'i rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no // dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun rten pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun rten dang yul dang brten pa'i ngo bor mngon du 'jug pa ste /
translated: But the object such as smell does not generate consciousness of that object alone, such as Devadatta‚Äôs nose consciousness.üîΩThe sense faculty, object, and consciousness mutually support each other.

original: 'di ltar dbang po'i khams dag ni ci rigs par rnam par shes pa'i khams dag gi ni rten gyi ni ngo bor brten te rten par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po'i khams dag ni ci rigs par rnam par shes pa'i khams dag gi ni rten gyi ni ngo bor brten te rten par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The sense element of the eye is the support of the eye consciousness element, and the eye consciousness element is the supported that is supported by the eye element.

original: yul rnams kyi ni yul can gyi ngo bor ro //
analyzed: yul rnams kyi ni yul can gyi ngo bor ro //
translated: The object element is the object of the eye consciousness element.

original: de bzhin du yul gyi khams dag kyang rang gi dbang po'i khams rnams kyi ni yul gyi ngo bor rten to //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul gyi khams dag kyang rang gi dbang po'i khams rnams kyi ni yul gyi ngo bor rten to //
translated: In the same way, the object elements are the object of their own sense faculties.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyi ni yul dang dmigs pa'i ngo bor rten te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyi ni yul dang dmigs pa'i ngo bor rten te /
translated: The consciousness elements are the object and support of the sense faculties and the object elements.

original: de bzhin du @71a * //üîΩrnam par shes pa'i khams dag kyang rang rang gi dbang po'i khams rnams kyi rten can gyi ngo bor rten to //
analyzed: de bzhin du @71a * // rnam par shes pa'i khams dag kyang rang rang gi dbang po'i khams rnams kyi rten can gyi ngo bor rten to //
translated: In the same way,üîΩthe consciousness elements are the support of their own sense faculties.

original: yul gyi khams rnams kyi ni yul can dang dmigs pa can gyi ngo bor rten to //
analyzed: yul gyi khams rnams kyi ni yul can dang dmigs pa can gyi ngo bor rten to //
translated: The object elements are the object and support of the consciousness elements.

original: de bas na phan tshun rten pa ni brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phan tshun rten pa ni brten pa yin no //
translated: Thus, mutual support is support.

original: byed pa rten pa ni brten pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byed pa rten pa ni brten pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Support as function is as follows:

original: byed pa ni mig la sogs pa'i byed pa ni blta ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa ni mig la sogs pa'i byed pa ni blta ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The function of the eye, etc. is seeing, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyi ni rnam par shes par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyi ni rnam par shes par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The function of the consciousness elements is consciousness.

original: yul gyi khams rnams kyi ni de dag gi yul lam dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi khams rnams kyi ni de dag gi yul lam dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: The function of the object elements is to be the object or support of those.

original: byed pa de la brten pa ni brten pa yin te de 'di dag la yod pas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed pa de la brten pa ni brten pa yin te de 'di dag la yod pas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the compound is: they are supported by that which is the basis.

original: 'di ni rab tu bstan pa tsam kho nar zad kyi tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni 'di ltar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu bstan pa tsam kho nar zad kyi tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni 'di ltar bya'o //
translated: This is merely an explanation. The compound should be analyzed as follows:

original: rten pa dang lhan cig 'dug pas rten pa dang bcas pas sam 'di dag la rten pa 'dra ba yod pas 'di dag ni rten pa mtshungs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rten pa dang lhan cig 'dug pas rten pa dang bcas pas sam 'di dag la rten pa 'dra ba yod pas 'di dag ni rten pa mtshungs pa dag yin no //
translated: They are similar in that they have a similar support or they are similar in that they are supported together.

original: 'bras bu reg pa mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ci zhe na //
analyzed: 'bras bu reg pa mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ci zhe na //
translated: What is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúbecause their result is the same contact‚Äù?

original: rten pa dang mtshungs pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rten pa dang mtshungs pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsimilar support‚Äù should be supplied.

original: brten par bya ba yin pas na rten pa ste tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brten par bya ba yin pas na rten pa ste tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the compound is: they are supported because they are that which is supported. The analysis of the compound is the same as before.

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'di rnams kyi 'bras bu sems las byung ba reg pa dran pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'di rnams kyi 'bras bu sems las byung ba reg pa dran pa yin te /
translated: The result of these faculties, objects, and consciousnesses is the mental factor of contact.

original: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o //
translated: The S≈´tra says: Eye and form are the conditions for the arising of visual consciousness.

original: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those that are not supported are similar to those that are supported.üîΩThose that are not supported are similar to those that are supported.üîΩThose that are not supported are similar to those that are supported.üîΩThose that are not supported are similar to those that are supported.

original: gang dag rten pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig la sogs pa rten pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rten pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa de dag dang mtshungsüîΩshing 'dra bas na de dang mtshungs pa yin te 'dir mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dra ba'i don yin no //üîΩmthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba la mthong ba ni dang po nyid du bden pa mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: gang dag rten pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig la sogs pa rten pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rten pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa de dag dang mtshungs shing 'dra bas na de dang mtshungs pa yin te 'dir mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dra ba'i don yin no // mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba la mthong ba ni dang po nyid du bden pa mthong ba yin te /
translated: Those that are not supported are similar to those that are supported.üîΩThose that are not supported are similar to those that are supported.üîΩThose that are not supported are similar to those that are supported.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma bco lngas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma bco lngas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Those that are not supported are similar to those that are supported.üîΩThose that are not supported are similar to those that are supported.

original: bsgom pa ni de nyid la yang dang yang du lta ba yin no //üîΩyang na bsgom pa ni 'jig rten pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni de nyid la yang dang yang du lta ba yin no //üîΩyang na bsgom pa ni 'jig rten pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa yin no //

original: bcu ni bsgom pas spang bya yin //
analyzed: bcu ni bsgom pas spang bya yin //
translated: The ten are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩThe five are also that,

original: lnga yang yin te zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu dang de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga @71b yin no //
analyzed: lnga yang yin te zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu dang de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga @71b yin no //
translated: The ten physical elements and the five consciousness elements that are their results are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that only those are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation?üîΩBecause it says, ‚ÄúThe final three are threefold,‚Äù the fifteen elements that are other than the final three are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: tha ma'i gsum rnam gsum zhes 'byung ba'i phyir tha ma'i gsum las gzhan pa ni khams bco lnga yin no zhes bya ba yin te de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ngo //
analyzed: tha ma'i gsum rnam gsum zhes 'byung ba'i phyir tha ma'i gsum las gzhan pa ni khams bco lnga yin no zhes bya ba yin te de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ngo //
translated: The term also indicates that they are definitely objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: rnam pa gsum sta  zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum sta  zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The term threefold indicates that they are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, and not objects to be abandoned.

original: de dag kho na rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: de dag kho na rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: They are only threefold.

original: phra rgyas brgyad bcu rtsa brgyad dang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba la phra rgyas ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: phra rgyas brgyad bcu rtsa brgyad dang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba zhes bya ba la phra rgyas ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The eighty-eight proclivities and those that are associated with them. The proclivities are the afflicted view of self, etc.

original: de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni rnam par shes pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa de dag gi mtshan nyid dang rjes kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni rnam par shes pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa de dag gi mtshan nyid dang rjes kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no //
translated: Those that are associated with them are the associated factors of consciousness, sensation, etc., and the dissociated factors of the characteristics of the conditioned, etc.

original: de dag gi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The acquisition of those, together with their following.

original: de dag ces bya ba'i sgra ni phra rgyas la sogs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba'i sgra ni phra rgyas la sogs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúthose‚Äù is connected with the proclivities, etc.

original: phra rgyas de dag dang / de ngag dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyis thob pa dag yin no //
analyzed: phra rgyas de dag dang / de ngag dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyis thob pa dag yin no //
translated: The acquisition of those proclivities and of those that are associated with them.

original: thob pa dag dang phra rgyas dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin mod kyi thams cad ni ma yin te //
analyzed: thob pa dag dang phra rgyas dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin mod kyi thams cad ni ma yin te //
translated: Although the acquisition is associated with the proclivities and with those that are associated with them, it is not with all of them.

original: thob pa kha cig ni phra rgyas la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin te lhan cig skyes pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa kha cig ni phra rgyas la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin te lhan cig skyes pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: Some acquisitions arise simultaneously with the negative tendencies and so on, which are those that arise simultaneously.

original: kha cig ni de dag pas snga ma dang 'phyi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig ni de dag pas snga ma dang 'phyi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Some arise earlier or later than those.

original: de'i phyir thob pa logs shig tu smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thob pa logs shig tu smos so //
translated: Therefore, acquisition is mentioned separately.

original: rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba smos pas ni rjes kyi thob pa dag dang de dag gi mtshan nyid dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba smos pas ni rjes kyi thob pa dag dang de dag gi mtshan nyid dag bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äútogether with their following‚Äù includes subsequent acquisitions and their characteristics.üîΩThe remaining contaminated ones are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa lhag ma rnams ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no zhes bya ba ni khams tha ma gsum po de dag nyid mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams las gzhan pa zag pa dang bcas pa lhag ma gang dag yin pa
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa lhag ma rnams ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no zhes bya ba ni khams tha ma gsum po de dag nyid mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams las gzhan pa zag pa dang bcas pa lhag ma gang dag yin pa
translated: The remaining contaminated states that are different from those to be abandoned by the path of seeing in the three final realms

original: de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: phra rgyas bcu dang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams dang de dag gis thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa rnams te dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang 'du byed ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang rnam par rig
analyzed: phra rgyas bcu dang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams dang de dag gis thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa rnams te dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang 'du byed ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang rnam par rig
translated: The ten negative tendencies, those that arise simultaneously with them, those that are obtained by them and those that are concomitant with them, those that are virtuous and contaminated, unobscured neutral compositional factors and the unconditioned are not objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩ

original: byed ma yin pa'i gzugs zag pa dang bcas pa rjes su 'brang @72a * //üîΩba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: byed ma yin pa'i gzugs zag pa dang bcas pa rjes su 'brang @72a * // ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The ten negative tendencies, that which arises simultaneously with them, that which is obtained by them, and that which is concomitant with them, that is, all contaminated virtuous phenomena, unobscured neutral compositional factors, and uncontaminated form that is concomitant with them.üîΩUncontaminated states are not objects to be abandoned.

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag go zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa dang 'dus ma byas kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag go zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa dang 'dus ma byas kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The truth of the path and the nature of unconditioned states are uncontaminated states.üîΩAre there other phenomena that are not objects to be abandoned?

original: spang bar bya ba gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni so so'i skye bo nyid kyang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nang du gtogs
analyzed: spang bar bya ba gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni so so'i skye bo nyid kyang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nang du gtogs
translated: Ordinary beings are also unobscured neutral compositional factors and they are included in objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: la ngan song bar 'gyur ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyang gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin par bshad pas /üîΩde'i phyir gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag /'phags pa'i lam dang 'gal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: la ngan song bar 'gyur ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyang gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin par bshad pas / de'i phyir gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag /'phags pa'i lam dang 'gal ba'i phyir //
translated: Also, physical and verbal karma that would lead to the lower realms is explained as being objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation because it is the intrinsic reality of form.üîΩTherefore the Vatsiputrƒ´ya school argues:

original: zhes rgol bar byed de /
analyzed: zhes rgol bar byed de /
translated: Because it contradicts the ƒÅrya path,

original: so so'i skye bo nyid kyang 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa na med la ngan song bar nges pa'i las yod na yang 'phags pa'i lam mi skye'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid kyang 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa na med la ngan song bar nges pa'i las yod na yang 'phags pa'i lam mi skye'o //
translated: because the state of an ordinary being does not exist when the ƒÅrya path arises, and because if karma certain to lead to the lower realms exists, the ƒÅrya path does not arise.

original: 'phags pa'i lam skyes na ni ngan song ba'i las kyang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam skyes na ni ngan song ba'i las kyang mi 'byung ste /
translated: If the ƒÅrya path arises, karma leading to the lower realms does not occur.

original: de lta bas na gnyi ga 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes rjod par byed de /
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyi ga 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes rjod par byed de /
translated: Therefore both are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, like the afflicted view of the self and so on.

original: de dgag pa'i phyir 'di bshad zin kyang bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mdor bsdus nas yang /
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir 'di bshad zin kyang bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mdor bsdus nas yang /
translated: Although this has already been explained, it is summarized here for easy understanding.

original: nyon mongs can min mthong spang min //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min mthong spang min //
translated: Nonafflictive states are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gzugs min drug pa min skyes min //
analyzed: gzugs min drug pa min skyes min //
translated: The sixth is not form, nor is it arisen from that which is not form.

original: zhes bya ba brjod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod de /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: mthong ba ni mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mthong ba yin no //
translated: That which is seen is seeing.

original: nyon mongs can min pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin te mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin te mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is not defiled is either unobscured-indeterminate or virtuous and contaminated. It is not abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gzugs ni nyon mongs can yin yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni nyon mongs can yin yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Form is defiled but is not abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: drug pa min skyes ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: drug pa min skyes ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga las skyes pa yin te /
translated: That which is arisen from that which is not the sixth is arisen from the five collections of consciousness.

original: de ni gzugs ma yin zhing nyon mongs pa can yin yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzugs ma yin zhing nyon mongs pa can yin yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: That is not form and is defiled but is not abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'di las gzhan ji skad bshad pa lta bu ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan ji skad bshad pa lta bu ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is other than this, as has been explained, is not abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin te dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin te dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun
translated: The state of an ordinary being is a nonvirtuous neutral state, because those who have severed their root of virtue and those who are free from attachment possess it.

original: tu chad pa rnams ni chos dge ba dag dang mi ldan par 'dod la so so'i skye bo nyid dang mi ldan @72b te /
analyzed: tu chad pa rnams ni chos dge ba dag dang mi ldan par 'dod la so so'i skye bo nyid dang mi ldan @72b te /
translated: Those who have severed their root of virtue are not said to possess virtuous states, but they are not said to be devoid of the state of an ordinary being.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni so so'i skye bo yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni so so'i skye bo yin par 'dod do //
translated: For they are considered to be ordinary beings.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni so so'i skye bo nyid ni dge ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni so so'i skye bo nyid ni dge ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the state of an ordinary being is not virtuous.

original: de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a nonvirtuous state because those who are free from attachment possess it.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi dngos po ni ngo bo nyid kyis spong bar 'dod de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi dngos po ni ngo bo nyid kyis spong bar 'dod de /
translated: For it is maintained that the nature of a nonvirtuous state is abandoned by its intrinsic nature.

original: thob pa bcad par spong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thob pa bcad par spong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with the abandonment of the obtainment of a nonvirtuous state.

original: gal te so so'i skye bo nyid de nyon mongs pa can zhig yin phar gyur na 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la de'i thob pa chad pas de dang mi ldan pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te so so'i skye bo nyid de nyon mongs pa can zhig yin phar gyur na 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la de'i thob pa chad pas de dang mi ldan pa zhig na /
translated: If ordinary beings were afflicted, then those who are free from mundane attachment would not possess it, because they would have eliminated the obtainment of that.

original: de dag de dang ldan par yang 'dod de //
analyzed: de dag de dang ldan par yang 'dod de //
translated: But it is accepted that they possess it.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag ni so so skye bo kho na yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag ni so so skye bo kho na yin par 'dod do //
translated: Because it is accepted that those who are free from mundane attachment are ordinary beings.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa nyid cig yin na ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa nyid cig yin na ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If it were non-afflicted neutral, there would be no fault.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong bar 'dod de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong bar 'dod de /
translated: Non-afflicted means abandoning attachment that is desire.

original: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa gcod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa gcod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that they eliminate the obtainment of affliction that focuses on that.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi thog pa gcod par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi thog pa gcod par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But it is not accepted that they eliminate the obtainment of that nature.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gzugs la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de spongs shig 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs nas de lta na khyed kyis gzugs spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gzugs la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de spongs shig 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs nas de lta na khyed kyis gzugs spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said, ‚ÄúMonks, abandon desire and attachment for form. If you abandon desire and attachment, then you abandon form.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de dag gi so so'i skye bo nyid nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa spangs kyang mig la sogs pa bzhin du kun tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi so so'i skye bo nyid nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa spangs kyang mig la sogs pa bzhin du kun tu 'byung ste /
translated: even though they abandon the non-afflicted neutral state of being an ordinary being, it arises again like the eyes and so on.

original: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore they possess it.üîΩWhy is being an ordinary being not abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: yang ci'i phyir so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin la lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin la lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin
translated: Because it is non-afflicted neutral. Why is the action of body and speech not abandoned by the path of seeing?üîΩBecause it is form.

original: zhe na / bden pa dag la log par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhe na / bden pa dag la log par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is not wrongly conceived in relation to the four truths.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pas skyon can du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dag la log par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pas skyon can du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dag la log par mi rtog ste /
translated: Ordinary beings do not wrongly engage the truths of suffering, etc., because they are not afflicted by the afflictions and because they do not objectify them.

original: phyin ci log gi ngo bor mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi ngo bor mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they do not engage them in the form of error.

original: lus dang ngag gi las kyang dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis log par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las kyang dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis log par mi rtog ste /
translated: Also, the actions of body and speech do not wrongly engage them because they are not objectified.

original: de lta bas na gnyi ga mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyi ga mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, both are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: bden pa dag la log @73a * //
analyzed: bden pa dag la log @73a * //
translated: Because they do not wrongly engage the truths.

original: par mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni drug pa ma yin pa las skyes pa la yang bsgre bar bya'o //
analyzed: par mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni drug pa ma yin pa las skyes pa la yang bsgre bar bya'o //
translated: This reason should be extended to that which is not derived from the sixth.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa na so so'i skye bo nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur pa'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rgyu bsdu ba 'di ni so so skye bo nyid kho na mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa bzlog pa'i phyir brjod
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa na so so'i skye bo nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur pa'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rgyu bsdu ba 'di ni so so skye bo nyid kho na mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa bzlog pa'i phyir brjod
translated: and it would also follow that ordinary beings would be abandoned by perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: pa yin te /
analyzed: pa yin te /
translated: This is stated to refute the idea that ordinary beings are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: lus dang ngag gi las dang ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las dang ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not related to physical and verbal karma.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa na so so'i skye bo nyid kyi thob pa 'chad kyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa na so so'i skye bo nyid kyi thob pa 'chad kyi /
translated: When one obtains perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, the obtainment of ordinary being is severed.

original: 'gags par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: 'gags par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: The path that causes cessation

original: de'i sgrib pa rab tu spong //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa rab tu spong //
translated: completely abandons its obscurations.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir chad zin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir chad zin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it is not already ceased,

original: des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa bzhin no //
translated: like the obtainment of affliction to be abandoned by it.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pas na ni de'i thob pa chad pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pas na ni de'i thob pa chad pa yin no //
translated: When one obtains Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, the obtainment of ordinary being is severed.

original: des na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i gnas skabs na de'i thob pa yod pa'i phyir gang zag de so so'i skye bo nyid yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i gnas skabs na de'i thob pa yod pa'i phyir gang zag de so so'i skye bo nyid yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, since the obtainment of the state of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering exists at that time, that person would be an ordinary being.

original: 'di ni de'i gnas skabs na 'phags pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i gnas skabs na 'phags pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par yang mi nus so //
translated: But it is not possible to posit that one who obtains the ƒÅrya path at that time is an ordinary being.

original: 'di ltar so so'i skye bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar so so'i skye bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The definition of an ordinary being is this:

original: so so'i skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is an ordinary being?üîΩIt is the nonobtainment of ƒÅrya dharmas.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba yin la ma thob pa de yang 'phags pa'i chos rnams thob nas ldog ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba yin la ma thob pa de yang 'phags pa'i chos rnams thob nas ldog ste /
translated: That nonobtainment ceases when ƒÅrya dharmas are obtained.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni 'phags pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni 'phags pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore this person is an ƒÅrya.

original: re zhig bye brag tu smra ba khyed rnams la 'di dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig bye brag tu smra ba khyed rnams la 'di dri bar bya ste /
translated: First, this question should be asked of you VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas:

original: ci so so'i skye bo nyid de bsgom pa'i lam thob pa kho nas spong bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci so so'i skye bo nyid de bsgom pa'i lam thob pa kho nas spong bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Is that ordinary being abandoned only by obtaining the path of meditation?

original: smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa ma yin te /
translated: They reply: No.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i bar sa dgu pa yin la de yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i bar sa dgu pa yin la de yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yin no //
translated: Ordinary beingship is of nine levels, from the level of the desire realm up to the peak of cyclic existence, and it is not afflicted.

original: des na so so'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu pa spong ba'i phyir gnas skabs na spong bar 'gyur te zag pa dang bcas pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa thams cad ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa kho na la spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na so so'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu pa spong ba'i phyir gnas skabs na spong bar 'gyur te zag pa dang bcas pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa thams cad ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa kho na la spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is abandoned by the state of the ninth stage of abandonment of the nine aspects of affliction. All contaminated states that are not afflicted are abandoned by the ninth liberated path alone.

original: gal te de lta na 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gnas skabs na 'phags pa so so'i skye bo yin par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gnas skabs na 'phags pa so so'i skye bo yin par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then in the state of not being free from attachment, ƒÅryas would be ordinary beings.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par @73b nyams pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa phan chad de rnam par nyams pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par @73b nyams pa'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa phan chad de rnam par nyams pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: That is not so, because ordinary beingship is lost.

original: spang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is lost after the perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering, but it is not abandoned.

original: rnam par nyams pa dang spang ba dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa dang spang ba dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between degeneration and abandonment?

original: rnam par nyams pa ni thob pa chad pa yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa ni thob pa chad pa yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Degeneration is the termination of acquisition.

original: spangs pa ni gnyen po thob pa yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: spangs pa ni gnyen po thob pa yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Abandonment is the acquisition of an antidote.

original: de lta bas na thob pa chad pas so so'i skye bo nyid de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs na 'phags pa kho na yin gyi so so'i skye bo ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do //üîΩmig dang chos kyi khams phyogs ni //
analyzed: de lta bas na thob pa chad pas so so'i skye bo nyid de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs na 'phags pa kho na yin gyi so so'i skye bo ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do // mig dang chos kyi khams phyogs ni //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault, because at that time, he is only an ƒÅrya, not an ordinary being, since he is not endowed with ordinary beinghood, which is terminated by the acquisition of the ƒÅrya state.üîΩThe eye and part of the phenomena elementüîΩare view.

analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'jig rten pa nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lta ba dag gis chos la lta'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba ni 'jig rten la yod pas na 'jig rten pa'o
translated: The extensive explanation of the above verse up to ‚ÄúOne views phenomena through mundane afflicted and unafflicted, learner and nonlearner views‚Äù is as follows: Mundane means that which exists in the world.

original: ji ltar @74a * //

original: mi gsal zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi gsal zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: ji ltar sprin dang bcas pa'i nyin mo gzugs la lta ba de bzhin du slob pa'i lta bas chos la lta ba yin te /
translated: Just as one sees forms on a cloudy day, so one sees phenomena with the view of one in training.

analyzed: ji ltar sprin med pa'i nyin mo gzugs la lta ba de bzhin du mi slob pa'i lta bas chos la lta ba yin te /
translated: Just as one sees forms on a cloudless day, so one sees phenomena with the view of one beyond training.

translated: Because it is nonconceptual, mental wisdom that is concomitant with attachment, etc., is afflicted.

analyzed: dang lhan cig tu zhes bya ba smras te / ji ltar mig bsgribs pa la 'jug pa med par rung ba ltar rnam par shes pa yang rten dang lhan cig yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir mi skye bar rung ste rnam par shes pa 'jug pa med do //
translated: together with its support.üîΩJust as it is possible for the eye to engage without being obstructed, it is possible for consciousness to arise together with its support, since it engages the same object.üîΩSince the object of the eye is also the object of consciousness, it is possible for consciousness to arise when the object of the eye is obstructed.

original: mig gi yul bsgribs pa'i don gang yin par gyur pa de nyid rnam par shes pa'i yang yin pas rnam par shes pa yang mi skye bar rung gi rnam par shes par smra ba khyed kyi ltar na ni rnam par shes pa thogs pa med pa yin pas
analyzed: mig gi yul bsgribs pa'i don gang yin par gyur pa de nyid rnam par shes pa'i yang yin pas rnam par shes pa yang mi skye bar rung gi rnam par shes par smra ba khyed kyi ltar na ni rnam par shes pa thogs pa med pa yin pas
translated: But according to you, who assert that consciousness is unobstructed, it is impossible for consciousness to arise when the object of the eye is obstructed.

original: bsgribs pa la yang rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na skye bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgribs pa la yang rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na skye bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: and consciousness would arise even when it is obstructed, but it does not arise.

original: de lta bas na mig gis mthong gi rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na mig gis mthong gi rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore it is established that the eye sees, but consciousness does not.üîΩHaving refuted the Proponents of Consciousness in this way, the master now takes their position and says,

original: de ltar rnam par shes par smra ba bkag pa dang slob dpon gyis de'i phyogs bzung nas mig kyang lus kyi dbang po bzhin du yul dang phrad pa zhig yin nam ci lhag ce na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes par smra ba bkag pa dang slob dpon gyis de'i phyogs bzung nas mig kyang lus kyi dbang po bzhin du yul dang phrad pa zhig yin nam ci lhag ce na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Is the eye also like the body faculty, which contacts its object?

original: ji ltar lus kyi dbang po yul dang phrad pa rtsig pa la sogs pa la @75a * //
analyzed: ji ltar lus kyi dbang po yul dang phrad pa rtsig pa la sogs pa la @75a * //
translated: Just as the body faculty contacts its object,üîΩbut does not apprehend objects obstructed by walls and so on because it is obstructed by walls and so on,

original: thogs pas de phan chad du 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i yul mi 'dzin pa de bzhin du mig kyang yul dang phrad cing rtsig pa la sogs pa'i thogs pas thogs par gyur la de phan chad du 'gro bar mi 'gyur
analyzed: thogs pas de phan chad du 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i yul mi 'dzin pa de bzhin du mig kyang yul dang phrad cing rtsig pa la sogs pa'i thogs pas thogs par gyur la de phan chad du 'gro bar mi 'gyur
translated: in the same way, the eye also contacts its object and is obstructed by walls and so on.

original: bas rtsig pa la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i yul mi 'dzin pa zhig yin nam ci /
analyzed: bas rtsig pa la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i yul mi 'dzin pa zhig yin nam ci /
translated: Or does it not apprehend objects obscured by walls and so on?

original: de ni rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rung ba ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mig gis bsgribs pa mi mthong ngo zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mig gis bsgribs pa mi mthong ngo zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: it is not correct to say that the eye does not see obscured form because it encounters physical resistance.üîΩHow could one see form obscured by glass, mica, crystal, or water?

original: mching bu dang lhang tsher dang shel dang chu dag gis bar du chod pa yang ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni mching bu dang lhang tsher dang shel dang chus bar du chod cing bsgribs pa'i gzugs kyang ji ltar mthong ste /
analyzed: mching bu dang lhang tsher dang shel dang chu dag gis bar du chod pa yang ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni mching bu dang lhang tsher dang shel dang chus bar du chod cing bsgribs pa'i gzugs kyang ji ltar mthong ste /
translated: How could one see form obscured and covered by glass, mica, crystal, or water?

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa bzhin mching bu la sogs pas chod pa yang mig gis mthong bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa bzhin mching bu la sogs pas chod pa yang mig gis mthong bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Since it encounters physical resistance, just as form covered by walls and so on is not seen, form covered by glass and so on would not be seen by the eye.

original: de ni grub pa'i mtha' las mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni grub pa'i mtha' las mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: But it is said in the philosophical treatises that it is seen.

original: gang du snang ba la gegs med na zhes bya ba ni snang ba yod na yul snang bar gyur pa yin pas rnam par shes pa skye ba srid de rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni 'di skad du mig gi dbang po ma nyams pa yin yul snang bar
analyzed: gang du snang ba la gegs med na zhes bya ba ni snang ba yod na yul snang bar gyur pa yin pas rnam par shes pa skye ba srid de rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni 'di skad du mig gi dbang po ma nyams pa yin yul snang bar
translated: if there is appearance, the object appears. Therefore, it is possible for consciousness to arise. The cause of consciousness is stated in the following:üîΩThe unimpaired eye faculty, the appearance of the object,

original: gyur pa yin te de las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩde'i phyir mching bu la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i gzugs de med la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid la gang la mching bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa rtsig pa la sogs pa thibs po can dag gis gegs yod pa'i bsgribs pa
analyzed: gyur pa yin te de las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo // de'i phyir mching bu la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i gzugs de med la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid la gang la mching bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa rtsig pa la sogs pa thibs po can dag gis gegs yod pa'i bsgribs pa
translated: and the attention that arises from that are present.üîΩTherefore, form that is obscured by glass and so on does not exist, but eye consciousness arises.

original: de la ni mi skye'o //
analyzed: de la ni mi skye'o //
translated: That which is obscured by something else, such as a wall, which is not the nature of glass and so on, does not arise.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is eye consciousness.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir bsgribs pa mi mthong ste khyed kyis ci ste mi skye zhes rgyu dris pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu ni 'di yin par smra'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir bsgribs pa mi mthong ste khyed kyis ci ste mi skye zhes rgyu dris pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu ni 'di yin par smra'o //
translated: Because it is unarisen, it does not see the obscured. You asked, ‚ÄúWhy is it unarisen?‚Äù We say that is its cause.

original: 'o na gang mdo las mig gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas mtshan mar 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhing mngon rtags su 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na gang mdo las mig gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas mtshan mar 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhing mngon rtags su 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBut in the sutra it says ‚Äòthe eye sees‚Äô and so on,‚Äù it is said in detail that ‚Äúhaving seen forms with the eye, one does not grasp them as signs and does not grasp them as causes for conceiving.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mig gis mthong ba de'i phyir gang zag gi mig gis mthong ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig gis mthong ba de'i phyir gang zag gi mig gis mthong ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Because the eye sees, it is thought that the person sees with the eye.

original: slob dpon gyis der ni @75b dgongs pa ni de la brten te zhes bya ba 'di yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis der ni @75b dgongs pa ni de la brten te zhes bya ba 'di yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The Master says, ‚ÄúThe intention there is that it is based on that,‚Äù and so on.

original: der ni dgongs pa ni mig la brten te zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: der ni dgongs pa ni mig la brten te zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The intention there is that it is based on the eye.

original: mig la brten te rnam par shes pas mthong nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig la brten te rnam par shes pas mthong nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that having seen with consciousness based on the eye.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know?

original: dper na yid kyi chos rnams rnam par shes par byas nas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dper na yid kyi chos rnams rnam par shes par byas nas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For example, it is said, ‚ÄúHaving cognized mental phenomena with the mind.‚Äù

original: yid la brten te yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par byas nas shes par bya ba yin gyi 'das ma thag pa'i yid kyis ni chos rnams rnam par mi shes pa ni da ltar gyi gnas skabs na bya ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yid la brten te yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par byas nas shes par bya ba yin gyi 'das ma thag pa'i yid kyis ni chos rnams rnam par mi shes pa ni da ltar gyi gnas skabs na bya ba byed pa yin no //
translated: Mental phenomena are cognized by the mental consciousness that is supported by the mind. They are not cognized by the mind that has just passed away. This is because the mind that is present in the present time period performs a function.üîΩAlternatively, the action of that which is supported is figuratively assigned to the support.

original: yang na brten pa'i las rten la nye bar btags pa yin te zhes bya ba ni brten pa rnam par shes pa'i las mthong ba rten mig la nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na brten pa'i las rten la nye bar btags pa yin te zhes bya ba ni brten pa rnam par shes pa'i las mthong ba rten mig la nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: The action of the consciousness that is supported is figuratively assigned to the eye, which is its support.

original: rnam par shes pas mthong ba la mig gis mthong ngo zhes nye bar btags pa yin no //üîΩdper na khri'u dag 'bod do zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas mthong ba la mig gis mthong ngo zhes nye bar btags pa yin no // dper na khri'u dag 'bod do zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is as if the consciousness were seeing, that the eye sees.üîΩFor example, it is as if one were to say, ‚ÄúThe seats are crying out.‚Äù

original: dper na khri'u la 'dug pa'i mi dag 'bod pa la khri'u dag 'bod do zhes nye bar 'dogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na khri'u la 'dug pa'i mi dag 'bod pa la khri'u dag 'bod do zhes nye bar 'dogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, when people who are seated on seats cry out, it is as if the seats were crying out.

original: ji ltar mdo las mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis phyogs kyang mig gis ni rnam par mi shes so //üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo las mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis phyogs kyang mig gis ni rnam par mi shes so // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The Vaibhasikas do not assert that the eye consciousness cognizes,

original: rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: but rather that consciousness cognizes.

original: 'on kyang mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs sdug pa rnams zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs sdug pa rnams zhes gsungs te /
translated: However, the sutra states: ‚ÄúBeautiful forms are cognized by the eye consciousness.‚Äù

original: der ni gdon mi za bar brten pa'i las rten la brjod pa yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: der ni gdon mi za bar brten pa'i las rten la brjod pa yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the eye is the basis of the action of seeing.üîΩThe sutra also states: ‚ÄúThe eye is the door for seeing forms.‚Äù

original: gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la sgo yin no zhes kyang gsungs te zhes bya ba ni sgo dang 'dra bas na sgo yin te rgyu dang rten yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la sgo yin no zhes kyang gsungs te zhes bya ba ni sgo dang 'dra bas na sgo yin te rgyu dang rten yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: The eye is like a door, since it is the cause and basis of seeing.

original: lung 'dis ni mig gi sgo nas rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes de la brten to zhes bshad pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid gzhung 'dzugs par byed pa yin no //üîΩder ni lta ba la sgo zhes bya bar zad do zhes bya ba na bram ze mig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lung 'dis ni mig gi sgo nas rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes de la brten to zhes bshad pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid gzhung 'dzugs par byed pa yin no // der ni lta ba la sgo zhes bya bar zad do zhes bya ba na bram ze mig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This passage establishes the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúIt sees by means of the eye,‚Äù which means ‚ÄúIt is supported by the eye.‚Äù

original: gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la sgo yin no zhes kyang gsungs te zhes bya ba 'dir ro //
analyzed: gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la sgo yin no zhes kyang gsungs te zhes bya ba 'dir ro //
translated: ‚Äú There it is merely the eye that is the door of seeing‚Äù means that the Buddha also said, ‚ÄúBrahmin, the eye is the door for seeing visible forms.‚Äù

original: mig ni gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la lta ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir tshig tu mi rung bas mi rung ngo zhes bya bar @76a * //
analyzed: mig ni gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la lta ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir tshig tu mi rung bas mi rung ngo zhes bya bar @76a * //
translated: ‚Äú It is not tenable to say that the eye sees visible forms‚Äù means that it is not tenable to say that the eye sees visible forms.

original: bsams pa'o // gal te 'dis lta bas na mthong ba'o zhes byed pa yin pa 'am lta bar byed pas na byad pa po yin pa 'am lta ba'i phyir zhes ngo bo sgrub pa yin yang mthong ba ni lta ba yin pas mthong ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ji
analyzed: bsams pa'o // gal te 'dis lta bas na mthong ba'o zhes byed pa yin pa 'am lta bar byed pas na byad pa po yin pa 'am lta ba'i phyir zhes ngo bo sgrub pa yin yang mthong ba ni lta ba yin pas mthong ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ji
translated: If the word ‚Äúseeing‚Äù is the verbal action of the verb ‚Äúto see,‚Äù or if it is the agent of the verb ‚Äúto see,‚Äù or if it is the meaning of the verb ‚Äúto see,‚Äù how can it be said that ‚Äúseeing is seeing because of that‚Äù?

original: ltar rung / 'di ltar mig las ma gtogs pa'i mthong ba ni med do //
analyzed: ltar rung / 'di ltar mig las ma gtogs pa'i mthong ba ni med do //
translated: In fact, there is no seeing apart from the eye.

original: gal te lta bar byed pa yin no snyam na rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa med de /
analyzed: gal te lta bar byed pa yin no snyam na rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa med de /
translated: If it is thought that the eye sees, then apart from consciousness there is no seeing.

original: rnam par shes pa kho na lta bar byed pa yin gyi 'di las gzhan yod par ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kho na lta bar byed pa yin gyi 'di las gzhan yod par ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: Consciousness alone sees, and apart from that there is no seeing.

original: gal te don mig ni gzugs rnams blta bar bya zhing rnam par shes par bya ba la sgo dang khung yin no zhes bya bar bzung na de ni rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te don mig ni gzugs rnams blta bar bya zhing rnam par shes par bya ba la sgo dang khung yin no zhes bya bar bzung na de ni rung ngo //
translated: If it is thought that the eye is the door for seeing visible forms and for the arising of visual consciousness, that is acceptable.

original: dper na shes rab 'ga' zhig la mthong ba zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: dper na shes rab 'ga' zhig la mthong ba zhes kyang bya /
translated: For example, wisdom is called ‚Äúseeing‚Äù and ‚Äúthe seer.‚Äù

original: rab tu shes pa zhes kyang bya zhes bya ba'i nye bar bkod pa 'dis ni mthong ba dang rnam par shes pa dag don gyi ngo bo gzhan ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu shes pa zhes kyang bya zhes bya ba'i nye bar bkod pa 'dis ni mthong ba dang rnam par shes pa dag don gyi ngo bo gzhan ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This supplementary statement ‚Äúit is also called thorough knowledge‚Äù shows that seeing and consciousness are not different in substance.

original: gang zhig de skad du brjod pa'i bye brag de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig de skad du brjod pa'i bye brag de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that distinction that is expressed in that way?

original: lta ba'i bdag nyid du bshad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i bdag nyid du bshad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is that which is explained as having the nature of view.

original: de las gzhan 'phags blo gnyi ga / zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang mdo las kyang de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba de zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'phags blo gnyi ga / zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang mdo las kyang de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba de zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, ‚ÄúThe other, which is the noble mind, is both,‚Äù and because a s≈´tra says, ‚ÄúOne who knows and sees in that way . . . ‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig ces smos pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa thams cad kyis mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes kyang bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig ces smos pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa thams cad kyis mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes kyang bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: Because it says ‚Äúsome consciousness,‚Äù it also explains that not all consciousnesses see.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it says, ‚ÄúSeeing is by eye consciousness,‚Äù it does not say that it is by ear consciousness and so on.

original: lta bar bya ba gzhan gang zhig yin zhes bya ba ni gang la dmigs par byed pa nyid yod pas de ni mthong bar rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: lta bar bya ba gzhan gang zhig yin zhes bya ba ni gang la dmigs par byed pa nyid yod pas de ni mthong bar rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: He thinks that since it is the very object of observation, it is suitable to be seen.

original: de ni klan kar mi rung ste //
analyzed: de ni klan kar mi rung ste //
translated: That is not a proper objection.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te rnam par shes pas rnam par shes na yang rnam par shes pa byed pa por gyur pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i bya ba gzhan gang zhig yod ces bya ba brjod dgos pas mtshungs par klan kar 'gyur roüîΩ// de la byed pa po dang bya ba'i bye brag kyang med ces bya ba ni byed pa po rnam par shes pa dang bya ba rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dag la bye brag gzhan nyid med mod kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes byed
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te rnam par shes pas rnam par shes na yang rnam par shes pa byed pa por gyur pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i bya ba gzhan gang zhig yod ces bya ba brjod dgos pas mtshungs par klan kar 'gyur ro // de la byed pa po dang bya ba'i bye brag kyang med ces bya ba ni byed pa po rnam par shes pa dang bya ba rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dag la bye brag gzhan nyid med mod kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes byed
translated: If consciousness were to cognize, then just as you would have to say that since consciousness is the agent, what other action of consciousness is there, so too you would have to say that since consciousness is the object of cognition, what other object of cognition is there?üîΩTherefore, it is similar to the objection.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthere is no difference between the agent and the action‚Äù means that the agent, consciousness, and the action, the characteristic of consciousness, are not different.

original: pa po @76b dang bya ba 'brel bar tha snyad 'dogs pa yang yod pa'o //
analyzed: pa po @76b dang bya ba 'brel bar tha snyad 'dogs pa yang yod pa'o //
translated: However, consciousness is said to cognize, and the convention of the relationship between the agent and the action exists.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang mig gis lta'o zhes bya bar 'gyur bas de ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang mig gis lta'o zhes bya bar 'gyur bas de ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: In the same way, here, the eye sees, and this is not open to objection.üîΩOthers say: Seeing is the visual consciousness.

original: gzhan dag na re mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes zer te de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mthong ngo zhes bya ste dper na dril sgrogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir dril sgrogs so zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes zer te de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mthong ngo zhes bya ste dper na dril sgrogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir dril sgrogs so zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The eye is said to see because it is the basis of seeing, just as a bell is said to ring because it is the basis of ringing.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The eye is the basis of seeing means that the eye is the basis of the visual consciousness.üîΩIn the world, it is commonly said that consciousness is seeing.

original: 'jig rten na rnam par shes pa de ni mthong ba'o zhes grags te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na mthong ba'o zhes grags kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni ma grags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na rnam par shes pa de ni mthong ba'o zhes grags te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na mthong ba'o zhes grags kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni ma grags so //
translated: In the world, it is commonly said that consciousness is seeing, but it is not commonly said that seeing is consciousness.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar de skyes na gzugs mthong ngo zhes ni mi zer ro zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩbye brag tu bshad pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni don de nyid mngon par brjod do snyam du bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar de skyes na gzugs mthong ngo zhes ni mi zer ro zhes bya ba smos so // bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni don de nyid mngon par brjod do snyam du bsams pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThus, when that arises, one does not say, ‚ÄòI see visible form.‚Äô‚ÄùüîΩThe Abhidharmako≈õa also says, ‚ÄúThe eye sense faculty sees visible form.‚Äù

original: mig dang phrad pa ni mig lam du snang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mig dang phrad pa ni mig lam du snang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the eye sense faculty sees visible form when it is in a state of contact with visible form.

original: rnam par shes pa ni yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni rten gyi ngo bo'i tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni rten gyi ngo bo'i tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Consciousness is merely present, but it is not that it sees visible form in the manner of a support.üîΩFor example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúThe sun makes the day.‚Äù

original: dper na nyi mas nyin par byed do zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na nyi ma yod pa tsam gyis nyin par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na nyi mas nyin par byed do zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na nyi ma yod pa tsam gyis nyin par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the sun makes the day merely by being present,

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pas rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pas rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: in the same way, consciousness is consciousness merely by being present.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten na de ltar grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na de ltar grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is well known in the world.

original: de ni byed pa med pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa las don gzhan du gyur pa'i byed pa po dang bya ba 'gog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byed pa med pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa las don gzhan du gyur pa'i byed pa po dang bya ba 'gog par byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is without activity‚Äù is an extensive explanation. ‚ÄúWithout activity‚Äù is a refutation of an agent and action that are different from the collection.

original: chos tsam zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud kyi byed pa po 'gog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chos tsam zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud kyi byed pa po 'gog par byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMere phenomena‚Äù is a refutation of an agent in one‚Äôs continuum.

original: rgyu dang 'dras  bu tsam zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag bya ba dang byed par 'brel par ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dras  bu tsam zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag bya ba dang byed par 'brel par ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMere cause and effect‚Äù demonstrates that although there is no agent, cause and effect are related as action and actor.

original: de la 'dun pa'i sgo nas mig gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa'i sgo nas mig gis mthong ngo //
translated: In this regard, it is imputed that ‚Äúthe eye sees through desire‚Äù and ‚Äúconsciousness cognizes.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes nye bar 'dogs par byed ces bya ba ni dngos po gang zhig tha snyad gdags pa'i yan lag yin pa des 'dir tha snyad yang dag par grub par bya ba'i phyir yod pa ma yin yang yod pa'i ngo bor
analyzed: rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes nye bar 'dogs par byed ces bya ba ni dngos po gang zhig tha snyad gdags pa'i yan lag yin pa des 'dir tha snyad yang dag par grub par bya ba'i phyir yod pa ma yin yang yod pa'i ngo bor
translated: That which is a part of the designation is here established as an existent, although it does not exist, through the nature of existence.

original: kun brtags nas mig gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: kun brtags nas mig gis mthong ngo //
translated: The imaginary is posited as the agent and action, etc.,

original: @77a * // rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa byed pa po dang bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: @77a * // rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa byed pa po dang bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: such as ‚Äúthe eye sees,‚Äù ‚Äúthe consciousness cognizes,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid ni dngos po la ltos nas gzhan yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par ro /üîΩljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ljongs kyi mi'i nang na nges shing gtan la bab par brjod pa ni ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid ni dngos po la ltos nas gzhan yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par ro / ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ljongs kyi mi'i nang na nges shing gtan la bab par brjod pa ni ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig ste /
translated: One should not adhere to this, i.e., one should not adhere to the intrinsic reality of things as other, etc.üîΩOne should not adhere to the etymological definitions of the people of the region, i.e., one should not adhere to the idea that ‚Äúthis is the etymological definition of that,‚Äù because the people of a region have fixed and determined the expression of a word in their own region.

original: de dag la 'di nges pa'i tshig 'di yin pas de'i phyir zhes mngon par zhen par mi bya ba 'am nges pa'i tshig thams cad don dang ldan pa kho na zhes brtags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'di nges pa'i tshig 'di yin pas de'i phyir zhes mngon par zhen par mi bya ba 'am nges pa'i tshig thams cad don dang ldan pa kho na zhes brtags par mi bya'o //
translated: Or, one should not investigate whether all etymological definitions have meaning.

original: 'jig rten gyi ming la mngon par brgyug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi ming bdag dang srog ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa sgro btags par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ming la mngon par brgyug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi ming bdag dang srog ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa sgro btags par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not run after worldly names means one should not impute such worldly names as self and life, etc.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa la sgro btags nas lus la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i bdag yod do zhes bya bar rtog par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa la sgro btags nas lus la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i bdag yod do zhes bya bar rtog par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having imputed what is not real, one should not imagine that there is a self apart from the body, etc. This is the meaning.

original: yang na 'jig rten gyi ming la mngon par brgyug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di 'da' bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gyi ming la mngon par brgyug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di 'da' bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: Or, one should not run after worldly names means one should not transgress this.

original: don dam pa'i phyir ming yung med do zhes rnam par brtag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam pa'i phyir ming yung med do zhes rnam par brtag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For the sake of the ultimate, one should not imagine that the name does not exist. This is the meaning.

original: 'da' ba dang brgal ba zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: 'da' ba dang brgal ba zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: Transgressing and running are synonyms.

original: gnyi ga dag gis kyang zhes bya ba las kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gcig gis kyang mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga dag gis kyang zhes bya ba las kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gcig gis kyang mthong ba yin no //
translated: By both means by either one, the word ca indicates.

original: nges pa med de zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga phye na mthong ba bzhin du gsal lo zhes bshad pa yin no //üîΩgang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mig phye ba dang phyed phye ba dag las gang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: nges pa med de zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga phye na mthong ba bzhin du gsal lo zhes bshad pa yin no // gang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mig phye ba dang phyed phye ba dag las gang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur pa na'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not certain‚Äù means that when both eyes are open, the moon appears as it really is.üîΩWhen one of the two eyes is altered, the moon appears double.

original: gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur na ste /üîΩgal te phye ba gang yin pa de phyed phye ba 'am thams cad btsums par byas pa 'am //
analyzed: gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur na ste / gal te phye ba gang yin pa de phyed phye ba 'am thams cad btsums par byas pa 'am //
translated: When one of the two eyes is altered, the moon appears double.

original: phyed phye ba gang yin pa de gal te thams cad btsums pa 'am thams cad phye ba byas na de'i tshe zla ba gnyis su mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyed phye ba gang yin pa de gal te thams cad btsums pa 'am thams cad phye ba byas na de'i tshe zla ba gnyis su mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the open eye is altered, and the half-open eye is either closed or fully open, or if the half-open eye is altered, and the open eye is either closed or half-open, then the moon will not appear double.

original: de'i phyir 'dir mig gnyi g-yang rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba la zho sha yod do zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir mig gnyi g-yang rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba la zho sha yod do zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that both eyes are equally capable of producing consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs bzhin du yul na ni gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs bzhin du yul na ni gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'i dpe yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness is not like form, because it does not abide in a place‚Äù is the counterexample.

original: ji ltar gzugs yul na gnas pa'i phyir rten @77b rnam par chad pas rnam par chad par 'gyur ba ltar rnam par shes pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs yul na gnas pa'i phyir rten @77b rnam par chad pas rnam par chad par 'gyur ba ltar rnam par shes pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Just as form is cut off when its support is cut off, because it abides in a place, consciousness is not like that.

original: rnam par shes pa ni yul na gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yul na gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness does not abide in a place.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it?

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not physical, it does not abide in a place.

original: yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir na rten rnam par chad pas rnam par chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir na rten rnam par chad pas rnam par chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it does not abide in a place, it is not cut off when its support is cut off.

original: 'di ltang gzugs rgyang ring po nas mthong zhes bya ba ni gang na gzugs snang ba de na de 'dzin par byed pa'i mig gi dbang po med de /
analyzed: 'di ltang gzugs rgyang ring po nas mthong zhes bya ba ni gang na gzugs snang ba de na de 'dzin par byed pa'i mig gi dbang po med de /
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, form is seen from a distance‚Äù means that where form appears, the eye sense faculty that apprehends it does not exist.

original: de tshad mas mi dmigs pa'i phyir de na lhas byin la sogs pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de tshad mas mi dmigs pa'i phyir de na lhas byin la sogs pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is not observed by valid knowledge, it is like Devadatta not existing there.

original: mig la ji lta ba de bzhin du rna ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mig la ji lta ba de bzhin du rna ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is with the eye, so it is with the ear.

original: cig shos kyis smras pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyis smras pa /
translated: The other says:

original: mig dang rna ba ni rang gi yul gyi phyogs dang phrad pa yin te /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba ni rang gi yul gyi phyogs dang phrad pa yin te /
translated: The eye and ear are in contact with their objects,

original: dbang po yin pa'i phyir sna'i dbang po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang po yin pa'i phyir sna'i dbang po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: because they are sense faculties, like the nose faculty and so on.

original: rjes su dpag pa 'dis ni gtan tshigs de ni tshad mas mi dmigs pa nyid ma grub par ston par byed do //
