analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'dis ni gtan tshigs de ni tshad mas mi dmigs pa nyid ma grub par ston par byed do //
translated: This inference shows that the reason, nonobservation by valid knowledge, is not established.

original: slob dpon gyis yul dang phrad pa nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis yul dang phrad pa nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The Master says, If they were in contact with their objects, etc.

original: gal te mig dang rna ba yul dang phrad pa yin par brtags na ni mi'i nang na 'di na bsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i mig dang rna ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mig dang rna ba yul dang phrad pa yin par brtags na ni mi'i nang na 'di na bsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i mig dang rna ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the eye and ear were imagined to be in contact with their objects, then the divine eye and ear would not arise for contemplatives among humans.

original: gal te mig dang rna bas ci rigs par yul shin tu bskal bar yod pa dag rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa'i gzugs dang sgra 'dzin par byed na de lta na 'di lha'i nyid yin par srid par 'gyur ba zhig na de yang yul dang phrad pa
analyzed: gal te mig dang rna bas ci rigs par yul shin tu bskal bar yod pa dag rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa'i gzugs dang sgra 'dzin par byed na de lta na 'di lha'i nyid yin par srid par 'gyur ba zhig na de yang yul dang phrad pa
translated: If the eye and ear sense faculties were to apprehend form and sound that are very distant, or separated by a wall, then it would be possible that they are divine.

original: nyid cig yin na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyid cig yin na mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if they are faculties that contact their objects, that is not possible.

original: sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they are like the nose and so on.

original: dper na sna dang lce dag yul dang phrad pa'i phyir bsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i dag skye bar mi 'gyur ba de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na sna dang lce dag yul dang phrad pa'i phyir bsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i dag skye bar mi 'gyur ba de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, the nose and tongue sense faculties do not arise as divine for contemplatives because they contact their objects.

original: 'dis ni phyogs rang gi yul gyi phyogs dang phrad pa nyid chos can gyi khyad par las bzlog pa'i skyon dang bcas pa nyid du ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs rang gi yul gyi phyogs dang phrad pa nyid chos can gyi khyad par las bzlog pa'i skyon dang bcas pa nyid du ston par byed de /
translated: This shows that the position that the eye and ear sense faculties contact their object field is flawed because it contradicts the specific attributes of the object field.

original: mig dang rna ba lha'i mig dag yin par srid pa ni chos can yin no //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba lha'i mig dag yin par srid pa ni chos can yin no //
translated: The subject is that it is possible that the eye and ear sense faculties are divine eyes.

original: lha'i nyid kyi ngo bo yin par mi srid pa ni khyad par las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i nyid kyi ngo bo yin par mi srid pa ni khyad par las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The contradiction of the specific attribute is that it is impossible that they are divine by nature.

original: der 'gyur bas na nyes pa yin no //üîΩskyon 'dis na rjes su dpag par mi rung ba'i phyir de tshad mas mi dmigs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: der 'gyur bas na nyes pa yin no // skyon 'dis na rjes su dpag par mi rung ba'i phyir de tshad mas mi dmigs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: Since that is so, it is a fault.üîΩBecause of this fault, it is not suitable to infer that the eye sense faculty and so on are not physical sense faculties because they do not contact their objects.

original: de lta bas na mig dang rna ba ni yul dang ma phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mig dang rna ba ni yul dang ma phrad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the eye and ear sense faculties do not contact their objects.

original: gal te yul dang ma phrad pa yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni nye ba dang shin tu ring ba na yod pa dang bar du chod pa'ang rung de dang ma @78a * //
analyzed: gal te yul dang ma phrad pa yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni nye ba dang shin tu ring ba na yod pa dang bar du chod pa'ang rung de dang ma @78a * //
translated: If they do not contact their objects, then even if they are close, very distant, or obstructed,

original: phrad par 'dra bas de mthong bar thal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phrad par 'dra bas de mthong bar thal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: they would be similar in not contacting their objects and therefore it would follow that they would not see them.üîΩIs this argument of the opponent a proof or a refutation?

original: pha rol po'i 'di ci sgrub pa zhig yin nam 'on te sun 'byin pa zhig / gal te re zhig 'di skad du mig dang rna bas ni shin tu ring ba dang bar du chod pa 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pha rol po'i 'di ci sgrub pa zhig yin nam 'on te sun 'byin pa zhig / gal te re zhig 'di skad du mig dang rna bas ni shin tu ring ba dang bar du chod pa 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is a proof, then it is not established because the eye and ear sense faculties do not contact their objects.

original: yul dang ma phrad pa yin pa'i phyir yul nye ba lta bu'o zhes sgrub pa yin na ni de ni bsgrub par mi rung ste //
analyzed: yul dang ma phrad pa yin pa'i phyir yul nye ba lta bu'o zhes sgrub pa yin na ni de ni bsgrub par mi rung ste //
translated: If you are proving that it is like a nearby object because it does not come into contact with the object, that is not a suitable proof.

original: bdag nyid la gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i phyir dang / sngar khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i phyir dang / sngar khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason is not established for you, and because it contradicts your prior assertion.

original: 'on te mig dang rna ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos can ma phrad pa thams cad 'dzin par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar sun 'byin pa yin na ni de ni sun 'byin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'on te mig dang rna ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos can ma phrad pa thams cad 'dzin par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar sun 'byin pa yin na ni de ni sun 'byin par mi rung ste /
translated: But if you are refuting the consequence that all phenomena characterized by eyes and ears would apprehend without coming into contact, that is not a suitable refutation.

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is undermined by inference.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: re zhig khab long gis kyang lcags ma phrad pa thams cad ci ste mi 'dren zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: re zhig khab long gis kyang lcags ma phrad pa thams cad ci ste mi 'dren zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: First, why doesn‚Äôt a magnet attract all non-contacting iron?

original: dril ba'i sgo nas khab long dper nye bar bkod de mig dang rna ba ma phrad phar 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: dril ba'i sgo nas khab long dper nye bar bkod de mig dang rna ba ma phrad phar 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du sgrub par byed do //
translated: The magnet is cited as an example in terms of its function, proving that eyes and ears do not apprehend without coming into contact.

original: mig dang rna ba ni ma phrad pa thams cad 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te ma phrad pa thams cad 'dzin pa'i mthun med pa'i phyir khab long bzhin no /üîΩkhab long ni lcags ma phrad pa 'dzin par byed de 'dren par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig yin yang ma phrad pa thams cad 'dzin par byed pa ni ma yin pa ltar mig dang rna ba yang de dang 'dra'o //üîΩyul dang phrad pa nyid cig yin yang ci'i phyir mig sman nam thur ma phrad pa thams cad mi mthong ste de ni mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni yul shin tu ring ba dang bar du chod pa ni mig dang rna bas mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba ni ma phrad pa thams cad 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te ma phrad pa thams cad 'dzin pa'i mthun med pa'i phyir khab long bzhin no / khab long ni lcags ma phrad pa 'dzin par byed de 'dren par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig yin yang ma phrad pa thams cad 'dzin par byed pa ni ma yin pa ltar mig dang rna ba yang de dang 'dra'o // yul dang phrad pa nyid cig yin yang ci'i phyir mig sman nam thur ma phrad pa thams cad mi mthong ste de ni mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni yul shin tu ring ba dang bar du chod pa ni mig dang rna bas mi 'dzin te /
translated: The eyes and ears do not apprehend all non-contact, because they do not have the power to apprehend all non-contact, like a magnet.üîΩA magnet attracts iron and does not attract non-iron, and it does not attract iron that is not in contact with it.üîΩEven though the object is in contact, why do the eyes not see all that is in contact, such as eye medicine or a spoon?

original: gzung bar mi rung ba'i phyir mig sman dang thur ma phrad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzung bar mi rung ba'i phyir mig sman dang thur ma phrad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The eyes and ears do not apprehend distant or obstructed objects, because they are not suitable to be apprehended, like eye medicine or a spoon that is not in contact.

original: yang na mig dang rna ba ni rang gi gzung bar bya ba thams cad 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na mig dang rna ba ni rang gi gzung bar bya ba thams cad 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, the eyes and ears do not perceive all their objects because

original: dbang po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: they are by nature sense faculties, like the nose faculty, etc.

original: sna la sogs pa yul dang phrad pa yin yang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dri la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir thams cad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sna la sogs pa yul dang phrad pa yin yang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dri la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: Although the nose, etc., do contact their objects, they do not perceive all their objects because they do not perceive simultaneous odors, etc.

original: dbang po rnams kyis nus pa 'di 'dra bas sna la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dri dang ro dang reg bya dag mi 'dzin to //üîΩyid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phrad pa nyid ni lus can rnams kho na'i yin par rnam par gzhag gi //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyis nus pa 'di 'dra bas sna la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dri dang ro dang reg bya dag mi 'dzin to // yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phrad pa nyid ni lus can rnams kho na'i yin par rnam par gzhag gi //
translated: The sense faculties have this kind of power, so the nose, etc., do not perceive simultaneous odors, tastes, and tactile objects.üîΩThe mind does not because it is not material.üîΩContact is only established for those that are material, not for those that are not material.

original: lus can ma yin pa rnams ni ma yin pas yul @78b dang phrad pa yin zhes bya ba ni dpyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa rnams ni ma yin pas yul @78b dang phrad pa yin zhes bya ba ni dpyad par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be analyzed whether the mind contacts its object.

original: gsum gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gsum ni phrad pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar 'dod pa'i phyir brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gsum ni phrad pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar 'dod pa'i phyir brtsams pa yin no //
translated: The three are only contact.

original: de lta ba ma yin na yul dang phrad pa dang ma phrad pa yang yin no zhes bya bar yang srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ba ma yin na yul dang phrad pa dang ma phrad pa yang yin no zhes bya bar yang srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be possible to say that they are both contact and non-contact with their object-field.

original: dbugs ma rngubs par ni mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snar dbugs rngubs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba phra mo bzhi 'ongs pa gang yin pa de'i dri snas snom par byed do //
analyzed: dbugs ma rngubs par ni mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snar dbugs rngubs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba phra mo bzhi 'ongs pa gang yin pa de'i dri snas snom par byed do //
translated: Because one does not grasp without inhaling. The subtle matter that arises together with the inhalation of breath through the nostrils is the odor that is grasped by the nose.

original: gzhan dag na re rlung las dri gzhan 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rlung las dri gzhan 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: According to others, odor is produced from the wind.

original: 'dres par 'gyur ba ni yul gcig par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres par 'gyur ba ni yul gcig par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: They become mixed, that is, they become the same object-field.

original: 'on te phyogs gcig gis yin na ni zhes bya ba ci zhe na /üîΩreg par 'gyur na ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig gis yin na ni zhes bya ba ci zhe na /üîΩreg par 'gyur na ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If they are contact by one part, what do you conclude?üîΩIf they are contact, then they are contact by one part.

original: 'o na ji ltar sgra mngon par 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te mi reg na bsnun du med pas sgra mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sgra mngon par 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te mi reg na bsnun du med pas sgra mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: How then would sound be produced? If it does not touch, then since it cannot be struck, sound would not be produced.

original: de nyid kyi phyir te zhes zer ba ni kha ce pa rnams yin te gal te reg par gyur na lag pas lag pa la bsnun na bying bar 'gyur te rgya skyegs la rgya skyegs gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir te zhes zer ba ni kha ce pa rnams yin te gal te reg par gyur na lag pas lag pa la bsnun na bying bar 'gyur te rgya skyegs la rgya skyegs gzhan bzhin no //
translated: Some say: Because of that, if it touches, when one hand strikes the other, they would sink into each other, like myrobalan plums.

original: ji ltar bsags pa la brgyab na zhig par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab phan tshun ma reg pa'i tshogs la lag pa la sogs pas brgyab na ji ltar zhig par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bsags pa la brgyab na zhig par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab phan tshun ma reg pa'i tshogs la lag pa la sogs pas brgyab na ji ltar zhig par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: How could it not disintegrate when struck against an aggregation? If it does not touch, when one strikes an aggregation of atoms with one‚Äôs hand and so on, how could it not disintegrate?

original: de dag gi dbus na chung zad kyang med pa gang yin pa de kho na 'dab chags pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni nang na snang ba la sogs pa med pas 'di dag 'dab chags pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de dag gi dbus na chung zad kyang med pa gang yin pa de kho na 'dab chags pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni nang na snang ba la sogs pa med pas 'di dag 'dab chags pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: That which is not even slightly in their midst is precisely their continuity.

original: de kho na ni phrad pa nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na ni phrad pa nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: That is precisely their contact, not otherwise.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Again means moreover.

original: 'dus pa rnams ni cha shad dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir reg par 'gyur bas gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg par gyur na ni rdzas rnams 'dres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa rnams ni cha shad dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir reg par 'gyur bas gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg par gyur na ni rdzas rnams 'dres par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since those that are assembled have parts, they would be contacted. If they were contacted by their entire selves, then substances would merge.

original: gal te phyogs gcig gis na ni cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur zhes nyes pa smras pa gang yin pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gal te phyogs gcig gis na ni cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur zhes nyes pa smras pa gang yin pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If they were contacted by one part, then the fault would ensue that they would have parts.

original: rgyu'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi rgyu ci 'dra ba de ni reg pa 'am ma reg pa de'i rgyu'i phyir zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi rgyu ci 'dra ba de ni reg pa 'am ma reg pa de'i rgyu'i phyir zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the cause‚Äù means that the cause of contact or non-contact is the same.üîΩSometimes, they are not in contact, as when they are in the process of coming together.üîΩSometimes, they are in contact, as when they are in the process of separation.

original: res 'ga' ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la reg pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni 'di la phan tshun reg pa'i rgyu yod pas na reg pa'i rgyu can @79a * //üîΩgyis ma reg pa yin no //üîΩgang gi tshe rnam par zhig pa na'o zhes bya ba ni dper na bong pa skam po phye mar byas pa lta bu'o //üîΩgang gi tshe bsags par gyur pa na'o zhes bya ba ni dper na kha ba lta bu ste de ni sngon phra la phyis chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la reg pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni 'di la phan tshun reg pa'i rgyu yod pas na reg pa'i rgyu can @79a * // gyis ma reg pa yin no // gang gi tshe rnam par zhig pa na'o zhes bya ba ni dper na bong pa skam po phye mar byas pa lta bu'o // gang gi tshe bsags par gyur pa na'o zhes bya ba ni dper na kha ba lta bu ste de ni sngon phra la phyis chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes, they are in the process of coming together, as when they are in the process of aggregation.üîΩSometimes, they are in the process of separation, as when they are in the process of disintegration.üîΩSometimes, they are in the process of aggregation, as when they are in the process of becoming aggregated.üîΩSometimes, they are in the process of disintegration, as when they are in the process of disintegrating.üîΩSometimes, they are in the process of becoming aggregated, as when they are in the process of becoming aggregated.

original: gang gi tshe bsags pa dar ldan pa bsags pa na'o zhes bya ba ni dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu gnyis phrad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsags pa dar ldan pa bsags pa na'o zhes bya ba ni dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu gnyis phrad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Sometimes, they are in the process of disintegrating, as when they are in the process of disintegrating.

original: skad cig ma phyi mar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skyes nas reg pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi mar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skyes nas reg pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It endures in the second moment because it exists after arising.üîΩThe Bhadanta says: There is no contact, but there is the conception that there is contact with what is contiguous.üîΩThe Bhadanta‚Äôs position should be accepted.

original: btsun pa na reg pa ni reg pa ni med kyi 'dab chags pa la reg go snyam du 'du shes par zad do zhes zer te btsun pa'i lugs 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs ci'i phyir 'dod par mi bya /
analyzed: btsun pa na reg pa ni reg pa ni med kyi 'dab chags pa la reg go snyam du 'du shes par zad do zhes zer te btsun pa'i lugs 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs ci'i phyir 'dod par mi bya /
translated: Why not accept the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis kyang 'di skad du de dag gi dbus na cung zad kyang med pa gang yin pa de kho na 'dab chags pa nyid yin no zhes smras pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis kyang 'di skad du de dag gi dbus na cung zad kyang med pa gang yin pa de kho na 'dab chags pa nyid yin no zhes smras pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: Is it not said that what is in between them is not even slightly existent and that is what is meant by contiguous?

original: de skad ces ni smras mod kyi tshig de ni glags dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad ces ni smras mod kyi tshig de ni glags dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: That is what they say, but that statement is flawed.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dbus na chug zad kyang med pa gang yin pa zhes smra ba rnams ni dbus na snang ba la sogs pa yod par mi 'dod kyi rdul phra rab gzhan 'jug pa'i go skabs med par ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dbus na chug zad kyang med pa gang yin pa zhes smra ba rnams ni dbus na snang ba la sogs pa yod par mi 'dod kyi rdul phra rab gzhan 'jug pa'i go skabs med par ni mi smra'o //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas of Ka≈õmƒ´r do not assert that light and so on exist in the middle, but they do not say that there is no opportunity for other subtle particles to enter.

original: gzhan du rdul phra rab bar dang bcas pa rnams kyi bar dag tu 'gro ba las su 'gog na zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du rdul phra rab bar dang bcas pa rnams kyi bar dag tu 'gro ba las su 'gog na zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, if it is said that the space between particles with interstice is blocked by other particles, then the phrase ‚Äúpossessing going‚Äù would be a remainder of words.

original: nyes pa gzhan 'di yang yod de //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan 'di yang yod de //
translated: Another fault is this:

original: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba rnams rtog par byed pa ltar rdul phra rab rnams las bsags pa dag gzhan pa yang ma yin pas de dag kho na bsags pa la reg pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba rnams rtog par byed pa ltar rdul phra rab rnams las bsags pa dag gzhan pa yang ma yin pas de dag kho na bsags pa la reg pa yin te /
translated: Since the aggregates are not different from the subtle particles, as the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas imagine, they are only the aggregation of those particles.

original: dper na gzugs su rung ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa kho na yin gyi gcig pu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dper na gzugs su rung ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa kho na yin gyi gcig pu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For example, it is like the suitability of form. This means that only the collection is suitable, not the individual.

original: gal te rdul phra rab la phyogs cha tha dad par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni slob dpon rdul phra rab yongs su ma grub par 'chad par 'dod nas dpyod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab la phyogs cha tha dad par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni slob dpon rdul phra rab yongs su ma grub par 'chad par 'dod nas dpyod par byed pa yin te /
translated: If one says that partless particles have different directional parts, then the master analyzes, wishing to explain that partless particles are not established.

original: gal te rdul phra rab gcig la shar phyogs la sogs te phyogs kyi cha tha dad par rtog na ni phan tshun reg gam ma reg kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab gcig la shar phyogs la sogs te phyogs kyi cha tha dad par rtog na ni phan tshun reg gam ma reg kyang rung ste /
translated: If one imagines that a subtle particle has different directional parts, then, whether or not it touches another particle,

original: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that it has parts.

original: gal te ma yin na ni zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma yin na ni zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: If not, then what?

original: phyogs cha tha dad par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyogs cha tha dad par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdifferent directional parts‚Äù is supplied.

original: reg kyang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba cir zhe na /
analyzed: reg kyang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba cir zhe na /
translated: If it does not touch, then what?

original: cha shas @79b dang bcas pa nyid du'o //üîΩ'dir sgrub pa ni rdul phra rab ni cha shas med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cha shas @79b dang bcas pa nyid du'o // 'dir sgrub pa ni rdul phra rab ni cha shas med pa ma yin te /
translated: It follows that it has parts.

original: phyogs cha tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mon sran gre'u'i phung po bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs cha tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mon sran gre'u'i phung po bzhin no //
translated: Here is the proof: A subtle particle does not have no parts, because it has different directional parts, like a heap of mung beans.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni phyogs cha tha dad pa dang ldan pa nyid 'di mi 'dod de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni phyogs cha tha dad pa dang ldan pa nyid 'di mi 'dod de /
translated: Vaibhasikas do not assert that form possesses different directional parts.

original: phyogs cha tha dad pa ni bsags pa'i gzugs dag kho na'i yin par rtog go //
analyzed: phyogs cha tha dad pa ni bsags pa'i gzugs dag kho na'i yin par rtog go //
translated: They imagine that different directional parts belong to only aggregated form.

original: 'di skad du yul tha mi dad pa nyid du gyur na mi rung bas thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi yul tha dad pa nyid dang bar dang bcas pa nyid dag yin yang de dag 'dab chags par gnas pa'i phyir thogs pa dang bcad pa nyid kyis
analyzed: 'di skad du yul tha mi dad pa nyid du gyur na mi rung bas thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi yul tha dad pa nyid dang bar dang bcas pa nyid dag yin yang de dag 'dab chags par gnas pa'i phyir thogs pa dang bcad pa nyid kyis
translated: They say that it is impossible for objects to be undifferentiated, so though objects with resistance have different directional parts and are discrete, they obstruct movement by impeding it through their contiguity.

original: 'gro ba'i gags  byed do zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni chos nyid yin no zhes kyag brjod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gags  byed do zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni chos nyid yin no zhes kyag brjod do //
translated: This is the nature of things.üîΩDo they apprehend a mountain and so on because they quickly engage it like a firebrand, which appears to be a wheel?

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa bzhin du myur du 'jug pas ri la sogs pa 'dzin tam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi chad dang mnyam pa kho na'i don 'dzin par 'dod na ji ltar ri chen po dag cig car 'dzin pa lta bur snang gi
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa bzhin du myur du 'jug pas ri la sogs pa 'dzin tam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi chad dang mnyam pa kho na'i don 'dzin par 'dod na ji ltar ri chen po dag cig car 'dzin pa lta bur snang gi
translated: If you assert that they apprehend an object that is equal to their own measure, how do they appear to apprehend a great mountain all at once?

original: rim gyis ni ma yin no snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu bar de ltar 'dzin pa'i rigs pa myur du 'jug pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjod par byed de dper na 'gal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa 'dzin pa rim gyis yin yang cig car lta bur
analyzed: rim gyis ni ma yin no snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu bar de ltar 'dzin pa'i rigs pa myur du 'jug pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjod par byed de dper na 'gal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa 'dzin pa rim gyis yin yang cig car lta bur
translated: To anticipate this doubt, he says, ‚Äúbecause the cognition of that kind occurs quickly,‚Äù and so on. For example, the cognition of a firebrand wheel, etc., is gradual, but it appears as if it were instantaneous.

original: mngon pa'o // de bzhin du ri dang chu bo'i sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa yang myur du 'jug pa yin no //üîΩ'on te mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa zhig la zhes bya ba ni rgun 'brum la sogs pa la lta na ni mnyam pa yin la skra'i rtse mo dang ri la sogs pa la lta na ni mi mnyam pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon pa'o // de bzhin du ri dang chu bo'i sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa yang myur du 'jug pa yin no // 'on te mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa zhig la zhes bya ba ni rgun 'brum la sogs pa la lta na ni mnyam pa yin la skra'i rtse mo dang ri la sogs pa la lta na ni mi mnyam pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the cognition of a mountain, a river, etc., occurs quickly.üîΩOr, if it is equal or unequal, when one sees grapes, etc., it is equal, but when one sees the tip of a hair, a mountain, etc., it is unequal.

original: mig phye ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni rim gyis mthong ba ma yin pa'i lugs kyis so //
analyzed: mig phye ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni rim gyis mthong ba ma yin pa'i lugs kyis so //
translated: In the same way, when one sees a mountain, etc., it is unequal, but when one sees a cloud, etc., it is equal.

original: de bzhin du rna bas zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba ni res 'ga' ni chung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna bas zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba ni res 'ga' ni chung ste /
translated: In the same way, the cognition of sound is sometimes small, sometimes large.

original: gang gi tshe sbrang bu'i sgra thos pa na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sbrang bu'i sgra thos pa na'o //
translated: When one hears the sound of a mosquito.

original: res 'ga' ni mnyam ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mnyam ste /
translated: Sometimes they are equal.

original: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig gis sgra rna ba'i rdul phra rab dang tshad mnyam pa thos pa na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig gis sgra rna ba'i rdul phra rab dang tshad mnyam pa thos pa na'o //
translated: When one hears a sound that is equal in size to the atoms of the ear.

original: res 'ga' ni che ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni che ste /
translated: Sometimes they are larger.

original: gang gi tshe 'brug gi sgra thos pa na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'brug gi sgra thos pa na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: When one hears the sound of thunder.üîΩThey are like the flower of the black aconite plant.

original: go snyod kyi me tog bzhin du gnas te zhes bya ba ni go snyod nag po'i me tog bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: go snyod kyi me tog bzhin du gnas te zhes bya ba ni go snyod nag po'i me tog bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The flower of the black aconite plant is like a small ball.üîΩThe atoms of the ear sense faculty are like that.üîΩThey are located inside the ear drum.üîΩThe ear drum is like a small drum.

original: rna ba'i 'brug gi nang na gnas so zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i nang na gro ba'i kha dog gi rnam pa lta bu yod pa gang yin pa de ni gro ba dang 'dra bas 'brug yin te rna ba'i dbang po'i rdul phra @80a * //üîΩrab dag ni de'i nang na gnas so //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'brug gi nang na gnas so zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i nang na gro ba'i kha dog gi rnam pa lta bu yod pa gang yin pa de ni gro ba dang 'dra bas 'brug yin te rna ba'i dbang po'i rdul phra @80a * // rab dag ni de'i nang na gnas so //
translated: The atoms of the ear sense faculty are located inside the ear drum.

original: mtshul ba'i nang na zhes bya ba la mtshul ba ni sna'i rgyud do //
analyzed: mtshul ba'i nang na zhes bya ba la mtshul ba ni sna'i rgyud do //
translated: The nose sense faculty is located inside the nose.üîΩThe nose is like a bird‚Äôs beak.üîΩThe atoms of the nose sense faculty are located inside the nose.

original: phreng ba bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba ni phreng ba ma 'grus par kor kor por gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: phreng ba bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba ni phreng ba ma 'grus par kor kor por gnas pa yin no //
translated: It is like a garland, that is, it is like a garland that is not strung.

original: skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam zhig lce'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab dag gis ma khebs so zhes grag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam zhig lce'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab dag gis ma khebs so zhes grag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said that the tip of a hair is not covered by the atoms of the tongue sense faculty.

original: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni lung yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni lung yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúit is said‚Äù indicates that this is a scriptural reference.

original: ma khebs pa ni ma khyab pa'o //
analyzed: ma khebs pa ni ma khyab pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot covered‚Äù means not pervaded.

original: thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa skyed na ni lus zhigs par 'gyur ro lo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa skyed na ni lus zhigs par 'gyur ro lo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If all of them generate consciousness, the body would be destroyed.

original: lo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni las kyi mthun kho nas 'jig par mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes ma dad pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni las kyi mthun kho nas 'jig par mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes ma dad pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù indicates that it would not be destroyed by the power of karma alone.

original: rten dang dmigs pa ni bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang dmigs pa bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa ni bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang dmigs pa bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the support and object are accumulated, that is, because the support is accumulated and the object is accumulated.

original: tha ma'i rten 'das zhes bya ba ni 'das pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: tha ma'i rten 'das zhes bya ba ni 'das pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúpast‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe final basis is past‚Äù is understood to mean ‚Äúonly past.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dbang po gnyis kyi rten can yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dbang po gnyis kyi rten can yin te /
translated: Therefore means that because the five collections of consciousness are based on two faculties,

original: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'i rten can dang yid kyi dbang po'i rten can dag yin pa de'i phyir mu bzhi pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'i rten can dang yid kyi dbang po'i rten can dag yin pa de'i phyir mu bzhi pa 'byung ste /
translated: a fourth possibility arises, which is that they are based on the eye faculty and so on and the mental faculty.

original: mu dang po ni mig yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por yin gyi /
analyzed: mu dang po ni mig yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por yin gyi /
translated: The first possibility is the eye faculty, which is the basis of eye consciousness.

original: mig sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the equivalent immediately preceding condition because it is not the nature of mind or mental factors.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The definition of the equivalent immediately preceding condition is:

original: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
translated: Those that are mind and mental factors

original: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag / ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag / ces bya ba yin no //
translated: that are born and not final.

original: mu gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por yin gyi rten gyi dngos por ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por yin gyi rten gyi dngos por ni ma yin te /
translated: That is a similar immediately preceding state, but it is not a supportive state.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rten ni mig la sogs pa yid la thug pa'i bar drug kho na yin par 'dod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rten ni mig la sogs pa yid la thug pa'i bar drug kho na yin par 'dod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: The support of consciousness is asserted to be just the six sense faculties from the eye to the mind.

original: gsum pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third possibility is the immediately past mind.üîΩThe fourth possibility is those phenomena that are not included in the explanation.

original: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams yin te zhes bya ba ni mu gsum las ma gtogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams yin te zhes bya ba ni mu gsum las ma gtogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Those are nonassociated compositional factors, unconditioned phenomena, and so on that are not included in the three possibilities.

original: de bzhin du @80b lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang rang gi dbang po brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por yin pa de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yang yin nam
analyzed: de bzhin du @80b lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang rang gi dbang po brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por yin pa de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yang yin nam
translated: Does that which is the basis of ear consciousness also act as its equivalent immediately preceding condition?

original: zhe na / mu bzhi ste mu dang po ni rna ba yin no //
analyzed: zhe na / mu bzhi ste mu dang po ni rna ba yin no //
translated: There are four possibilities. The first possibility is the ear.

original: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa yin no //
translated: The second is the immediately past mental factor of the phenomena element.

original: gsum pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid yin no //
translated: The third is the immediately past mental faculty.

original: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams yin te /
translated: The fourth is phenomena not mentioned as a possibility in the explanation.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, this should be stated for the others.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste zhes bya ba ni gang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por yin pa de ni de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yang yin no zhes tshig snga maüîΩdang sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste zhes bya ba ni gang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por yin pa de ni de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yang yin no zhes tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is the basis of the mental consciousness is also the equivalent and immediately antecedent condition of the mental consciousness‚Äù is connected with the former phrase.üîΩThat which is the basis of the mental consciousness is also the equivalent and immediately antecedent condition of the mental consciousness.

original: re zhig gang rten gyi dngos por yin pa de ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yang yin no zhes bya ba ni re zhig mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'di ni gdon mi za bar yid yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gang rten gyi dngos por yin pa de ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yang yin no zhes bya ba ni re zhig mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'di ni gdon mi za bar yid yin no //
translated: The equivalent and immediately antecedent condition is necessarily the mental faculty.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yin la rten gyi dngos por ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yin la rten gyi dngos por ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a factor that is the equivalent and immediately antecedent condition but is not the basis.

original: chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa'o zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rten drug gi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa'o zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rten drug gi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The factor that is the immediately preceding mental factor of the element of mental objects is not the nature of the six bases such as the eye, etc.

original: de dag gyur pas 'gyur nyid phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig la sogs pa de dag gyur pas 'gyur pa ni //
analyzed: de dag gyur pas 'gyur nyid phyir // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mig la sogs pa de dag gyur pas 'gyur pa ni //
translated: Because they are transformed by the transformation of those.üîΩThe transformation of those is the transformation of consciousness.

original: de dag gyur bas 'gyur ba ste de dag gyur pas 'gyur ba ni de dag gyur pas 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gyur bas 'gyur ba ste de dag gyur pas 'gyur ba ni de dag gyur pas 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The transformation of consciousness is the transformation of those.

original: 'di dag la de yod pas rnam par shes pa rnams ni de dag gyur pas 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag la de yod pas rnam par shes pa rnams ni de dag gyur pas 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: Because they have that, the consciousnesses are the transformation of those.

original: de ngo bo ni de dag gyur pas 'gyur ba nyid yin no //üîΩde'i phyir 'di dag gi rten mig la sogs pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nge spar bzung ngo //
analyzed: de ngo bo ni de dag gyur pas 'gyur ba nyid yin no // de'i phyir 'di dag gi rten mig la sogs pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nge spar bzung ngo //
translated: The nature of that is the transformation of those.üîΩTherefore, the eye and so on are the basis of those.üîΩBecause they conform to benefit, harm, clarity, and lack of clarity.

original: phan pa dang gnod pa dang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa la mig sman la sogs pas phan btags shing rdul la sogs pas gnod pa byas na go rims bzhin du mig gi rnam
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod pa dang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa la mig sman la sogs pas phan btags shing rdul la sogs pas gnod pa byas na go rims bzhin du mig gi rnam
translated: When the eye and so on are benefited by collyrium and so on, and harmed by dust and so on, the eye consciousness and so on are clear and unclear respectively.

original: par shes pa la sogs pa bde ba dang bcas pa skyed pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal dang bcas pa skyed pa'i phyir rjes su byed pa yin no //
analyzed: par shes pa la sogs pa bde ba dang bcas pa skyed pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal dang bcas pa skyed pa'i phyir rjes su byed pa yin no //
translated: because it is the cause of the production of the visual consciousness, etc. ,

original: de dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyi @81a * //
analyzed: de dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyi @81a * //
translated: when they are clear or unclear, it is clear or unclear.

original: skyed pa'i phyir gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su yang byed do //
analyzed: skyed pa'i phyir gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su yang byed do //
translated: When form is clear, a clear visual consciousness arises; when form is unclear, an unclear visual consciousness arises.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa gyur pas rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar shes so //üîΩgzugs gsal na rnam par shes pa gsal ba skye ba snang la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa gyur pas rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar shes so // gzugs gsal na rnam par shes pa gsal ba skye ba snang la /
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the transformation of the visual consciousness, etc. , is due to the transformation of the eye, etc.

original: mi gsal na mi gsal ba yang ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mi gsal na mi gsal ba yang ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that when form is clear, a clear visual consciousness arises, and when form is unclear, an unclear visual consciousness arises?

original: gzugs gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid yin na mig gi rnam par shes pa rjes su byed mod kyi mig dang gzugs dag gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni mig gi gnas skabs nyid na mig gi rnam par shes pa rjes su byed pa'i gzugs kyi gnas skabsüîΩsu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid yin na mig gi rnam par shes pa rjes su byed mod kyi mig dang gzugs dag gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni mig gi gnas skabs nyid na mig gi rnam par shes pa rjes su byed pa'i gzugs kyi gnas skabsüîΩsu ni ma yin no //
translated: When form is clear or unclear, the visual consciousness does conform to it. But when the eye and form are in a transformed state, the visual consciousness is in a transformed state, not in a state conforming to the form.

original: 'di ltar mig la ni phan btags la gzugs ni nye bar bcom na de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba bar mar gnas skabs la mig gi rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba med par skye'i sdug bsngal dang bcas par skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la ni phan btags la gzugs ni nye bar bcom na de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba bar mar gnas skabs la mig gi rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba med par skye'i sdug bsngal dang bcas par skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, when the eye is helped and form is destroyed, the eye consciousness arises free from attachment to the intermediate state, but it does not arise with suffering.

original: gzugs la ni phan btags la mig ni yongs su ma spangs la mig ser gyi nad dam rab rib kyi gnod pas nyams na ser por mthong bar 'khrul pa 'am /
analyzed: gzugs la ni phan btags la mig ni yongs su ma spangs la mig ser gyi nad dam rab rib kyi gnod pas nyams na ser por mthong bar 'khrul pa 'am /
translated: When form is helped and the eye is not abandoned, but the eye is impaired by the affliction of jaundice or cataracts, the error of seeing yellow arises.

original: skra shad la sogs pa mthong bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde bzhin du gzugs ni gsal la mig ni rdul gyis mi gsal bar gyur na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa mi gsal bar skye'o //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa mthong bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de bzhin du gzugs ni gsal la mig ni rdul gyis mi gsal bar gyur na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa mi gsal bar skye'o //
translated: Or the appearance of seeing hair and so on occurs.üîΩSimilarly, when form is clear and the eye is unclear due to dust, the eye consciousness arises unclearly.

original: de bzhin du gzugs mi gsal la gsal te mi gsal bar gyur na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa gsal bar skye'o /üîΩ// / bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs mi gsal la gsal te mi gsal bar gyur na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa gsal bar skye'o /üîΩ// / bam po brgyad pa /
translated: Similarly, when form is unclear and the eye is clear and not unclear, the eye consciousness arises clearly.

original: 'di ltar bya rgod kyi mig ni rang bzhin gyis gsal pas ro'i gzugs mi gsal yang dpag tshad du mas bar du chod pa la yang mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bya rgod kyi mig ni rang bzhin gyis gsal pas ro'i gzugs mi gsal yang dpag tshad du mas bar du chod pa la yang mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since the vulture‚Äôs eye is naturally clear, visual consciousness arises in it even with respect to a form that is not clear and that is obstructed by many yojanas.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the ear, etc.

original: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa de'i phyir dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin phyir // zhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa de'i phyir dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because of the uncommonality of the basis.

original: rten gyi dngos po ni bshad zin pas de'i phyir gus par mi byed kyi thun mong ma yin pa nyid kho na bshad pa'i phyir ji ltar na thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rten gyi dngos po ni bshad zin pas de'i phyir gus par mi byed kyi thun mong ma yin pa nyid kho na bshad pa'i phyir ji ltar na thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The basis has been explained, therefore, it is not respected. Because of the uncommonality, it is explained. In order to explain the uncommonality, it is said, ‚ÄúHow is it uncommon?‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Also, the visual consciousness of another means the consciousness that exists in another continuum.

original: de dag @81b kho nas rnam par shes pa bstan zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du bstan gyi /
analyzed: de dag @81b kho nas rnam par shes pa bstan zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du bstan gyi /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConsciousness is taught by them alone‚Äù means that eye consciousness up to mental consciousness are taught by the eyes and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pas gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa nas chos kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pas gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa nas chos kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du ni ma yin no //
translated: But form consciousness up to dharma consciousness are not taught by form and so on.

original: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu zhes rnga bo che dang nas de dag gi sgo nas ston gyi //
analyzed: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu zhes rnga bo che dang nas de dag gi sgo nas ston gyi //
translated: For example, the sound of a drum and the sprout of barley are taught in the world by the drum and barley, respectively, because they are not shared.

original: dbyig pa'i sgra dang zhing gi myu gu zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbyig pa'i sgra dang zhing gi myu gu zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: But they are not taught by the sound of a stick or the sprout of a field.

original: dbyug pa yang rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra'i rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: dbyug pa yang rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra'i rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: A stick can be the cause of the sound of a pataha drum and so on.

original: zhing yang 'bras s'a lu dang gro la sogs pa'i myu gu'i rgyur 'gyur mod kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir de dag gi sgo nas ston par mi byed kyi //
analyzed: zhing yang 'bras s'a lu dang gro la sogs pa'i myu gu'i rgyur 'gyur mod kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir de dag gi sgo nas ston par mi byed kyi //
translated: The field is indeed the cause of the sprout of rice, wheat, etc. , but it is not indicated by that, because it is common.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rnga bo che dang nas dag gi sgo nas ston pa ltar /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rnga bo che dang nas dag gi sgo nas ston pa ltar /
translated: But the drum and barley are indicated by that, because they are not common.

original: 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: So too, it should be understood here.

original: gzhan yang gnyi ga sems can du bgrang ba yin pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnyi ga sems can du bgrang ba yin pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the eye consciousness is the cause of the eye consciousness, because both are counted as sentient beings.

original: gzugs ni sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa yang yin no //üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa yang yin no // mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: But form is not counted as a sentient being.

original: de ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The eye consciousness is the cause of the eye consciousness, because it is the cause.

original: rnam par shes pa bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mig phan pa dang gnod par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mig phan pa dang gnod par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye consciousness is the cause of the eye consciousness, because the eye consciousness is engaged in benefitting and harming the eye consciousness that is concomitant with the feeling of pleasure and pain.

original: mig nas rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig nas rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that is in the eye is eye consciousness.

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid du de'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid du de'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages its object through that eye, which is not common to all.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: Eye consciousness is the consciousness of the eye.

original: sems can du bgrang ba nyid bdag por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba nyid bdag por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the dominant factor in the enumeration of sentient beings.

original: mig la rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig la rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness in the eye is eye consciousness.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni mig kho na la yongs su gcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni mig kho na la yongs su gcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pleasure and pain that are associated with it are to be experienced by the eye alone.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The same should be applied to the ear, etc.

original: de ltar na mig la sogs pa kho na'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa bstan par rung gi gzugs la sogs pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mig la sogs pa kho na'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa bstan par rung gi gzugs la sogs pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is appropriate to teach the consciousnesses by means of the eye, etc., but not by means of form, etc.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i sa pa'i mig gis de dag gis pa dang sa 'og ma'i gzugs rnams la lta ba'i yang @82a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i sa pa'i mig gis de dag gis pa dang sa 'og ma'i gzugs rnams la lta ba'i yang @82a * //
translated: Eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe same should be applied to those born in the desire realm.üîΩThe same should be applied to those born in the desire realm.

original: de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa de kho na'i sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa de kho na'i sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The same should be applied to those born in the first absorption.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe same should be applied to those born in the third absorption and so on.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la sogs pa'i mig gis lta ba'i yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang por skyes pa de kho na'i bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i mig gis lta ba'i sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la sogs pa'i mig gis lta ba'i yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang por skyes pa de kho na'i bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i mig gis lta ba'i sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.

original: lus la 'og ma'i mig ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: lus la 'og ma'i mig ma yin // zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.

original: rang gi sa pa dang / sa 'og ma ni khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa dang / sa 'og ma ni khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: The eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own level and lower levels.üîΩThe eyes of the third and fourth absorptions see forms of their own

original: lus dang mig dang gzugs rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar sa lnga pa dag yin no zhes bya ba la lus ni khog pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang mig dang gzugs rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar sa lnga pa dag yin no zhes bya ba la lus ni khog pa ste /
translated: Body, eye, and form are five levels, from the desire realm up to the fourth absorption.

original: lus la sogs pa 'di dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams na med pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar dag yin no //üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang sa gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dag yin te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa 'di dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams na med pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar dag yin no // mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang sa gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dag yin te /
translated: These body, eye, and form are from the desire realm up to the fourth absorption level, because they do not exist in the formless realm.üîΩEye consciousness is two levels, from the desire realm up to the first absorption.

original: de dag na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag yod pa'i phyir la mig gi rnam par shes pa yang gdon mi za bar rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag yod pa'i phyir la mig gi rnam par shes pa yang gdon mi za bar rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are from the desire realm up to the first absorption level, because investigation and analysis exist on those levels and eye consciousness definitely possesses investigation and analysis.

original: mig gi gong ma'i gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba ni mig gi yul ni gong ma'i gzugs ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi gong ma'i gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba ni mig gi yul ni gong ma'i gzugs ma yin te /
translated: Form that is higher than the eye is not the object of the eye.

original: sa gong ma'i gzugs ni phra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gong ma'i gzugs ni phra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Form of a higher level is not the object of the eye of a lower level, because form of a higher level is more subtle.

original: rang gi sa pa dang sa 'og ma pa ni khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa dang sa 'og ma pa ni khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Form of its own level and lower levels is accepted as its object.

original: rnam par shes pa'ang ci zhe na gong ma ni mig gi ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /üîΩsa 'og ma pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mig gi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang ci zhe na gong ma ni mig gi ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te / sa 'og ma pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mig gi /
translated: What about consciousness? The consciousness of a higher level is not the eye.üîΩThe eye consciousness of the first absorption level is not the object of the eye of the desire realm level.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa ni ma yin gyi rang gi sa pa dang / sa 'og ma pa ni khas blangs pa yin no //üîΩ'dod pa na spyod pa'i mig gi /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa ni ma yin gyi rang gi sa pa dang / sa 'og ma pa ni khas blangs pa yin no // 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mig gi /
translated: Eye consciousness of its own level and lower levels is accepted as its object.üîΩThe eye of the desire realm level is not the object of the eye consciousness of the first absorption level.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rang gi sa pa 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na yin la /üîΩbsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rang gi sa pa 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na yin la / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi //
translated: The eye consciousness of the desire realm level is of the desire realm level alone.üîΩThe eye of the first absorption level is the object of the eye consciousness of the first absorption level alone.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: The eye consciousness of the first absorption level is of the first absorption level alone.

original: 'di'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The eye consciousness of this realm is not of the desire realm.

original: sa 'og ma pa ni khas blangs pa yin no zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa ni khas blangs pa yin no zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it accepted that the eye consciousness of a lower level is of a lower level?

original: de skad ces bshad @82b pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de skad ces bshad @82b pa bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that this is explained,

original: 'on kyang rang gi med na sa 'og ma pa yin par 'dod kyi yod na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi med na sa 'og ma pa yin par 'dod kyi yod na ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is accepted that the eye consciousness of a lower level is of a lower level only when the eye of a higher level does not exist.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i mig ni rang gi med pas mig gi rnam par shes pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho na yin gyi //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i mig ni rang gi med pas mig gi rnam par shes pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho na yin gyi //
translated: The eye of the second, third, and fourth absorptions is of its own level, because it does not exist on a lower level. The eye consciousness is of the first absorption level only.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not of the desire realm,

original: shin tu dman pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsa 'og ma pa ni khas blangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i phyir de skad du bshad par zad do //
analyzed: shin tu dman pa'i phyir ro // sa 'og ma pa ni khas blangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i phyir de skad du bshad par zad do //
translated: because it is too inferior.üîΩIt is accepted that the eye consciousness of a lower level is of a lower level only when the eye of a higher level does not exist.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba bshad ma thag pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rigs kyi yul ni de ltar thams cad yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba bshad ma thag pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rigs kyi yul ni de ltar thams cad yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúof this‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúThe eye consciousness of this realm is not of the desire realm‚Äù refers to the eye consciousness that was just explained. The object of a type of consciousness is always of the same level as that consciousness.

original: ci rigs par ni sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: ci rigs par ni sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: They should be applied as appropriate.üîΩ

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i ni rang gi sa pa'i gzugs kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i ni rang gi sa pa'i gzugs kho na yin no //
translated: The object field of the eye consciousness of the desire realm is form of the desire realm itself.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rten can gyi yul ni rang gi sa pa dang sa 'og ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rten can gyi yul ni rang gi sa pa dang sa 'og ma yin no //
translated: The object field of the eye consciousness of the first absorption is form of the first absorption and lower levels.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i mig gi rten can gyi yul ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa dang de'i 'og ma'i sa pa thams cad yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i mig gi rten can gyi yul ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa dang de'i 'og ma'i sa pa thams cad yin no //
translated: The object field of the eye consciousness of the fourth absorption is form of the fourth absorption and all lower levels.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i bar gyis mig gi rten can gyi yul ni gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dang de'i 'og ma'i sa pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i bar gyis mig gi rten can gyi yul ni gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dang de'i 'og ma'i sa pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the object field of the eye consciousness of the second absorption is form of the second absorption and lower levels.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i rigs kyi yul ni sa gong ma dang 'og ma dang rang gi sa pa thams cad yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i rigs kyi yul ni sa gong ma dang 'og ma dang rang gi sa pa thams cad yin no //
translated: Thus the object field of the type of consciousness is all levels of the higher, lower and same level.

original: lus kyi yang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dag thams cad du yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus khog pa'i ni gzugs dang rnam par shes pa rang gi sa pa dang sa gong ma dag yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi yang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dag thams cad du yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus khog pa'i ni gzugs dang rnam par shes pa rang gi sa pa dang sa gong ma dag yin no //
translated: The form and consciousness of the body that is active in the desire realm are of its own level and higher levels.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho na yin la /
translated: The consciousness of the body of the first absorption is of the level of the first absorption alone.

original: gzugs ni rang dang 'og ma dang gong ma'i sa pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni rang dang 'og ma dang gong ma'i sa pa yin te /
translated: Form is of its own level, lower levels, and higher levels.

original: rang gi rten gyi mig ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi rten gyi mig ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the eye that is its basis.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa'i lus kyi ni rnam par shes pa ni sa 'og ma pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa'i lus kyi ni rnam par shes pa ni sa 'og ma pa kho na yin te /
translated: The consciousness of the body of the second absorption and so on is of lower levels alone.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is of the level of the first absorption alone.

original: gzugs ni bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i sa pa'i lus kyi ni gzugs ni rang dang gong ma dang 'og ma'i sa pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i sa pa'i lus kyi ni gzugs ni rang dang gong ma dang 'og ma'i sa pa yin te /
translated: The form of the body of the second and third absorptions is of its own level, higher levels, and lower levels.

original: rang gi rten gyi mig ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi rten gyi mig ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The eye of its level is like its support.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i lus @83a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i lus @83a * //
translated: The form of the body of the fourth absorption

original: kyi ni gzugs ni de yan chad na gzugs med pa'i phyir rang dang sa 'og ma pa yin te /
analyzed: kyi ni gzugs ni de yan chad na gzugs med pa'i phyir rang dang sa 'og ma pa yin te /
translated: is of its own level and lower levels, because there is no form above it.

original: rang gi rten gyi mig ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi rten gyi mig ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The eye of its level is like its support.üîΩThe ear is also like that.

original: rna ba'ang de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mig gi ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du rna ba'ang bshad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rna ba'ang de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mig gi ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du rna ba'ang bshad par bya ba yin no //
translated: The ear is also explained in the same way that the eye is explained.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩyang lus gang la gnas te rna bas sgra rnams nyan pa na ci lus dang rna ba dang sgra dang rnam par shes pa de rnams sa gcig pa kho na zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / yang lus gang la gnas te rna bas sgra rnams nyan pa na ci lus dang rna ba dang sgra dang rnam par shes pa de rnams sa gcig pa kho na zhig yin nam /
translated: How is that?

original: 'on te gzhan gyi sa pa yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi sa pa yang yin zhe na /
translated: When the ear hears sounds based on any body, are the body, ear, sound and consciousness of the same level or are they of other levels?

original: smras pa / thams cad la bye brag yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad la bye brag yod de /
translated: All have distinctions.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba rang gi rna bas rang gi sgra rnams la nyan pa na thams cad rang gi sa pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'dis 'di ni nges pa yin te zhes bya ba'i bar brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba rang gi rna bas rang gi sgra rnams la nyan pa na thams cad rang gi sa pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'dis 'di ni nges pa yin te zhes bya ba'i bar brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: When one born in the desire realm listens to sounds with his own ear, all are of his own level.

original: lus la 'og ma'i rna ba min //
analyzed: lus la 'og ma'i rna ba min //
translated: The ear is not lower than the body.

original: rna ba'i gong ma'i sgra ma yin //
analyzed: rna ba'i gong ma'i sgra ma yin //
translated: Sound is not higher than the ear.

original: rnam par shes pa 'ang sgra ni 'di'i /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'ang sgra ni 'di'i /
translated: Consciousness is of the sound and the ear.

original: lus kyi 'ang gnyi ga thams cad du //
analyzed: lus kyi 'ang gnyi ga thams cad du //
translated: Both are of the body in all cases.üîΩThis should be applied extensively.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na lus la 'og ma'i rna ba yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na lus la 'og ma'i rna ba yin /
translated: How? The ear is not lower than the body.

original: lus dang rna ba dang sgra rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar sa lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang rna ba dang sgra rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar sa lnga pa yin no //
translated: The body, ear, and sound are of five levels, from the desire realm up to the fourth absorption.

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang sa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang sa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Consciousness is of two levels, the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: de las gong ma pa'i lus yin pa sa de pa 'am sa gong ma pa'i rna ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de las gong ma pa'i lus yin pa sa de pa 'am sa gong ma pa'i rna ba yin gyi /
translated: The ear of a higher stage is the support of the ear consciousness of that stage or of a higher stage.

original: sa 'og ma pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The ear of a lower stage is not the support.

original: 'di'i rna ba'i yul ni de'i sa pa 'am sa 'og ma pa'i sgra yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i rna ba'i yul ni de'i sa pa 'am sa 'og ma pa'i sgra yin gyi /
translated: The object of the ear of a certain stage is the sound of that stage or of a lower stage.

original: rna ba'i gong ma'i sgra ma yin /
analyzed: rna ba'i gong ma'i sgra ma yin /
translated: It is not the sound of a higher stage.

original: sa gong ma pa'i sgra sa 'og ma pa'i rna bas thos par ni nam yang mi nus so //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa'i sgra sa 'og ma pa'i rna bas thos par ni nam yang mi nus so //
translated: The sound of a higher stage can never be the object of the ear of a lower stage.

original: rnam par shes pa 'am gong ma ni rna ba'i ma yin te sgra bzhin no //üîΩsgra ni 'di'i lus kyi 'ang gnyi ga thams cad du 'di'i zhes bya ba bshad ma thag pa'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ni gong ma dang 'og ma dang rang gi sa pa'i sgra thams cad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'am gong ma ni rna ba'i ma yin te sgra bzhin no // sgra ni 'di'i lus kyi 'ang gnyi ga thams cad du 'di'i zhes bya ba bshad ma thag pa'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ni gong ma dang 'og ma dang rang gi sa pa'i sgra thams cad pa yin no //
translated: The ear consciousness of a higher stage is not the result of the ear of a lower stage, just as sound is not.üîΩThe object of the ear consciousness that has just been discussed is all the sounds of the higher, lower, and same stages.üîΩThe object of the body consciousness is all the tangible objects of the higher, lower, and same stages.

original: lus kyi yang sgra dang rnam par shes pa dag thams cad du yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi yang sgra dang rnam par shes pa dag thams cad du yin no //
translated: The object of the body consciousness is all tangible objects of the higher, lower, and same stages.

original: yid ma nges te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lus la 'og ma'i mig dang rna ba ma yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas mig dang rna ba nges pa de ltar yid ni ma nges so //
analyzed: yid ma nges te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lus la 'og ma'i mig dang rna ba ma yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas mig dang rna ba nges pa de ltar yid ni ma nges so //
translated: The mind is not ascertained means that, unlike the eyes and ears, which are ascertained in the body, the mind is not ascertained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa lnga pa'i lus la yang snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba'i tshe yid @83b la sogs pa ci rigs par sa thams cad pa yin zhes bya ba ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam ni 'dod pa na spyodüîΩpa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar sa thams cad pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa lnga pa'i lus la yang snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba'i tshe yid @83b la sogs pa ci rigs par sa thams cad pa yin zhes bya ba ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar sa thams cad pa yin te /
translated: For that reason, when entering meditative attainment and when taking birth in the body of the five ƒÅyatanas, the mind and so on are of all levels as appropriate.üîΩThe mind manas, mental phenomena dharmas and mental consciousness manovij√±ƒÅna are of all levels from the desire realm to the summit of existence.

original: 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa zhig gal te 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid kyi mjug thogs su 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na zhig bskyed na thams cad 'dod paüîΩna spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa zhig gal te 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid kyi mjug thogs su 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na zhig bskyed na thams cad 'dod paüîΩna spyod pa yin no //
translated: For example, if one born in the desire realm generates desire realm mental consciousness that focuses on desire realm phenomena immediately after a desire realm mind, all are desire realm phenomena.

original: gal te skye ba'i tshe'am snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i bar las ci rigs par de kho na bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed na yid ni deüîΩdag pa yin no //
