analyzed: gal te skye ba'i tshe'am snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i bar las ci rigs par de kho na bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed na yid ni de dag pa yin no //
translated: If the desire realm mental consciousness arises from the first absorption up to the summit of existence at the time of birth or entry into meditative attainment, then the mental faculty is of that level.

original: lhag ma rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
translated: The remaining faculties are of the desire realm level.

original: ji ste de nyid na de'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed na ni dmigs pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo sa pa'i bar gyi chos rnams yin pas chos ni de dag pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste de nyid na de'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed na ni dmigs pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo sa pa'i bar gyi chos rnams yin pas chos ni de dag pa yin no //
translated: If the mental consciousness arises on that level, then the object field is phenomena of the levels from the first absorption up to the summit of existence.

original: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The remaining faculties are as before.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang por skyes pa nas srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa'i bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang por skyes pa nas srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa'i bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, it should be said that whatever is born in the first absorption up to the summit of existence is born in that level.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa'i skabs rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa'i skabs rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This concludes the supplementary discussion.

original: mig dang ni /
analyzed: mig dang ni /
translated: The eye sense faculty

original: rnam shes khams dag so so dang // lhan cig tu yang 'thob pa yod //
analyzed: rnam shes khams dag so so dang // lhan cig tu yang 'thob pa yod //
translated: There is acquisition of the elements of consciousness individually and together.

original: ces bya ba 'di'i skabs dang sbyar ba 'am /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di'i skabs dang sbyar ba 'am /
translated: This is the context for this verse.

original: yang lus gang la gnas te mig gis gzugs rnams lta ba na zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ni zhar la 'ongs pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: yang lus gang la gnas te mig gis gzugs rnams lta ba na zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ni zhar la 'ongs pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: Or else, the context is the discussion beginning with ‚ÄúWhen one sees forms with the eye while abiding in this body,‚Äù

original: lta ba dang 'brel pa'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba dang 'brel pa'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is presented in connection with seeing.

original: gnyis kyis rnam shes phyi yi lnga //
analyzed: gnyis kyis rnam shes phyi yi lnga //
translated: The five external elements are cognized by two.

original: zhes bya ba la lnga smos pa ni chos kyi khams bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la lnga smos pa ni chos kyi khams bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five are mentioned in order to exclude the element of mental objects.

original: phyi'i smos pa ni mig la sogs pa gsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyi'i smos pa ni mig la sogs pa gsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúexternal‚Äù is mentioned in order to clarify the eye, etc.

original: phyi'i lnga kho na gnyis kyis rnam par shes par bya ba yin no zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir khams gzhan bcu gsum ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gcig gis rnam par shes par bya ba yin no zhes
analyzed: phyi'i lnga kho na gnyis kyis rnam par shes par bya ba yin no zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir khams gzhan bcu gsum ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gcig gis rnam par shes par bya ba yin no zhes
translated: Since it is ascertained that only the five external elements are cognized by two, the other thirteen elements are cognized by one consciousness, because they are not objects of the five collections of consciousness.

original: bya bar grub po //
analyzed: bya bar grub po //
translated: This is established.

original: 'dus ma byas chos rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas chos rtag pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is permanent.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kho na rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kho na rtag pa yin te /
translated: Only the unconditioned is permanent.

original: dus rnams su 'pho ba med pa'i phyir rtag pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dus rnams su 'pho ba med pa'i phyir rtag pa dag yin no //
translated: They are permanent because they do not change from one moment to the next.

original: chos kyi @84a * //üîΩphyed dang gang dag ni //
analyzed: chos kyi @84a * // phyed dang gang dag ni //
translated: The other dharmas are impermanent.üîΩThe other dharmas are impermanent.

original: bcu gnyis nang gi bshad dbang po //üîΩzhes bya ba ni khams dag ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcu gnyis nang gi bshad dbang po // zhes bya ba ni khams dag ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The twelve internal sense spheres are the faculties.üîΩThe twelve internal sense spheres are the faculties.üîΩThe faculties are twenty-two.

original: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis gsungs //
analyzed: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis gsungs //
translated: The faculties are twenty-two.

original: zhes bya ba ni bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas //
translated: The Brahmin ≈öre·πáika went to the Blessed One and,

original: bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig mngon sum du yang dag par mgu ba dang kun tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig mngon sum du yang dag par mgu ba dang kun tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: having exchanged friendly greetings with the Blessed One, sat down to one side.

original: 'dug nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la bram ze rang bzhin nyan gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'dug nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la bram ze rang bzhin nyan gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat down to one side, the Brahmin ≈öre·πáika said this to the Blessed One:

original: kye go ta ma dbang po rnams dbang po rnams zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: kye go ta ma dbang po rnams dbang po rnams zhes bgyi na /
translated: ‚ÄúO Gautama, it is said that the faculties are the faculties.

original: kye goo ta ma dbang po rnams ni du zhig mchis /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma dbang po rnams ni du zhig mchis /
translated: O Gautama, how many faculties are there?

original: ji snyed cig gis ni dbang po rnams bsdus pa lags /
analyzed: ji snyed cig gis ni dbang po rnams bsdus pa lags /
translated: By how many are the faculties subsumed?

original: bram ze dbang po ni nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: bram ze dbang po ni nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag yin te /
translated: Brahmin, there are twenty-two faculties:

original: nyi shu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty-two?

original: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / mo'i dbang po dang / pho'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po dang /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / mo'i dbang po dang / pho'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po dang /
translated: The eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, the mind faculty, the female faculty, the male faculty, the life faculty,

original: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang /
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang /
translated: the pleasure faculty, the pain faculty, the mental pleasure faculty, the mental pain faculty, the neutral faculty, the faith faculty, the effort faculty, the mindfulness faculty,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dang / mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dang / mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of meditative concentration, the faculty of wisdom, the faculty producing complete knowledge, the faculty of complete knowledge, and the faculty possessing complete knowledge.

original: bram ze 'di dag ni dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: bram ze 'di dag ni dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis yin te /
translated: Brahmin, these are the twenty-two faculties.

original: 'di tsam gyis dbang po rnams bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis dbang po rnams bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they include all faculties within this number.

original: de nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa la mngon par dga' nas rjes su yi rangs te /
analyzed: de nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa la mngon par dga' nas rjes su yi rangs te /
translated: Then the Brahmin Nature-Listener rejoiced in and praised what the Blessed One had taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad nas song ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad nas song ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: He then departed from the presence of the Blessed One.

original: chos kyi phyed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi phyed ces bya ba ni /
translated: The half of the dharma means

original: chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the one part of the element of mental objects.

original: chos mngon pa pa rnams ni skye mched drug rnam par gzhag pa la ma gus pas zhes bya ba ni mig gi skye mched nas /
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa rnams ni skye mched drug rnam par gzhag pa la ma gus pas zhes bya ba ni mig gi skye mched nas /
translated: The Abhidharmikas, out of disrespect for the presentation of the six sense bases, say:

original: lus kyi skye mched dang @84b yid kyi skye mched ces bya ba'i bar skye mched drug rnam par gzhag pa rigs pa'i ngo bo la ma gus pas /
analyzed: lus kyi skye mched dang @84b yid kyi skye mched ces bya ba'i bar skye mched drug rnam par gzhag pa rigs pa'i ngo bo la ma gus pas /
translated: The six sense bases are posited as the eye sense base and so on up to the mind sense base.

original: yid kyi dbang po srog gi dbang po'i mjug thogs su 'don te dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po srog gi dbang po'i mjug thogs su 'don te dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind faculty is stated immediately after the life faculty because it is the basis of the other faculties and because it is the basis of all contaminated states.

original: tshor ba'i dbang po la sogs pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni de'i mjug thogs su 'don te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang po la sogs pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni de'i mjug thogs su 'don te /
translated: The faculties of feeling and so on are stated immediately after the mind faculty because they are the basis of the other faculties.

original: srog gi dbang po la sogs pa dbang po bcu gcig ces bya ba ni srog gi dbang po dang / tshor ba'i dbang po lnga dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po la sogs pa dbang po bcu gcig ces bya ba ni srog gi dbang po dang / tshor ba'i dbang po lnga dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'o //
translated: The eleven faculties such as the life faculty are the life faculty, the five faculties of feeling, and the five such as faith.üîΩThe three faculties are the faculty of producing complete knowledge, the faculty of complete knowledge and the faculty of the possession of complete knowledge.

original: gsum po dag gi cha'o zhes bya ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rdzas dgu'i bdag nyid dag las yid kyi dbang po ma gtogs pa gzhan brgyad ni chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: gsum po dag gi cha'o zhes bya ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rdzas dgu'i bdag nyid dag las yid kyi dbang po ma gtogs pa gzhan brgyad ni chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: The three faculties are the faculty of producing complete knowledge, the faculty of complete knowledge and the faculty of the possession of complete knowledge.

original: mig la sogs pa rang gi ming gis smos pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga ni dbang po lnga ste /üîΩmig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rang gi ming gis smos pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga ni dbang po lnga ste / mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar yin no //
translated: The five elements of eye, etc., are the five faculties,

original: mo dang pho'i dbang po dag ni lus kyi phyogs gcig kho na yin pas mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga ni dbang po bdun yin no //
analyzed: mo dang pho'i dbang po dag ni lus kyi phyogs gcig kho na yin pas mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga ni dbang po bdun yin no //
translated: because they are mentioned by their own names. The five elements of eye, etc., are the five faculties, because they are mentioned by their own names. The five faculties are the five elements of eye, etc., from the eye faculty to the body faculty.üîΩThe male and female faculties are only a part of the body faculty.

original: sems kyi khams bdun ni yid kyi dbang po yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun ni yid kyi dbang po yin no //
translated: The seven elements of consciousness are the mind faculty.

original: de ltar na nang gi khams bcu gnyis ni dbang po brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nang gi khams bcu gnyis ni dbang po brgyad yin no //
translated: Thus, the twelve internal elements are the eight faculties.üîΩThe twelve internal elements and half of the element of mental objects are faculties.

original: nang gi khams bcu gnyis kho na dang chos kyi phyed kho na dbang po yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i khams lnga dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs de las gzhan pa ni dbang po ma yin no zhes bya bar grub
analyzed: nang gi khams bcu gnyis kho na dang chos kyi phyed kho na dbang po yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i khams lnga dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs de las gzhan pa ni dbang po ma yin no zhes bya bar grub
translated: The five elements of form, etc., and the part of the element of mental objects other than that are not faculties.

original: po // chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi rnam par bshad pa don gsal ba zhes bya ba slob dpon rgyal po'o sras grags pa'i bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa las khams bstan pa zhes bya ba ste mdzod kyi gnas dang po'o /
analyzed: po // chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi rnam par bshad pa don gsal ba zhes bya ba slob dpon rgyal po'o sras grags pa'i bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa las khams bstan pa zhes bya ba ste mdzod kyi gnas dang po'o /
translated: The first topic of the Abhidharmako≈õa is called the ‚ÄúExposition of the Elements.‚Äù

original: // / dbang po rnams bshad pa la zhes bya ba ni mdzod kyi gnas dang po dang gnyis pa 'brel pa yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir dbang po rnams bshad pa la zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: // / dbang po rnams bshad pa la zhes bya ba ni mdzod kyi gnas dang po dang gnyis pa 'brel pa yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir dbang po rnams bshad pa la zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of the faculties is mentioned in order to show the connection between the first and second topics of the Abhidharmako≈õa.

original: gang gi phyir mdzod kyi gnas kyi mjug nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdzod kyi gnas kyi mjug nas /
translated: The final section of the first topic of the Abhidharmako≈õa states:

original: chos kyi phyed dang gang dag ni //
analyzed: chos kyi phyed dang gang dag ni //
translated: The half of the dharmas and those that are explained

original: bcu gnyis nang gir bshad dbang po //
analyzed: bcu gnyis nang gir bshad dbang po //
translated: as the twelve internal faculties.

original: zhes bshad pa de'i phyir 'di smos so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa de'i phyir 'di smos so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is mentioned because of that.

original: @85a * // brda sprod pa pa rnams kyi dbang po zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don bye brag tu bshad pa gzhan du byas te /
analyzed: @85a * // brda sprod pa pa rnams kyi dbang po zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don bye brag tu bshad pa gzhan du byas te /
translated: The grammarians explain the meaning of the term faculty differently.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i don ci zhe na zhes 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i don ci zhe na zhes 'dri bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of the term indriya?‚ÄùüîΩThe term indriya is derived from the verbal root ƒ´≈õ, which means to rule.

original: dbang ni dbang phyug dam pa'o zhes 'byung ste skad kyi byings de ni dbang byed pas na dbang po rnams so zhes bya ba'i ngo bo yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ni dbang phyug dam pa'o zhes 'byung ste skad kyi byings de ni dbang byed pas na dbang po rnams so zhes bya ba'i ngo bo yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The term indriya is used to refer to those entities that exercise control over their own specific objects.

original: dbang po mang ba'i phyir dbang byed pas na dbang po rnams so zhes mang po'i tshig gis bstan par byas pa yin no //üîΩde lta bas na dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni dbang po zhes bya bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po mang ba'i phyir dbang byed pas na dbang po rnams so zhes mang po'i tshig gis bstan par byas pa yin no // de lta bas na dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni dbang po zhes bya bar byas pa yin no //
translated: The term indriya is used in the plural because there are many faculties.üîΩTherefore, the term indriya is a derivative of the verbal root ƒ´≈õ, which means to rule.

original: des na nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the term indriya is derived from the verbal root ƒ´≈õ in the sense of ‚Äúthat which rules.‚Äù

original: dper na glang po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na glang po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the term ‚Äúelephant‚Äù is derived from the verbal root gaj, which means to play.

original: brda sprod pa pa rnams kyis ni 'di la tshang tshing yod pas na glang po che zhes bya'o zhes glang po che zhes bya ba'i sgras ldan pa'i don du rnam par 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: brda sprod pa pa rnams kyis ni 'di la tshang tshing yod pas na glang po che zhes bya'o zhes glang po che zhes bya ba'i sgras ldan pa'i don du rnam par 'chad par byed do //
translated: The grammarians explain the word hasti, elephant, as follows: ‚ÄúIt is an elephant because it has a thicket ,‚Äù and they explain the word as having the sense of possession.

original: nges pa'i tshig dag tu ni de la ma gus pas tshang tshing na rgyu ba'i phyir glang po che yin no zhes nges pa'i tshig gi tshig gi tshul gyis sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dag tu ni de la ma gus pas tshang tshing na rgyu ba'i phyir glang po che yin no zhes nges pa'i tshig gi tshig gi tshul gyis sgrub par byed de /
translated: In the Nirukta, the meaning of the word is established by the method of derivation: ‚ÄúIt is an elephant because it moves in a thicket with lack of respect for it.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the word should be understood in the same way here.

original: gal te brda sprod pa'i tshul tu dbang po'i rtags ni dbang po'o zhes bya bar bye brag tu bshad pa ni dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don to zhes bya bar nyams par 'gyur ba zhig na dbang byed pa'i don yin par yang 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te brda sprod pa'i tshul tu dbang po'i rtags ni dbang po'o zhes bya bar bye brag tu bshad pa ni dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don to zhes bya bar nyams par 'gyur ba zhig na dbang byed pa'i don yin par yang 'dod do //
translated: If the explanation of the word indriya, faculty, in the Abhidharmako≈õa is according to the method of the grammarians, then the meaning of indriya, faculty, as controlling faculty would be lost.

original: de lta bas na dbang po zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don bye brag tu bshad pa 'di lta bur 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang po zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don bye brag tu bshad pa 'di lta bur 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word indriya should be accepted as explained in the Abhidharmako≈õa.

original: mthong ba dang thos nas yang ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngam grog la sogs pa mthong ba dang stag la sogs pa'i sgra thos nas yang ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos nas yang ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngam grog la sogs pa mthong ba dang stag la sogs pa'i sgra thos nas yang ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of abandoning fear upon seeing and hearing, means that upon seeing a precipice, etc. and hearing the sound of a tiger, etc. fear is abandoned.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag ces bya ba ni sems las byung ba dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag ces bya ba ni sems las byung ba dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: Those that are associated means those that are accompanied by mental factors.

original: gzugs lta ba dang sgra mnyan pa dag gi zhes bya ba ni mig gis mthong ngo //üîΩrna bas thos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: gzugs lta ba dang sgra mnyan pa dag gi zhes bya ba ni mig gis mthong ngo // rna bas thos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: Seeing forms and hearing sounds means that the eye sees and the ear hears, etc.üîΩThis is the tenet of the Vaibhasikas.

original: de la ni mig dang rna ba dag ni mthong ba dang mnyan pa gtod par byed pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can dag gi thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid la dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ni mig dang rna ba dag ni mthong ba dang mnyan pa gtod par byed pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can dag gi thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid la dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: In that regard, the eye and ear are the uncommon causes of the special characteristics of directing seeing and hearing and they are the dominant conditions.

original: snga ma bzhin du lus @85b mdzes par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni sna la sogs pa med pa'i sems can rnams ni mi mdzes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du lus @85b mdzes par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni sna la sogs pa med pa'i sems can rnams ni mi mdzes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As before, the body is made beautiful means that sentient beings who lack a nose, etc., are ugly in appearance.

original: lus mi mdzes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus mi mdzes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The body is made beautiful means that the body is made beautiful.

original: de dag gis kham gyi zas la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sna la sogs pa de dag gis de la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis kham gyi zas la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sna la sogs pa de dag gis de la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they enjoy the enjoyment of oral food means that they enjoy it by means of the nose, etc.

original: dri ji ltar kham gyi zas nyid yin zhe na snas dri'i zas rnam par bcad nas kham du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ji ltar kham gyi zas nyid yin zhe na snas dri'i zas rnam par bcad nas kham du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is odor oral food? Because the nose seizes odor as food and makes it into morsels.

original: reg bya ji ltar kham gyi zas nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: reg bya ji ltar kham gyi zas nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is tactility oral food?

original: lus kyi khrus dang bsku ba la sogs pas reg bya'i zas spu'i bu ga'i khar rnam par bcad nas kham du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi khrus dang bsku ba la sogs pas reg bya'i zas spu'i bu ga'i khar rnam par bcad nas kham du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body seizes tactility as food, such as bathing, anointing, etc., and makes it into morsels through the pores of the body.

original: bzhi rnam gnyis la'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi rnam gnyis la'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four are of two kinds.

original: lo zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i gzhung lugs bstan pa yin te rang gi gzhung lugs ni 'og nas 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: lo zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i gzhung lugs bstan pa yin te rang gi gzhung lugs ni 'og nas 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúyear‚Äù indicates the opponent‚Äôs theory, while our own theory will be stated later.

original: gnyis la zhes bya ba ni re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis la zhes bya ba ni re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTwo‚Äù should be applied to each.

original: sems can gyi bye brag ni mo'o pho'o zhes bya ba la mo zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa cig yin la pho zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi bye brag ni mo'o pho'o zhes bya ba la mo zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa cig yin la pho zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin te /
translated: The distinction of sentient beings is female and male. ‚ÄúFemale‚Äù is one type of life-stream, while ‚Äúmale‚Äù is another.

original: de gnyis kyi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bye brag yin no //
translated: They are the distinction of those two.

original: sems can gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni ju ma la sogs pa dbyibs dang ro dang spyod pa gzhan pa nyid de khyad par yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig bo /
analyzed: sems can gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni ju ma la sogs pa dbyibs dang ro dang spyod pa gzhan pa nyid de khyad par yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig bo /
translated: The difference of sentient beings is the difference in shape, taste, and behavior, such as a cow, etc.üîΩOther masters say:

original: // gzhan dag na re ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag la zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon yin te /
analyzed: // gzhan dag na re ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag la zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon yin te /
translated: The former masters say:

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams la pho'i dbang po med kyang khyad par du grub pa'i phyir sems can gyi bye brag dang khyad par dag la dbang byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams la pho'i dbang po med kyang khyad par du grub pa'i phyir sems can gyi bye brag dang khyad par dag la dbang byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Though those active in the form realm do not have the male faculty, they are still distinguished, but they do not control the distinctions and specific states of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi bye brag ni khyad par gyis byas pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi bye brag ni khyad par gyis byas pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The specific states of sentient beings are made by distinctions.

original: de dag dang mi ldan pa dang nyams pa zhes bya ba de dag ni mi ldan pa yang yin la //
analyzed: de dag dang mi ldan pa dang nyams pa zhes bya ba de dag ni mi ldan pa yang yin la //
translated: Those who are not endowed with those faculties and those who degenerate are those who are not endowed and those who degenerate.

original: nyams pa yang yin pas mi ldan pa dang nyams pa'o //
analyzed: nyams pa yang yin pas mi ldan pa dang nyams pa'o //
translated: They are not endowed and they degenerate, thus they are those who are not endowed and those who degenerate.

original: mo dang pho'i dbang po de dag dang mi ldan pa dang nyams pa rnams ni de dag dang mi ldan pa dang nyams pa'o //
analyzed: mo dang pho'i dbang po de dag dang mi ldan pa dang nyams pa rnams ni de dag dang mi ldan pa dang nyams pa'o //
translated: Those who are not endowed with those male and female faculties and those who degenerate are those who are not endowed and those who degenerate.

original: gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: Who are they?

original: za ma dang ma nir dang mtshan gnyis pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: za ma dang ma nir dang mtshan gnyis pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are eunuchs sandhas, neuters pa·πá·∏çakas, and hermaphrodites ubhayavya√±janas.

original: de dag dang mi ldan pa ni za ma rnams yin te /
analyzed: de dag dang mi ldan pa ni za ma rnams yin te /
translated: Those who are not endowed with those faculties are eunuchs,

original: de dag la mo dang pho'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la mo dang pho'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the male or female faculties.

original: za ma dang ma ning dag @86a * //
analyzed: za ma dang ma ning dag @86a * //
translated: Eunuchs and neuters

original: la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between them?

original: za ma ni rang bzhin gyis mo dang pho'i dbang po med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: za ma ni rang bzhin gyis mo dang pho'i dbang po med pa dag yin no //
translated: Eunuchs are by nature those who lack either a male or female organ.

original: ma ning ni gnod pas dbang po nyams pa dag yin no //
analyzed: ma ning ni gnod pas dbang po nyams pa dag yin no //
translated: Neuters are those whose organ degenerates due to injury.

original: 'dul ba las ni rang bzhin gyis ma ning dang phrag dog can dang 'khyud pa'i ma ning dang ma ning zla phyed pa dang / bcas pa'i ma ning zhes bya ba ma ning kho na lnga 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba las ni rang bzhin gyis ma ning dang phrag dog can dang 'khyud pa'i ma ning dang ma ning zla phyed pa dang / bcas pa'i ma ning zhes bya ba ma ning kho na lnga 'byung ste /
translated: Five types of eunuch are mentioned in the Vinaya: natural eunuchs, jealous eunuchs, eunuchs through embrace, eunuchs for half a month, and eunuchs through injunctions.

original: de las rang bzhin gyis ma ning 'byung ba ni 'dir za ma yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: de las rang bzhin gyis ma ning 'byung ba ni 'dir za ma yin par 'dod de /
translated: Among them, natural eunuchs are asserted to be the same as the hermaphrodites of this treatise.

original: gang zhig rang bzhin gyis mtshan ma med pa de ni rang bzhin gyis ma ning yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig rang bzhin gyis mtshan ma med pa de ni rang bzhin gyis ma ning yin la /
translated: Because they are by nature devoid of sex organs, they are natural eunuchs.

original: lhag ma ni 'dir ma ning dang yin par 'dod de //
analyzed: lhag ma ni 'dir ma ning dang yin par 'dod de //
translated: The remaining four are asserted to be neuters.üîΩThe eunuch through injunctions is a neuter by nature, but is not a hermaphrodite.

original: re zhig bcad pa'i ma ning ni dbang po bcad pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po ma tshang ba yin no zhes bya bar gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: re zhig bcad pa'i ma ning ni dbang po bcad pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po ma tshang ba yin no zhes bya bar gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The eunuch through embrace is a neuter who becomes a male through embracing a female.

original: ma ning zla phyed pa la sogs pa ni dbang po las su mi rung ba nyid kyis de dag nyams pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ma ning zla phyed pa la sogs pa ni dbang po las su mi rung ba nyid kyis de dag nyams pa kho na yin no //
translated: The eunuch, the hermaphrodite, etc., are defective because their sexual organ is not functional.

original: dbang po las su rung ba nyid kyi dus na yang de dag nyams pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: dbang po las su rung ba nyid kyi dus na yang de dag nyams pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa kho na ste /
translated: Even when the sexual organ is functional, they are still defective.

original: de'i dbang po las su rung ba nyid ni pho'i dga' ba'i khyad par skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bu skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang po las su rung ba nyid ni pho'i dga' ba'i khyad par skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bu skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sexual organ of the eunuch, etc., does not produce the specific masculinity of the male, and does not produce a son.

original: 'dir za ma dang ma ning zhes bya ba so sor 'byung ba ni dbang po yod pa'i phyir snyam du sems pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir za ma dang ma ning zhes bya ba so sor 'byung ba ni dbang po yod pa'i phyir snyam du sems pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù in the verse should be understood as having the conjunctive sense.

original: de lta ma yin na 'dul ba bzhin du chos mngon pa 'di las kyang ma ning zhes bya ba kho na bton par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dul ba bzhin du chos mngon pa 'di las kyang ma ning zhes bya ba kho na bton par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, as in the case of the Vinaya, only the word ‚Äúeunuch‚Äù would have been used in this Abhidharma treatise.

original: mtshan gnyis pa rnams ni de dag nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa rnams ni de dag nyams pa yin te /
translated: Those who have two organs are defective.

original: gnas nyams pas nyams pa'i phyir dang bde ba chung ngu'i rgyu nyid kyis nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas nyams pas nyams pa'i phyir dang bde ba chung ngu'i rgyu nyid kyis nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called eunuchs because they are impaired in their faculties and because they are impaired in their cause of little pleasure.

original: gzhan dag na re ni de dag dang mi ldan pa rnams ni za ma yin la de dag nyams pa rnams ni ma ning yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni de dag dang mi ldan pa rnams ni za ma yin la de dag nyams pa rnams ni ma ning yin te /
translated: Others say: Those who are not endowed with those faculties are eunuchs. Those who are impaired in those faculties are neuters.

original: gnod pas nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pas nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called neuters because they are impaired by injury.

original: mtshan gnyis pa rnams kyang de dag nyams pa yin te gnas nyams pas nyams pa'i phyir dang / bde ba chung ngu'i rgyu nyid kyis nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa rnams kyang de dag nyams pa yin te gnas nyams pas nyams pa'i phyir dang / bde ba chung ngu'i rgyu nyid kyis nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Those who have two organs are also impaired because they are impaired in their faculties and because they are impaired in their cause of little pleasure.

original: de dag la ni sdom pa la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: de dag la ni sdom pa la sogs pa med do //
translated: They do not possess vows and so on.

original: za ma ma ning sgra mi snyan /
analyzed: za ma ma ning sgra mi snyan /
translated: Eunuchs, neuters, those of Kuru,

original: mtshan gnyis ma gtogs mi rnams la /üîΩsdom min zhes bya ba dang / za ma sogs la mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis ma gtogs mi rnams la / sdom min zhes bya ba dang / za ma sogs la mi 'dod do //
translated: those with two organs and so on do not possess negative commitments.

original: phan dang ngo mtshar chung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: phan dang ngo mtshar chung ba'i phyir //
translated: They do not possess negative commitments and so on because they have little shame, they have little purpose, they have little wonder and they have little pleasure.

original: zhes bya ba dang / @86b skyes pa bud med kyi 'chad do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / @86b skyes pa bud med kyi 'chad do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not objects of respect because they are not male.

original: pho dang mo rnams la ni de dag yod de //
analyzed: pho dang mo rnams la ni de dag yod de //
translated: Men and women have these.

original: de'i phyir mo dang pho'i dbang po dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mo dang pho'i dbang po dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the male and female faculties exercise controlling power with regard to the afflictions.üîΩVows, attainment of the fruits, and freedom from attachment.

original: sdom pa dang 'bras bu 'thob pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams zhes bya ba ni sdom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sdom pa dang 'bras bu 'thob pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams zhes bya ba ni sdom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Vows are of three types:

original: so so thar ba'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: so so thar ba'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: the vow of individual liberation, the vow of meditative concentration, and the uncontaminated vow.

original: de dag la ni sdom pa gcig kyang med na thams cad lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: de dag la ni sdom pa gcig kyang med na thams cad lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: Since they do not have even one vow, how could they have all three?

original: sdom pa'ang de bzhin la zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdom pa'ang de bzhin la zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, ‚ÄúVows are also like that.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag la rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa 'bras bu 'thob pa dang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dod chags bral ba yang mi srid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag la rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa 'bras bu 'thob pa dang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dod chags bral ba yang mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for them to obtain the fruits of stream entry and so on, and it is impossible for them to be free from attachment to the desire realm and so on.

original: mo dang pho rnams la ni srid pas //
analyzed: mo dang pho rnams la ni srid pas //
translated: But it is possible for men and women.

original: de'i phyir pho dang mo'i dbang po rnam par byang ba la yang dbang byed pa yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir pho dang mo'i dbang po rnam par byang ba la yang dbang byed pa yin no /
translated: Therefore, the male and female faculties also control purification.

original: ris mthun par mtshams sbyor ba dang yang dag par 'dzin pa dag la zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po ni ris mthun par skye ba la ste /
analyzed: ris mthun par mtshams sbyor ba dang yang dag par 'dzin pa dag la zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po ni ris mthun par skye ba la ste /
translated: With regard to the statement ‚ÄúThey control the connection to a homogeneous existence and the complete grasping of that existence,‚Äù the faculty of life force controls birth in a homogeneous existence.

original: de ni ris mthun par mtshams sbyor ba la dbang byed par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ni ris mthun par mtshams sbyor ba la dbang byed par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is posited that it controls the connection to a homogeneous existence.

original: ris mthun pa yang dag par 'dzin pa la yang dbang byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ris mthun pa yang dag par 'dzin pa la yang dbang byed pa yin te /
translated: It also controls the complete grasping of a homogeneous existence.

original: srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis de'i 'og tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis de'i 'og tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis for the subsequent existence of that life force.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyis yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyis yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental faculty controls the connection to a new existence in cyclic existence because it connects to a new existence through being afflicted.

original: 'di srog gi dbang po las khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di srog gi dbang po las khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between this and the faculty of life force?

original: srog gi dbang po ni srid pa bar ma kho nar mtshams sbyor ba yin la /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni srid pa bar ma kho nar mtshams sbyor ba yin la /
translated: The faculty of life force controls the connection to a new existence in the intermediate existence alone.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni skye ba'i srid par yang yin no //üîΩsrog gi dbang po ni dus mnyam du ris mthun pa dang der mtshams sbyor bar byed kyi yid kyi dbang po ni dus tha dad pa yin yang /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni skye ba'i srid par yang yin no // srog gi dbang po ni dus mnyam du ris mthun pa dang der mtshams sbyor bar byed kyi yid kyi dbang po ni dus tha dad pa yin yang /
translated: The mental faculty is also in the intermediate existence.

original: yang srid par mtshams sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: yang srid par mtshams sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The faculty of life force is that which causes the connection to a homogeneous section and rebirth at the same time. The mental faculty is that which causes the connection to rebirth at a different time.

original: dbang gi ngo bo dang mthun par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten nam chos ni sems kyi dbang gi ngo bo dang mthun par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang gi ngo bo dang mthun par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten nam chos ni sems kyi dbang gi ngo bo dang mthun par byed pa yin no //
translated: The statement the world or phenomena are controlled by the mind means that the world or phenomena are controlled by the mind.üîΩAs it is said, this world is led by the mind, and so on.

original: ji skad du 'jig rten 'di ni sems kyis khrid do zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa las kyang /üîΩ'jig rten sems kyis khrid pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du 'jig rten 'di ni sems kyis khrid do zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa las kyang / 'jig rten sems kyis khrid pa ste /
translated: The verse states:üîΩThe world is led by the mind;

original: sems kyis yongs su drangs pa yin //üîΩsems kyi @87a * //üîΩchos ni gcig pu yi //
analyzed: sems kyis yongs su drangs pa yin // sems kyi @87a * // chos ni gcig pu yi //
translated: the world is drawn by the mind.üîΩThere is no doubt

original: dbang gi rjes su chos kun 'gro //üîΩzhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang gi rjes su chos kun 'gro //üîΩzhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: that phenomena follow the mind.

original: de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la dmigs pa 'am mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas bde ba la sogs pa de dag la rgyas par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'dod chags la
analyzed: de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la dmigs pa 'am mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas bde ba la sogs pa de dag la rgyas par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'dod chags la
translated: They are called the basis of attachment and so on because pleasure and so on increase in them, either by taking them as objects or by being concomitant with them.

original: sogs pa 'di dag ni de dag la rgyas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa 'di dag ni de dag la rgyas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Attachment and so on increase in them.

original: de'i ngo bo ni de dag la rgyas par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de dag la rgyas par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Their nature is that they increase in them.

original: de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i phyir te /
translated: Because of that,

original: ji skad du bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji skad du bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur la /
translated: as it is said: Attachment increases in the feeling of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal la ni zhe sdang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa de ba yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ni zhe sdang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa de ba yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Aversion increases in the feeling of pain. Delusion increases in the feeling that is neither.

original: de dag gis rnam par byang bar byed do zhes bya ba ni de dag gis rnam par dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gis rnam par byang bar byed do zhes bya ba ni de dag gis rnam par dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They purify means they are purified.

original: de ltar na dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par bya ba la dbang phyed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par bya ba la dbang phyed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said that these such as faith are dominant in purifying the passions.

original: gzhan dag na re bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba la yang dbang byed de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba la yang dbang byed de zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say: Pleasure, etc. are dominant in purification also.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni bde ba la sogs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig la dbang byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni bde ba la sogs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig la dbang byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The word also indicates that pleasure, etc. are not dominant only in the passions.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of also?

original: rnam par byang ba la yang yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba la yang yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It means that pleasure, etc. are also dominant in purification.

original: chos mngon pa pa kho na kha cig de skad ces zer te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa kho na kha cig de skad ces zer te /
translated: Some Abhidharmikas say this.

original: de dag rnam par byang ba la dbang byed pa yod de zhes bya ba'i lung 'di ltar bde bar gyur ba'i sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang khyer te 'ongs bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag rnam par byang ba la dbang byed pa yod de zhes bya ba'i lung 'di ltar bde bar gyur ba'i sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang khyer te 'ongs bar byed do //
translated: They bring this scripture to support their view: ‚ÄúThey are dominant in purification also. Thus it is said: ‚ÄòA mind that is happy becomes concentrated.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can gyi dad pa ni 'di la rgyu sdug bsngal yod pas na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can gyi dad pa ni 'di la rgyu sdug bsngal yod pas na /
translated: Faith that has suffering for its cause is faith that has suffering for its cause.

original: dad pa 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: dad pa 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can yin no //
translated: This faith has suffering for its cause.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It has suffering for its origin.

original: sdug bsngal yod na 'ga' zhig chos sam dkon mchog gsum la dad pa skye ba'am rab tu 'byung ba mngon par 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yod na 'ga' zhig chos sam dkon mchog gsum la dad pa skye ba'am rab tu 'byung ba mngon par 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is suffering, some people produce faith in the Dharma or in the Three Jewels, or they aspire to go forth.üîΩThere are six kinds of joy, etc., that are based on deliverance.

original: yid bde ba la sogs pa nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug ces bya ba ni yid bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug dag dang yid mi bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug dag dang / btang snyoms nges par 'byung @87b ba la brten pa drug dag ste /
analyzed: yid bde ba la sogs pa nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug ces bya ba ni yid bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug dag dang yid mi bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug dag dang / btang snyoms nges par 'byung @87b ba la brten pa drug dag ste /
translated: There are six kinds of joy that are based on deliverance, six kinds of sorrow that are based on deliverance, and six kinds of equanimity that are based on deliverance.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i lam yin no //
translated: Deliverance is the path, whether it is impure or pure.

original: gzhan dag na re khams sam 'khor ba la nges par 'byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re khams sam 'khor ba la nges par 'byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is the detachment and renunciation of the realms or of cyclic existence.üîΩAs a s≈´tra explains:

original: mdo las ji skad du mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten te /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten te /
translated: In dependence on forms that are objects of eye consciousness,

original: yid bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /üîΩnges par 'byung ba la dmigs pa 'am /
analyzed: yid bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste / nges par 'byung ba la dmigs pa 'am /
translated: mental satisfaction that is renunciation arises.

original: nges par 'byung ba dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called ‚Äúhaving renunciation as its object‚Äù or ‚Äúhaving renunciation as its nature.‚ÄùüîΩSimilarly, in dependence on mental phenomena that are objects of mental consciousness, mental satisfaction that is renunciation arises.

original: de bzhin du yid dang chos rnams la brten te yid bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten te yid mi bde ba skye'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid dang chos rnams la brten te yid bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten te yid mi bde ba skye'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In dependence on forms that are objects of eye consciousness, mental dissatisfaction arises.

original: de bzhin du yid dang zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten te btang snyoms nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye'o zhes bya ba dang de bzhin du yid dang zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid dang zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten te btang snyoms nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye'o zhes bya ba dang de bzhin du yid dang zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa lta bu yin te /
translated: So too, ‚Äúin dependence on forms that are objects of eye consciousness, equanimity that is based on the renunciation of desire arises,‚Äù and so too, ‚Äúup to the mind is not agitated.‚Äù

original: la la ni nges par 'byung ba thob par 'gyur ro snyam du yid bde ba yin no //
analyzed: la la ni nges par 'byung ba thob par 'gyur ro snyam du yid bde ba yin no //
translated: Some are pleased, thinking, ‚ÄúI will attain renunciation.‚Äù

original: la la ni bdag gis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir 'bad pa ma byas so snyam du yid mi bde ba yin no //
analyzed: la la ni bdag gis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir 'bad pa ma byas so snyam du yid mi bde ba yin no //
translated: Some are displeased, thinking, ‚ÄúI have not striven to attain renunciation.‚Äù

original: la la ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag la so sor brtags nas btang snyoms su byed pa yin no //
analyzed: la la ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag la so sor brtags nas btang snyoms su byed pa yin no //
translated: Some are equanimous, having investigated forms and so on.

original: gzhan dag na re ni zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag yin no //
translated: Others say:

original: rnam par shes nas yang ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pas yang ba yongs su spong bar byed kyi mig dang rna bas ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes nas yang ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pas yang ba yongs su spong bar byed kyi mig dang rna bas ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that consciousness completely abandons what is light, but the eye and ear do not.üîΩThere is no seeing of form or hearing of sound that is other than consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa gzugs mthong ba 'am sgra thos pa yang med ces bya ba ni gzugs mthong ba dang sgra thos pa ni dpyad na 'dzin pa las logs shig na yod par mi dmigs la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa gzugs mthong ba 'am sgra thos pa yang med ces bya ba ni gzugs mthong ba dang sgra thos pa ni dpyad na 'dzin pa las logs shig na yod par mi dmigs la /
translated: When one investigates, one does not observe the seeing of form and the hearing of sound apart from the apprehender.

original: 'dzin pa yang rnam par shes pa kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yang rnam par shes pa kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The apprehender is consciousness alone, and not anything else.

original: de lta bas na mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag skyed pa la dbang byed par bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid de yin gyi 'di dag gzhan la dbang byed pa @88a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag skyed pa la dbang byed par bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid de yin gyi 'di dag gzhan la dbang byed pa @88a * //
translated: Therefore, the eye and ear are said to exercise controlling power over the generation of their respective consciousnesses and their concomitant states.

original: ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: They do not exercise controlling power over anything else.

original: yid ni don thams cad la dmigs par bya ba la zhes bya ba smos pa ni rang gi don la dmigs pa dang dbang byed phyir zhes bya ba kho nas grub pa las yid ni don thams cad la dmigs par bya ba la zhes 'byung ba'i sa pa
analyzed: yid ni don thams cad la dmigs par bya ba la zhes bya ba smos pa ni rang gi don la dmigs pa dang dbang byed phyir zhes bya ba kho nas grub pa las yid ni don thams cad la dmigs par bya ba la zhes 'byung ba'i sa pa
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because it is established that the mental faculty is the dominant condition for its own object and for the object of the eye faculty, etc.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.

original: ni chos thams cad chos kyi khams kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te 'di ni gong du rnam par bshad zin to //üîΩ'di la don rnams kyang dbang byed ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni chos thams cad chos kyi khams kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te 'di ni gong du rnam par bshad zin to // 'di la don rnams kyang dbang byed ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.

original: lhag par dbang byed pa nyid ni dbang byed pa nyid yin la zhes bya ba ni lhag par dbang byed pa ni dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag par dbang byed pa nyid ni dbang byed pa nyid yin la zhes bya ba ni lhag par dbang byed pa ni dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects‚Äù is stated because the mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects, not just its own object.

original: de'i ngo bo ni lhag par dbang byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni lhag par dbang byed pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mental faculty is the dominant condition for all objects

original: gzugs thams cad la dmigs par bya ba la thun mong gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig gi ngo bo gcig pu ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs thams cad dmigs par bya ba la rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad la dmigs par bya ba la thun mong gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig gi ngo bo gcig pu ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs thams cad dmigs par bya ba la rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the common cause for the observation of all forms.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo gcig pu ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs thams cad dmigs par bya ba la rgyu nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo gcig pu ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs thams cad dmigs par bya ba la rgyu nyid ma yin te /
translated: The single nature of the eye is not the cause for the observation of all forms, such as blue, yellow, etc.

original: gzugs sngon po ni gzugs ser po dmigs par bya ba la rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs sngon po ni gzugs ser po dmigs par bya ba la rgyu ma yin no //
translated: For example, blue form is not the cause for the observation of yellow form.üîΩBecause the observation conforms to the clarity, etc., of the eye.

original: dmigs pa de gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dmigs pa ni mig la sogs pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed de //
analyzed: dmigs pa de gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dmigs pa ni mig la sogs pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed de //
translated: Thus, the observation conforms to the clarity and unclarity of the eye, etc.

original: 'di lta ste mig gsal na ni de'i dmigs pa gsal la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mig gsal na ni de'i dmigs pa gsal la /
translated: For example, if the eye is clear, its observation is clear.

original: mig mi gsal na ni mi gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: mig mi gsal na ni mi gsal ba yin no //
translated: If the eye is unclarity, the observation is unclarity.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mi dge ba dang dge ba dang tshor ba dang bcas pa dang tshor ba med pa'i rjes su byed pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mi dge ba dang dge ba dang tshor ba dang bcas pa dang tshor ba med pa'i rjes su byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that the mental faculty is also concomitant with the other mental factors that are either nonvirtuous, virtuous, associated with feeling, or not associated with feeling.

original: yid mi dge na ni dmigs pa mi dge ba yin la /
analyzed: yid mi dge na ni dmigs pa mi dge ba yin la /
translated: If the mental faculty is nonvirtuous, then its object is also nonvirtuous.

original: dge na ni dge ba yin //
analyzed: dge na ni dge ba yin //
translated: If it is virtuous, then its object is also virtuous.

original: tshor ba dang bcas na ni tshor ba dang bcas pa yin //
analyzed: tshor ba dang bcas na ni tshor ba dang bcas pa yin //
translated: If it is associated with feeling, then its object is also associated with feeling.

original: tshor ba med na ni tshor ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba med na ni tshor ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If it is not associated with feeling, then its object is also not associated with feeling.

original: dmigs pa gzugs kyis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa gzugs kyis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The mental faculty is not concomitant with the clarity or unclarity of its object, etc.

original: de'i phyir // de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir // de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚Äúbecause it is the opposite of those.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na mig la sogs pa lhag par dbang @88b byed pa yin gyi //
analyzed: de lta bas na mig la sogs pa lhag par dbang @88b byed pa yin gyi //
translated: Therefore, the eye faculty, etc., are dominant faculties because they are superior to form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Form, etc., are not dominant faculties.üîΩThe male and female faculties are in the body.

original: lus las mo dang pho'i dbang dag ces bya ba 'di la sgrub pa ni mo dang pho'i dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: lus las mo dang pho'i dbang dag ces bya ba 'di la sgrub pa ni mo dang pho'i dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The proof of this is as follows: The male and female faculties are by nature the body faculty.

original: reg bya'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mo dang pho'i dbang po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i lus kyi dbang po bzhin no //
analyzed: reg bya'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mo dang pho'i dbang po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i lus kyi dbang po bzhin no //
translated: It is not the essence of the male and female faculties because it generates tactile consciousness. It is like the body faculty.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni mig gi dbang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni mig gi dbang po lta bu'o //
translated: The dissimilar example is like the eye faculty.

original: mo'i dbang po ni rang bzhin nga ro dang g-yo ba dang bsam pa dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mo'i dbang po ni rang bzhin nga ro dang g-yo ba dang bsam pa dag ces bya ba la /
translated: The female faculty is the nature of the body that is the basis of feminine characteristics, such as a slender body, a high voice, feminine gestures, and feminine thoughts.

original: mo'i bsam pa ni mo ni pho la sems pa yin no //
analyzed: mo'i bsam pa ni mo ni pho la sems pa yin no //
translated: Feminine thoughts are the mind that is attracted to males.

original: pho ni bzlog pa yin te de lta yin dang mo dang pho'i dbang po dag ni sems can gyi khyad par kho na la dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: pho ni bzlog pa yin te de lta yin dang mo dang pho'i dbang po dag ni sems can gyi khyad par kho na la dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: The male faculty is the opposite of that. That being so, the female and male faculties control the distinctions of sentient beings.

original: srog gi dbang po ni ris mthun par gnas par bya ba la dbang byed pa yin gyi bye brag tu smra ba'i lta bur ris mthun pa'i bar mtshams sbyor ba la dbang byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni ris mthun par gnas par bya ba la dbang byed pa yin gyi bye brag tu smra ba'i lta bur ris mthun pa'i bar mtshams sbyor ba la dbang byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The faculty of life force controls remaining in a class of sentient beings. It does not control connecting to a class of sentient beings, as the Vaibhasikas say.

original: de la ni yid kho na dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni yid kho na dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because the mind controls that.

original: tshor ba rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba la dbang byed de zhes bya ba 'di la ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams dang gzhung lugs gcig go //
analyzed: tshor ba rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba la dbang byed de zhes bya ba 'di la ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams dang gzhung lugs gcig go //
translated: Feeling controls the afflictions.üîΩThe Vaibhasikas and this treatise agree on this point.

original: 'di ltar de dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúThey control the complete clearing of the afflictions,‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyang rnam par gnon pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi rnam pa dag gis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyang rnam par gnon pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi rnam pa dag gis so //
translated: the afflictions are suppressed by the aspects of the mundane path.

original: lam yang 'dren par byed pa par byang ba'i tshogs la dbang byed do zhes bshad pa yin no /üîΩdag gis so //
analyzed: lam yang 'dren par byed pa par byang ba'i tshogs la dbang byed do zhes bshad pa yin no / dag gis so //
translated: The path is controlled by the faculties of complete training.

original: de ltar na dad pa la sogs pa ni re re zhing rnam par byang ba'i tshogs la dbang byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dad pa la sogs pa ni re re zhing rnam par byang ba'i tshogs la dbang byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said that faith and so on control the complete clearing of the afflictions.

original: sems rnam par ma grol ba la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med ces bya ba ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni zad pa zhes pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i dbang po yin no //
analyzed: sems rnam par ma grol ba la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med ces bya ba ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni zad pa zhes pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i dbang po yin no //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, ‚ÄúOne who is not liberated in mind does not attain nirvana.‚Äù The faculty of possessing complete knowledge is an uncontaminated faculty that is called ‚Äúexhaustion‚Äù and so on.

original: de nyid kyang nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dang rgyud rnam par grol ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyang nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dang rgyud rnam par grol ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba yin la /
translated: and it is also liberation because it is completely liberated from the defilements and because the mindstream is liberated.

original: de thob pa ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thob pa ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The attainment of that is nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder of the aggregates.

original: de lta bas na kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba la dbang byed par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba la dbang byed par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus the faculty of final and perfect knowledge is established as the dominant condition for nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder of the aggregates.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba @89a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba @89a * //
translated: For the sake of abiding happily in this life

original: rgyas par 'byung ba ni chos mthong ba ni mthong ba'i chos te mthong ba'i tshe zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyas par 'byung ba ni chos mthong ba ni mthong ba'i chos te mthong ba'i tshe zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The extensive explanation is: The seen Dharma is seeing the Dharma. It means at the time of seeing.

original: gnas pa bde ba ni bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa bde ba ni bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: Happy abiding is abiding happily.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding happily in the seen Dharma is abiding happily in the seen Dharma.üîΩThe faculty of final and perfect knowledge is the dominant condition for abiding happily in the seen Dharma.

original: rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because one experiences the joy and pleasure of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: dga' ba ni yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni yid bde ba'o //
translated: Joy is mental satisfaction.

original: bde ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: Pleasure is the pleasure of pliancy.

original: rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba ni rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba ni rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba ste /
translated: The experience of the joy and pleasure of liberation is the experience of the joy and pleasure of liberation.

original: de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that.

original: 'di skad du rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba yang dag par myong ba nyid mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du rnam par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba yang dag par myong ba nyid mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: the experience of the joy and pleasure of liberation is the present comfort of one who sees.

original: ngag dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang rkub dang mdoms rnams kyang dbang po nyid du kha bskang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa ma gtogs pa ngag gi dbang po la sogs par rtog par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ngag dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang rkub dang mdoms rnams kyang dbang po nyid du kha bskang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa ma gtogs pa ngag gi dbang po la sogs par rtog par byed pa yin te /
translated: The faculties of speech, hands, feet, anus, and genitals should be added to the list of faculties.

original: ngag gi dbang po ni gang gis na tshig smra bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ngag gi dbang po ni gang gis na tshig smra bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The faculty of speech is that by which one speaks words.

original: lag pa'i dbang po ni gang gis na rdzas cung zad len par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lag pa'i dbang po ni gang gis na rdzas cung zad len par byed pa yin no //
translated: The faculty of hands is that by which one grasps small objects.

original: rkang pa'i dbang po ni gang gis na 'gro bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rkang pa'i dbang po ni gang gis na 'gro bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The faculty of feet is that by which one moves about.

original: 'chag par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'chag par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is also called the faculty of walking.

original: rkub kyi dbang po ni gang gis na rtug pa rtug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rkub kyi dbang po ni gang gis na rtug pa rtug par byed pa yin no //
translated: The faculty of the anus is that by which one discharges feces.

original: mdoms kyi dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po phyogs gcig las ma gtogs pa gang gis na kun tu dga' ba'i khyad par 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: mdoms kyi dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po phyogs gcig las ma gtogs pa gang gis na kun tu dga' ba'i khyad par 'thob pa yin no //
translated: The faculty of the genitals is that by which one experiences special pleasure. It is not a separate part of the body faculty.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis don gang gis dbang po nyid shu rtsa gnyis su gsungs pa de ma rig pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dbang po nyid du kha bskang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis don gang gis dbang po nyid shu rtsa gnyis su gsungs pa de ma rig pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dbang po nyid du kha bskang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Ignorance and so on are not to be added to the faculties because they are not related to the meaning for which the Blessed One taught twenty-two faculties.

original: don de yang gang zhe na sems kyi rten dang de'i bye brag ces bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: don de yang gang zhe na sems kyi rten dang de'i bye brag ces bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: What is that meaning? He says: the basis of mind, its differentiation, and so on.

original: sems kyi rten dang / rten de'i bye brag dang / gnas pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i tshogs dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rten dang / rten de'i bye brag dang / gnas pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i tshogs dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The basis of mind, the differentiation of that basis, its duration, its defilement and purification, and its liberation.

original: skye mched drug po de dag ni sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi @89b yin no zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa rnams de dag la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug po de dag ni sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi @89b yin no zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa rnams de dag la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those six bases are the substantial basis of sentient beings because the others are dependent on them.

original: 'di ltar dbang po drug gi dbang gis rten dang / yul gyi rnam par shes pa drug 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po drug gi dbang gis rten dang / yul gyi rnam par shes pa drug 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the six consciousnesses of the sense faculties and their objects arise from those six bases.

original: 'di dag kyang sems can gyi rdza yin par ni 'dod mid kyi gzhi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang sems can gyi rdza yin par ni 'dod mid kyi gzhi ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the basis of the desire to possess sentient beings.

original: de la sogs pa'i dbang gis skye mched drug byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i dbang gis skye mched drug byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The six sense spheres do not arise by the power of these.

original: lngas ni rnam par byang ba'i tshogs sogs par byed do zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lngas ni rnam par byang ba'i tshogs sogs par byed do zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Five are the accumulation of purification, that is, faith, etc.

original: gsum gyis ni rnam par byang bar byed de zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni rnam par byang bar byed de zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pas so //
translated: Three are purification, that is, the faculty of understanding what has not been understood, etc.

original: rtog pa gzhan /
analyzed: rtog pa gzhan /
translated: Another theoryüîΩThe support of engagement, nonarising,

original: 'jug pa'i rten dang mi skye dang // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'jug pa'i phyogs dang ldog pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin te /üîΩ'jug pa ste 'khor ba'i rten dang / skye ba dang gnas pa dang nye bar spyod pa dang ldog pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rten dang mi skye dang // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'jug pa'i phyogs dang ldog pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin te / 'jug pa ste 'khor ba'i rten dang / skye ba dang gnas pa dang nye bar spyod pa dang ldog pa ste /
translated: This is stated in detail from the perspective of the engaged side and the disengaged side.üîΩThe support of engagement, that is, sa·πÉsƒÅra, is birth, duration, and nourishment.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rten dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / nye bar spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rten dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / nye bar spyod pa yin no //
translated: The support of disengagement, that is, nirvƒÅ·πáa, is birth, duration, and nourishment.

original: 'di tsam gyis na skyes bu'i don yongs su rdzogs pa de las gzhan pa'i dbang po gdags pa ni don med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis na skyes bu'i don yongs su rdzogs pa de las gzhan pa'i dbang po gdags pa ni don med pa yin no //
translated: The designation of other faculties is meaningless.

original: khyed kyi de'i sgra la sogs pa dmigs pa ni dang po yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyi de'i sgra la sogs pa dmigs pa ni dang po yin no //
translated: For you, the first is the perception of sound, etc.

original: yon tan dang skyes bu'i khyad par dmigs pa ni mtha' yin no zhes skyes bu'i don yongs su rdzogs pa 'don to //
analyzed: yon tan dang skyes bu'i khyad par dmigs pa ni mtha' yin no zhes skyes bu'i don yongs su rdzogs pa 'don to //
translated: The last is the perception of the distinction of quality and substance.

original: de la skye mched drug po sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhir gyur pas ni 'khor bas na 'jug pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: de la skye mched drug po sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhir gyur pas ni 'khor bas na 'jug pa'i rten yin no //
translated: The six sense-spheres are the basis of the substance of a sentient being, and since they revolve, they are the support of engagement.
