original: skye ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po dag yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ni skye bar 'gyur bas na skye ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po dag yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ni skye bar 'gyur bas na skye ba'o //
translated: The faculties of male and female are birth.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because they are born from that.

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug ste /
translated: The six sense-spheres.

original: yid dang lus kyi dbang po dag ni de dag las mngon sum du skye ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: yid dang lus kyi dbang po dag ni de dag las mngon sum du skye ba'i phyir la /
translated: The mental faculty and body faculty are directly born from them.

original: mig la sogs pa bzhi ni rim gyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhi ni rim gyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The four beginning with the eye are the basis of birth, because they are born in sequence.

original: gnas pa ni srog gi dbang po yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa ni srog gi dbang po yin te /
translated: The basis of duration is the faculty of life force,

original: skye mched drug gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the six sense spheres to endure.

original: tshor ba rnams kyis ni nye bar spyod par byed de ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyis ni nye bar spyod par byed de ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The basis of experience is the three feelings, because they experience pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: ldog pa'i rten ni dad pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa ni gzhir gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rten ni dad pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa ni gzhir gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of turning away is faith, etc., because faith, etc., are the basis.

original: skye ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin no zhes bya ba ni dang por skyes pa ste /üîΩthog pa ma nyid du zag pa med pa skye ba yin @90a * //
analyzed: skye ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin no zhes bya ba ni dang por skyes pa ste / thog pa ma nyid du zag pa med pa skye ba yin @90a * //
translated: The basis of birth is the faculty of producing complete knowledge, because it is the first to be born.

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the first to be born, because the uncontaminated is born for the first time.

original: gnas pa ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin te rgyun chags par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin te rgyun chags par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of duration is the faculty of complete knowledge, because it causes the continuum to be prolonged.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos ni nye bar spyod par byed do zhes bya ba ni des na sems rnams par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos ni nye bar spyod par byed do zhes bya ba ni des na sems rnams par grol bas dga' ba dang bde ba so sor yang dag par myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of possessing complete knowledge causes one to experience, because one experiences the joy and pleasure of the mind's liberation through that faculty.

original: de'i phyir dbang po ni de snyed cig yin zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa ni dbang po nyid yin par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po ni de snyed cig yin zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa ni dbang po nyid yin par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, there are just so many faculties, i.e., it is not claimed that ignorance, etc., are faculties.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi go rims kyang de yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po nas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi go rims kyang de yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po nas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /
translated: For that very reason, their order is also like that, i.e., the order of the faculties is from the eye faculty up to the faculty of possessing complete knowledge.

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rten la sogs par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rten la sogs par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the basis for engagement, disengagement, etc.

original: ngag ni tshig smra bar bya ba la dbang po nyid ma yin te slob pa'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bus pa skyes ma thag pa bslab pa med pa kho nar mig gis gzugs mthong la tshig ni de ltar smra bar mi
analyzed: ngag ni tshig smra bar bya ba la dbang po nyid ma yin te slob pa'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bus pa skyes ma thag pa bslab pa med pa kho nar mig gis gzugs mthong la tshig ni de ltar smra bar mi
translated: A newborn infant, without any training, sees forms with the eye but does not speak words.

original: byed do // de lta bas na dbang po'i las las 'das pa'i phyir dag dbang po nyid yin par 'os pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: byed do // de lta bas na dbang po'i las las 'das pa'i phyir dag dbang po nyid yin par 'os pa ma yin gyi //
translated: Therefore, since it is beyond the function of the faculty, it is not suitable to be a faculty.

original: tshig tu smra ba de ni lce'i dbang po'i rten kho na'i las yin no //
analyzed: tshig tu smra ba de ni lce'i dbang po'i rten kho na'i las yin no //
translated: Speaking words is the function of the basis of the tongue faculty alone.üîΩHands and feet are not separate from grasping and walking.

original: lag pa dang rkang pa yang len pa dang 'gro ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni lag pa nyid gzhan du byung ba la len pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa yang len pa dang 'gro ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni lag pa nyid gzhan du byung ba la len pa zhes bya la /
translated: Hands are called grasping when they arise in another place.

original: rkang pa nyid gzhan du byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rkang pa nyid gzhan du byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Feet are called walking when they arise in another place.

original: las med pa'i phyir dang / rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa yang 'ga' ba'i phyir lag pa dang rkang pa ni dbang po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: las med pa'i phyir dang / rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa yang 'ga' ba'i phyir lag pa dang rkang pa ni dbang po nyid ma yin no //
translated: The hands and feet are not controlling faculties because they do not exercise controlling power with regard to their own intrinsic nature, and because they do not exercise controlling power with regard to anything else.

original: sbrul la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni sbrul la sogs pa la rkang pa dang lag pa med mod kyi //
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni sbrul la sogs pa la rkang pa dang lag pa med mod kyi //
translated: As for the snake, etc., the snake, etc., do not have hands and feet,

original: 'on kyang de dag len pa dang 'gro bar 'gyur bas lag pa dang rkang pa ni dbang po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag len pa dang 'gro bar 'gyur bas lag pa dang rkang pa ni dbang po nyid ma yin no //
translated: but they move by the action of their head and belly. Thus, the hands and feet are not controlling faculties.

original: gal te de dag la yang phra mo yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag la yang phra mo yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that they have subtle hands and feet,

original: bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ma yin te 'di gnyis kyang dbang po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ma yin te 'di gnyis kyang dbang po nyid ma yin no //
translated: we reply: no, because this is to be established; these two are not controlling faculties.

original: rtug par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba rtug par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: rtug par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba rtug par bya ba la'o //
translated: As for the anus, it is the faculty that exercises controlling power with regard to the elimination of excrement.üîΩThe space that is located in the cavities

original: bu ga'i nam mkha' la gnas pa'i rdza lci ba nas gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: bu ga'i nam mkha' la gnas pa'i rdza lci ba nas gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: is not the anus,

original: rkub kyi gnas las gzhan na yang /
analyzed: rkub kyi gnas las gzhan na yang /
translated: because it is not distinct from the receptacle.

original: ltung ba'i phyir rdzas lci ba ni lci ba nyid kho na'i phyir rang ltung gi dbang pos byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba'i phyir rdzas lci ba ni lci ba nyid kho na'i phyir rang ltung gi dbang pos byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Heavy substances descend due to their own heaviness, not due to the action of the organ of excretion.üîΩBecause wind also causes them to move.

original: de rlung gis kyang bro bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba'i rdzas lci ba de rlung gis bro bar byed @90b pa'i phyir de ni rlung kho na'i las yin gyi /
analyzed: de rlung gis kyang bro bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba'i rdzas lci ba de rlung gis bro bar byed @90b pa'i phyir de ni rlung kho na'i las yin gyi /
translated: That heavy substance of feces moves due to wind, therefore that is the action of wind alone.

original: rkub kyi dbang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rkub kyi dbang po ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the action of the organ of excretion,

original: de ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not observed.

original: mdoms kyang kun du dga' par bya ba la dbang po nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdoms kyang kun du dga' par bya ba la dbang po nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The anus is not a faculty in the sense of being the site of sexual pleasure.üîΩIn the sense of the meaning of the term, the anus is not a faculty in the sense of being the site of sexual pleasure, because it is not a part of the body faculty that is designated as the anus, except for the male and female faculties.

original: tshig gi don gyi kun tu dga' bar bya ba la lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig po mo dang pho'i dbang po las ma gtogs pa'i mdoms su btags pa dbang po nyid ma yin te nyon mongs pa can gyi bde ba de ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs
analyzed: tshig gi don gyi kun tu dga' bar bya ba la lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig po mo dang pho'i dbang po las ma gtogs pa'i mdoms su btags pa dbang po nyid ma yin te nyon mongs pa can gyi bde ba de ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs
translated: That afflicted pleasure is produced by a part of the body faculty,

original: gcig gi mo dang po'i dbang pos byas pa yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gcig gi mo dang po'i dbang pos byas pa yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: the male and female faculties.

original: lkog ma dang so dang mig gi lam dang tshigs rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: lkog ma dang so dang mig gi lam dang tshigs rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: are also faculties.

original: gal te ji skad du bshad ba'i rgyus dbang po dag ni de snyed kho na yin no zhes bya bar mi 'dod na klog ma yang mid pa dang so yang bca' ba dang mig gi lam yang 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa dang / tshigs kyang rus pa'i tshigs bskum pa dang rkyang ba'i bya ba dag la dbang po nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ji skad du bshad ba'i rgyus dbang po dag ni de snyed kho na yin no zhes bya bar mi 'dod na klog ma yang mid pa dang so yang bca' ba dang mig gi lam yang 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa dang / tshigs kyang rus pa'i tshigs bskum pa dang rkyang ba'i bya ba dag la dbang po nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept that the number of faculties is just as explained, then the throat would be a faculty for swallowing, the teeth would be a faculty for chewing, the eyes would be a faculty for opening and closing, and the joints would be faculties for the action of bending and stretching bones.

original: rgyur gyur pa thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te gnag zhig gang la rtsal yod pa de de la dbang po nyid yin par 'dod kyi gong du bshad pa'i rgyu des pa de ni mi 'dod na sa bon la sogs pa rgyur gyur
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te gnag zhig gang la rtsal yod pa de de la dbang po nyid yin par 'dod kyi gong du bshad pa'i rgyu des pa de ni mi 'dod na sa bon la sogs pa rgyur gyur
translated: If you assert that whatever has power over something is a faculty, then seeds and so on would be faculties of sprouts and so forth.

original: pa thams cad rang gi bya ba ste rang gi 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba la dbang po nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: pa thams cad rang gi bya ba ste rang gi 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba la dbang po nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is not tenable that the faculties are the characteristics of the action of arising, because it is not tenable that the faculties are the characteristics of the action of arising.

original: de lta bas na dag la sogs pa ni dbang po nyid yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dag la sogs pa ni dbang po nyid yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not logical that the faculties are the characteristics of the action of arising.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.

original: de la mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la de la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad yin no //üîΩbstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /üîΩde dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten /
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la de la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad yin no // bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni / de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten /
translated: The faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc.

original: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //üîΩzhes bya ba dang / lus las mo dang pho'i dbang dag //üîΩces bya ba yin no //üîΩsrog gi dbang po zhes bya ba ni /üîΩsrog ni tshe yin drod dang ni /üîΩrnam shes rten gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams // zhes bya ba dang / lus las mo dang pho'i dbang dag // ces bya ba yin no // srog gi dbang po zhes bya ba ni / srog ni tshe yin drod dang ni / rnam shes rten gang yin pa'o //
translated: The faculties of eye, etc.

original: zhes bya ba 'dir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dir ro //
translated: The

original: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Faith and so on are among the mental factors.

original: dad dang bag yod shin tu sbyangs //
analyzed: dad dang bag yod shin tu sbyangs //
translated: Faith, heedfulness, and pliancy

original: zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'dir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'dir ro //
translated: are mentioned in this context.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang /üîΩtshor ba myong ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang / tshor ba myong ba zhes bya ba /
translated: Feeling and so on are also mentioned in the Abhidharmakosa:üîΩFeeling is the experience of pleasure and so on.

original: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang // zhes bya ba 'byung @91a * //
analyzed: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang // zhes bya ba 'byung @91a * //
translated: Feeling, discrimination, intention,

original: ba'i phyir bstan zin pa yang yin la /
analyzed: ba'i phyir bstan zin pa yang yin la /
translated: and so on are mentioned in the Abhidharmakosa.

original: sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas 'chad par 'gyur ba yang ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas 'chad par 'gyur ba yang ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Aren't they also among the mental factors to be explained?

original: tshor ba'i spyi'i ngo bo bshad zin pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba bden mod kyi khyad par rnam par dbye ba'i ngo bo ni 'di nas 'chang par 'dod pas /
analyzed: tshor ba'i spyi'i ngo bo bshad zin pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba bden mod kyi khyad par rnam par dbye ba'i ngo bo ni 'di nas 'chang par 'dod pas /
translated: It is true that the general nature of feeling has already been explained and will be explained, but since the nature of its specific divisions is to be explained here,

original: bde ba la sogs pa bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said that pleasure and so on are to be explained.

original: 'o na kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa ni bshad mi dgos te /
analyzed: 'o na kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa ni bshad mi dgos te /
translated: The faculty producing complete knowledge and so on do not need to be explained,

original: 'di ltar yid kyi mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyi mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
translated: because the characteristics of the mental faculty have already been explained.

original: dad pa la sogs pa ni sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa ni sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Faith and so on will be explained among the mental factors.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms rnams ni 'di ni 'chad do zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms rnams ni 'di ni 'chad do zhe na /
translated: Pleasure, gladness, and equanimity are explained here.

original: 'di dag kyang bshad dgos pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang bshad dgos pa kho na'o //
translated: But they must be explained.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag ni rdzas dgu'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan dgos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni rdzas dgu'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan dgos so //
translated: For it must be shown that they are by nature the nine substances.

original: gnas skabs 'di na ni rdzas dgu po 'di dag mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di na ni rdzas dgu po 'di dag mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: In this state, these nine substances are called the faculty producing complete knowledge of the unknown.

original: gnas skabs 'di na ni kun shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di na ni kun shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur /
translated: In this state, they are called the faculty of complete knowledge.üîΩIn this state, they are called the faculty of possessing complete knowledge.

original: gnas skabs 'di na ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'di dag gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par te bstan dgos so //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di na ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'di dag gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par te bstan dgos so //
translated: It must be shown that these are the distinctions of their states.

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni legs par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni legs par smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is well said that the faculty of pleasure, etc., and the faculty of understanding all should be explained.

original: lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
analyzed: lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
translated: That which is unpleasant bodily feeling

original: zhes bya ba la lus tshor zhes bya ba ni yid kyis bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la lus tshor zhes bya ba ni yid kyis bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is unpleasant bodily feeling‚Äù is stated to exclude mental feeling.

original: sim pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni sim pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sim pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni sim pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is unpleasant‚Äù is stated to exclude pleasant feeling.

original: de la lus dag ni mig la sogs pa lnga yin te rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lus dag ni mig la sogs pa lnga yin te rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is the five sense faculties of eye, etc., because they have the nature of atoms, etc.

original: lus de la yod pa'am rten lus dang lhan cig spyod pas na lus kyi yin te dbang po lnga la brten pa'i tshor ba gnod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lus de la yod pa'am rten lus dang lhan cig spyod pas na lus kyi yin te dbang po lnga la brten pa'i tshor ba gnod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The feeling that is in the body or that accompanies the body, which is its support, is bodily feeling. The faculty of pain is the painful feeling that is based on the five sense faculties.

original: sim pa ni bde ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir lus kyi zhes bya ba dang dbang po zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: sim pa ni bde ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir lus kyi zhes bya ba dang dbang po zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the term body should be supplied, as should the term faculty.

original: sim pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni sim pa ma yin pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sim pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni sim pa ma yin pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term pleasurable is used to exclude the unpleasant.

original: 'di skad du dbang po lnga la brten pa'i tshor ba sim pa phan 'dogs par byed pa de ni bde ba'i dbang po yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du dbang po lnga la brten pa'i tshor ba sim pa phan 'dogs par byed pa de ni bde ba'i dbang po yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This passage explains that the faculty of pleasure is the pleasant feeling that benefits the five sense faculties.

original: bsam gtan @91b gsum pa na /
analyzed: bsam gtan @91b gsum pa na /
translated: In the third meditative absorption,

original: sems kyi de ni bde dbang po //
analyzed: sems kyi de ni bde dbang po //
translated: that mental feeling is the faculty of pleasure.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa na ni sems kyi tshor ba sim pa yang bde ba'i dbang po yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa na ni sems kyi tshor ba sim pa yang bde ba'i dbang po yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In the third meditative absorption, mental feeling that is pleasant is posited as the faculty of pleasure.

original: ci'i phyir de ni sems kyi sim pa kho na yin par gzung gi lus kyi ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ni sems kyi sim pa kho na yin par gzung gi lus kyi ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that only mental feeling is considered to be pleasure and not bodily feeling?

original: 'dir de ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga med pa'i phyir lus kyi tshor ba ni med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dir de ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga med pa'i phyir lus kyi tshor ba ni med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In response to this question, the root text states, ‚ÄúBecause there is no bodily feeling there, since the five collections of consciousness are absent.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa na de yid bde ba'i dbang po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa na de yid bde ba'i dbang po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the faculty of mental satisfaction in the third absorption?

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa na ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir de bde ba'i dbang po kho na yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa na ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir de bde ba'i dbang po kho na yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúBecause they are free from attachment to joy, it is the faculty of pleasure alone in the third absorption.‚ÄùüîΩThus a sutra states:

original: 'di ltar mdo las dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams btang snyoms su gnas so zhes bya ba nas rgyas par dran pa dang ldan zhing bde bar gnas so zhes bya ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams btang snyoms su gnas so zhes bya ba nas rgyas par dran pa dang ldan zhing bde bar gnas so zhes bya ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs so //
translated: Those who are free from attachment to joy abide in equanimity, and so on, up to they abide with mindfulness and bliss, and they perfect and abide in the third absorption.

original: gal te dga' ba ni yid bde ba las gzhan yin no snyam na de'i phyir dga' ba ni yid bde ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gal te dga' ba ni yid bde ba las gzhan yin no snyam na de'i phyir dga' ba ni yid bde ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If you think that joy is different from mental satisfaction, then it is said, ‚ÄúJoy is mental satisfaction.‚Äù

original: sems kyi sim pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: sems kyi sim pa ma yin pa //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is not mental peace.

original: yad mi bde ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems kyi tshor ba gnod par byed pa ni yid mi bde ba yin no //
analyzed: yad mi bde ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems kyi tshor ba gnod par byed pa ni yid mi bde ba yin no //
translated: Mental feeling that is harmful is mental dissatisfaction.

original: btang snyoms ni bar ma'o zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po ni tshor ba bar ma gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni bar ma'o zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po ni tshor ba bar ma gang yin pa ste /
translated: The faculty of equanimity is a neutral feeling.

original: sim pa yang ma yin sim pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sim pa yang ma yin sim pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba ni 'di la yan lag gnyi ga yod pas na gnyi ga'i ste lus kyi dang sems kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba ni 'di la yan lag gnyi ga yod pas na gnyi ga'i ste lus kyi dang sems kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Both refers to both the physical and mental.

original: mi rtog phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon par spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi rtog phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon par spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is non-conceptual. It is non-conceptual because it is free from the conceptualization of manifest activity.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba smos pa ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba smos pa ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúmostly‚Äù is used because it excludes the joy and pleasure that arise from concentration and those that arise from karmic maturation.

original: lus kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni rnam par rtog pas skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni rnam par rtog pas skye ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not physical. Physical pleasure and pain do not arise from conceptualization.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul gyi dbang gis ni dgra bcom pa rnams la yang skye bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yul gyi dbang gis ni dgra bcom pa rnams la yang skye bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since pleasure and pain arise due to the power of the object, even arhats generate physical pleasure and pain.

original: yul gyi dbang kho nas dgra bcom pa sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par rtog pa spangs pa rnams la yang lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal bskyed pas so //
analyzed: yul gyi dbang kho nas dgra bcom pa sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par rtog pa spangs pa rnams la yang lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal bskyed pas so //
translated: Even arhats who have abandoned the conception of the pleasant and the unpleasant generate physical pleasure and pain due to the power of the object alone.

original: @92a * // de'i phyir de dag / dbang po nyid du tha dad kyi //
analyzed: @92a * // de'i phyir de dag / dbang po nyid du tha dad kyi //
translated: Therefore they are different in terms of being faculties.

original: zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems kyi bde ba dag dang sdug bsngal de dag dbang po nyid du tha dad de so sor bde ba'i dbang po dang yid bde ba'i dbang po dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya ba
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems kyi bde ba dag dang sdug bsngal de dag dbang po nyid du tha dad de so sor bde ba'i dbang po dang yid bde ba'i dbang po dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya ba
translated: Physical pleasure and mental pleasure and physical pain and mental pain are different in terms of being faculties. They are called the faculty of pleasure, the faculty of mental satisfaction, the faculty of pain and the faculty of mental dissatisfaction.

original: yin gyi / btang snyoms ni lus kyi'am sems kyi'am rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'am rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: yin gyi / btang snyoms ni lus kyi'am sems kyi'am rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'am rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yang rung ste /
translated: But equanimity is either physical or mental, arisen from karmic maturation or arisen from natural outflow.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa kho nar mngon par rtogs pa med pa kho nar rang gi ngang gis mngon par 'du byed pa med par skye bas de lta bas na dbang bo nyid du tha dad pa med par btang snyoms kyi dbang po zhes dbang po gcig tuüîΩbyas so / //üîΩ/ bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa kho nar mngon par rtogs pa med pa kho nar rang gi ngang gis mngon par 'du byed pa med par skye bas de lta bas na dbang bo nyid du tha dad pa med par btang snyoms kyi dbang po zhes dbang po gcig tu byas so / // / bam po dgu pa /
translated: Since it arises as just nonconceptual, just nonrealizing, and just naturally effortless, therefore it is one faculty, called the faculty of equanimity, without differentiation as a faculty.

original: lus kyi bde ba yang gzhan du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lus kyi bde ba yang nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo'i khyad par gzhan gyis rjes su 'dzin la sems kyi yang gzhan gyis te lus kyi ni brten pa yin la /
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba yang gzhan du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lus kyi bde ba yang nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo'i khyad par gzhan gyis rjes su 'dzin la sems kyi yang gzhan gyis te lus kyi ni brten pa yin la /
translated: Physical pleasure is also experienced by another specific type of feeling, mental pleasure is also experienced by another, physical pleasure is based on the body,

original: sems kyi ni mi brten pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi ni mi brten pa yin no //
translated: but mental pleasure is not based on the body.

original: de bzhin du lus kyi sdug bsngal yang nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo'i khyad par gzhan gyis yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi sdug bsngal yang nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo'i khyad par gzhan gyis yin la /
translated: Similarly, physical pain is also experienced by another specific type of feeling,

original: sems kyi yang gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi yang gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: but mental pain is experienced by another.

original: btang snyoms la bye brag med de zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag med do //
analyzed: btang snyoms la bye brag med de zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag med do //
translated: This means that it is not differentiated in terms of its own nature and specific characteristics.

original: de bas na btang snyoms kyi phyir te btang snyoms su bya ba'i phyir bye brag med pas rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par med pas tha dad pa med do //üîΩmthong bsgom mi slob lam la dgu //üîΩzhes bya ba ni mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na btang snyoms kyi phyir te btang snyoms su bya ba'i phyir bye brag med pas rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par med pas tha dad pa med do // mthong bsgom mi slob lam la dgu // zhes bya ba ni mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of equanimity, because of being made equanimous, there is no differentiation, and because there is no difference in terms of its own nature and specific characteristics, there is no distinction.üîΩThe path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path of no learning are the paths of seeing, cultivation, and no learning.üîΩThe path of seeing is seeing.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam ni mthong bsgom mi slob lam yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam ni mthong bsgom mi slob lam yin no //
translated: The paths of seeing, cultivation, and no learning are the paths of seeing, cultivation, and no learning.

original: lam gsum po de nyid la yid dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ces bya ba'i rdzas dgu po gang dag yin pa de dag ni mthong pa'i lam la ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam gsum po de nyid la yid dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ces bya ba'i rdzas dgu po gang dag yin pa de dag ni mthong pa'i lam la ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The nine substances that are called the mental faculty, pleasure, mental satisfaction, equanimity, faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are called the faculty producing complete knowledge in the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called the faculty of complete knowledge in the path of meditation.

original: mi slob pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: They are called the faculty possessing complete knowledge in the path of no more learning.

original: rdzas de dag ni phan tshun ltos nas ming de dang de 'thob @92b bo /
analyzed: rdzas de dag ni phan tshun ltos nas ming de dang de 'thob @92b bo /
translated: These substances are called by these names in dependence on each other.

original: dgu zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa gzhan la ltos nas de skad ces bshad pa yin gyi tshogs pa gcig la rdzas dgu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dgu zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa gzhan la ltos nas de skad ces bshad pa yin gyi tshogs pa gcig la rdzas dgu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nine is stated in dependence on another collection, but nine substances do not exist in one collection.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba kho na zhig yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te lam de mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis pa zhig yin na ni de la btang snyoms kyi dbang po kho na yod kyi bde ba dang /
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba kho na zhig yod pa'i phyir ro // gal te lam de mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis pa zhig yin na ni de la btang snyoms kyi dbang po kho na yod kyi bde ba dang /
translated: because one of the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure, or equanimity is necessarily present.

original: yid bde ba'i dbang po dag ni med do //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang po dag ni med do //
translated: If this path is of the stage of the preliminary concentration, the intermediate meditation, the fourth meditation, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, or the sphere of nothingness, then the faculty of equanimity is present in it, but not the faculties of pleasure or mental pleasure.

original: gal te bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis ba'i sa pa zhig yin na ni de la yid bde ba'i dbang po kho na yod do //
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis ba'i sa pa zhig yin na ni de la yid bde ba'i dbang po kho na yod do //
translated: If this path is of the stage of the first or second meditation, then the faculty of mental pleasure is present in it.

original: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni de la bde ba'i dbang po kho na yod kyi gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni de la bde ba'i dbang po kho na yod kyi gzhan ni med do //
translated: If this path is of the stage of the third meditation, then the faculty of pleasure is present in it, but not the others.

original: mi shes pa kun shes par bya ba zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi mi shes pa kun shes par bya zhing kun rtogs par bya bar zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par bya ba zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi mi shes pa kun shes par bya zhing kun rtogs par bya bar zhugs pa ste /
translated: One who is entering to make all that is unknown known is one who is entering to make all that is unknown with regard to the four truths known and to fully understand them.

original: kun shes par bya'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: kun shes par bya'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: One who is entering to make all that is unknown known is one who is thinking, I will make all that is unknown known.

original: de'i dbang po ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang po ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin no //
translated: His faculty is the faculty of making all that is unknown known.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni sngon ma mthong ba kun shes par bya ba ni med kyi phra rgyas lhag ma spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni sngon ma mthong ba kun shes par bya ba ni med kyi phra rgyas lhag ma spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The path of cultivation is not for making all that has not been seen known, but for abandoning the remaining proclivities.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir bden pa bzhi po de nyid kun shes par byed do //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir bden pa bzhi po de nyid kun shes par byed do //
translated: One makes all that is unknown known with regard to those four truths in order to abandon the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: gang zag kun shes pa de'i dbang po yin pa'am kun shes pa nyid dbang po yin pas na kun shes pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang zag kun shes pa de'i dbang po yin pa'am kun shes pa nyid dbang po yin pas na kun shes pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of one who has made all that is unknown known is the faculty of one who has known all that is unknown or the faculty of knowing all that is unknown.

original: mi slob pa'i lam la ni kun shes so snyam du rtog pa ni kun shes pa ste zhes bya ba ni don brjod pa tsam du zad de sgra'i tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni 'di ltar bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam la ni kun shes so snyam du rtog pa ni kun shes pa ste zhes bya ba ni don brjod pa tsam du zad de sgra'i tshig rnam par sbyar ba ni 'di ltar bya'o //
translated: The path of no-more-learning is called ‚Äúhaving complete knowledge‚Äù because it is the complete knowledge of the thought ‚ÄúI have complete knowledge.‚Äù

original: kun shes pa zhes bya ba ni kun rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun shes pa zhes bya ba ni kun rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúcomplete knowledge‚Äù means complete understanding.

original: de 'di la yod pas sam 'di kun shes pa srung ba'i ngang tshul yin pas na kun shes pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas sam 'di kun shes pa srung ba'i ngang tshul yin pas na kun shes pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: One who possesses complete knowledge is called ‚Äúone who has complete knowledge‚Äù because he possesses complete knowledge or because he has the nature of guarding complete knowledge.

original: de lta bu'i dbang po ni zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa ni de lta bu'i dbang po ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dbang po ni zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa ni de lta bu'i dbang po ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúsuch a faculty‚Äù means ‚Äúthe faculty of one who has complete knowledge.‚Äù

original: gsum ni dri ma med ces bya ba ni gsum ni dri ma med pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gsum ni dri ma med ces bya ba ni gsum ni dri ma med pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe three are stainless,‚Äù but this should be understood to mean that the three are stainless alone.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag 'di khams bstan pa @93a * //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag 'di khams bstan pa @93a * //
translated: This distinction between the contaminated and uncontaminated is taught in the realms.

original: las / zag med lam gyi bden pa dang // zhes bya ba dang / de gsum zag bcas zag pa med //
analyzed: las / zag med lam gyi bden pa dang // zhes bya ba dang / de gsum zag bcas zag pa med //
translated: And: Those three are contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: lhag ma rnams ni zag bcas so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni zag bcas so //
translated: The remaining are contaminated.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir bshad zin ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir bshad zin ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: This is explained, but it is not explained in terms of specific instances.

original: rnam pa'i bye brag de lta bu la sogs pa 'di ni bshad pa bden mod kyi de ni spyi'i ngo bor bshad kyi bye brag gi ngo bor ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag de lta bu la sogs pa 'di ni bshad pa bden mod kyi de ni spyi'i ngo bor bshad kyi bye brag gi ngo bor ni ma yin te /
translated: This explanation of specific instances and so on is true, but it is explained in terms of general natures and not in terms of specific instances.

original: de bas na slob mas bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa'i bye brag de lta bu la sogs pa 'di ni tshig re re'i ngo bo nas brjod do zhes bya bar yang brjod do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //üîΩdgu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba dor bya mi dgos te /
analyzed: de bas na slob mas bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa'i bye brag de lta bu la sogs pa 'di ni tshig re re'i ngo bo nas brjod do zhes bya bar yang brjod do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o // dgu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba dor bya mi dgos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to easily understand this, the specific instances and so on are stated in terms of the nature of each word.

original: gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i nges par gzung ba kho nas dgu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i nges par gzung ba kho nas dgu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnine are of two types‚Äù is not necessary because it is established by the statement ‚Äúone is definitely contaminated and one is definitely uncontaminated.‚Äù

original: gal te 'di dag gcig tu zag pa med pa kho nar gyur ba yin na ni gcig tu zag pa med pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i nang du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag gcig tu zag pa med pa kho nar gyur ba yin na ni gcig tu zag pa med pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i nang du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: If these were uncontaminated alone, they would be included in the faculty producing complete knowledge, which is uncontaminated alone.

original: 'on te gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin par gyur na ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa gzugs can gyi dbang po dang srog dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i nang du ston par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'on te gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin par gyur na ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa gzugs can gyi dbang po dang srog dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i nang du ston par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If they were contaminated alone, they would be included in the contaminated physical faculties, life force, pain and mental dissatisfaction.

original: de lta yang ma yin pas de'i phyir dgu rnams gnyis zhes bya ba grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin pas de'i phyir dgu rnams gnyis zhes bya ba grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But since that is not so, it is established that nine are of two types.

original: de ni de lta yin mod kyi gzhung lugs gzhan bzlog pa'i phyir yang /
analyzed: de ni de lta yin mod kyi gzhung lugs gzhan bzlog pa'i phyir yang /
translated: That is so, but this is stated to refute another philosophical tenet.

original: dgu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba 'di brjod de /
analyzed: dgu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba 'di brjod de /
translated: Nine are of two types alone.

original: dgu ni rnam gnyis kho na yin gyi ji ltar kha cig brjod cing de grub par bya ba'i phyir lung yang khyer te 'ong ba lta bur zag pa med pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgu ni rnam gnyis kho na yin gyi ji ltar kha cig brjod cing de grub par bya ba'i phyir lung yang khyer te 'ong ba lta bur zag pa med pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not uncontaminated, as some have claimed, for they are not included in the faculty producing complete knowledge.

original: gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The passage continues, ‚ÄúOne who possesses these five faculties‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad du thams cad med pa zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dad 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gi rnam pa thams cad du'o //
analyzed: thams cad du thams cad med pa zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dad 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gi rnam pa thams cad du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù means in every aspect, that is, in terms of the distinctions of weak, medium, and strong.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni lnga char med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni lnga char med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù means that all five are absent.

original: so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga smra'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir don gyis na 'di skad du gang la 'di dag yod pa de ni 'phags pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga smra'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir don gyis na 'di skad du gang la 'di dag yod pa de ni 'phags pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúI declare that he or she is situated in the class of ordinary persons‚Äù implies that ‚Äúone who possesses these faculties is an ƒÅrya.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis de dag zag pa med pa nyid yin par bya ba'i skabs su de ni khungs su mi rung ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de dag zag pa med pa nyid yin par bya ba'i skabs su de ni khungs su mi rung ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The Master [Vasubandhu] says, ‚ÄúThis passage is not a suitable source for the claim that these faculties are uncontaminated.‚Äù

original: 'di lta @93b ste 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag par mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'di lta @93b ste 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag par mdzad nas /
translated: The passage reads, ‚ÄúHaving established the classification of ƒÅrya persons,

original: gang la dbang po 'di dag ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gang la dbang po 'di dag ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: the Buddha said, ‚ÄòOne who possesses these faculties‚Äô and so on.‚Äù

original: dge slong dag dbang po ni lnga po 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag dbang po ni lnga po 'di dag yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, there are five faculties.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dad pa'i dbang po nas shes rab kyi dbang po'i bar yin te /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po nas shes rab kyi dbang po'i bar yin te /
translated: The faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: dbang po lnga po 'di dag rno ba dang yongs su rdzogs pas dgra bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po lnga po 'di dag rno ba dang yongs su rdzogs pas dgra bcom pa yin no //
translated: Monks, one who has these five faculties sharp and complete is an arhat.

original: de bas ches zhan pa dang ches rtul bas phyir mi 'ong ba yin no //üîΩde bas ches zhan pa dang ches rtul bas lan cig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas ches zhan pa dang ches rtul bas phyir mi 'ong ba yin no // de bas ches zhan pa dang ches rtul bas lan cig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
translated: One who has these five faculties somewhat weaker and duller is a nonreturner.üîΩOne who has these five faculties somewhat weaker and duller is a once-returner.

original: de bas ches zhan pa dang ches rtul bas rgyun du zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas ches zhan pa dang ches rtul bas rgyun du zhugs pa yin no //
translated: One who has these five faculties somewhat weaker and duller is a stream enterer.

original: de bas ches zhan pa dang ches rtul bas chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas ches zhan pa dang ches rtul bas chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: One who has these five faculties somewhat weaker and duller is a follower of the teachings.

original: de bas ches zhan pa dang ches rtul bas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas ches zhan pa dang ches rtul bas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: One who has these five faculties somewhat weaker and duller is a follower by faith.

original: dge slong dag de ltar na dbang po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten cing stobs rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas gang zag gi pha rol tu phyin pa dag mngon no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na dbang po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten cing stobs rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas gang zag gi pha rol tu phyin pa dag mngon no //
translated: Thus, monks, the perfections of the individual are manifested in dependence on the perfections of the faculties and the perfections of the powers.

original: gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag thams cad du thams cad med pa de ni phyi rol so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga smra'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag thams cad du thams cad med pa de ni phyi rol so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga smra'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: I declare that one in whom all of these five faculties are completely non-existent is situated in the class of ordinary beings outside.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa mdzad nas gang la dbang po 'di dag ces gsungs pa yin te //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa mdzad nas gang la dbang po 'di dag ces gsungs pa yin te //
translated: The Blessed One, having thus established the noble individuals, said, in whom these faculties are.

original: phyi rol so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pa dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang ldan pa la ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: phyi rol so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas pa dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang ldan pa la ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in one situated in the class of ordinary beings outside possessing the contaminated faith, etc.

original: yang na so so'i skye bo rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni nang pa dang phyi rol pa'o //
analyzed: yang na so so'i skye bo rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni nang pa dang phyi rol pa'o //
translated: Or, ordinary beings are of two kinds, he says, those within and those outside.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu ma chad pa ni nang pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu ma chad pa ni nang pa yin te /
translated: Those whose roots of virtue are not severed are insiders,

original: sangs rgyas pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included among Buddhists.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa ni phyi pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa ni phyi pa yin te /
translated: Those whose roots of virtue are severed are outsiders,

original: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the opposite of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyi rol zhes khyad par du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyi rol zhes khyad par du byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are called outsiders.

original: de lta ma yin na so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga smra'o zhes bya ba kho na zhig bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga smra'o zhes bya ba kho na zhig bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, he would have said, ‚ÄúI declare that you are situated in the class of ordinary beings.‚Äù

original: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, in a sutra, it says:

original: yang bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon pa zhig na 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon pa zhig na 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Soon after the Bhagavat attained complete enlightenment, he thought,

original: bdag gis chos zab mo zab par snang la blta bar dka' ba rtogs par dka' ba brtag par bya ba ma yin pa rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa cha phra ba @94a * //
analyzed: bdag gis chos zab mo zab par snang la blta bar dka' ba rtogs par dka' ba brtag par bya ba ma yin pa rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa cha phra ba @94a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThis truth that I have realized is profound, difficult to see, difficult to understand, and is not investigated by mere reasoning. It is peaceful and sublime, subtle, and can be experienced only by the wise.

original: mkhas shing mdzangs la shes pas rig par bya ba rtogs pa de bdag gis gzhan dag la bstan te /
analyzed: mkhas shing mdzangs la shes pas rig par bya ba rtogs pa de bdag gis gzhan dag la bstan te /
translated: I will teach others what I have understood through my own learning, wisdom, and insight.

original: gzhan dag gis de ma shes par gyur na des ni bdag la gnod par yang 'gyur zhing tshegs su yang 'gyur la sems la nyam nga bar yang 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis de ma shes par gyur na des ni bdag la gnod par yang 'gyur zhing tshegs su yang 'gyur la sems la nyam nga bar yang 'gyur bas /
translated: But if others do not understand it, that will be a problem for me, a difficulty, and a source of anxiety.

original: ma la bdag gcig pu mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dgon pa la gzhol bar rnal 'byor dang ldan par gnas par bya ba gor ma chag snyam mo //
analyzed: ma la bdag gcig pu mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dgon pa la gzhol bar rnal 'byor dang ldan par gnas par bya ba gor ma chag snyam mo //
translated: Therefore, I will certainly go to the wilderness and live there in solitude, practicing meditation so that I can be happy in this life.‚Äù

original: de nas tshangs pa mi mjed kyi bdag po 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa mi mjed kyi bdag po 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then BrahmƒÅ, lord of the SahƒÅ World, thought,

original: da ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni brgya lam na res 'ga' zhig 'byung bar zad de /
analyzed: da ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni brgya lam na res 'ga' zhig 'byung bar zad de /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is rare for a tathƒÅgata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened buddha to appear in this world.

original: dper na au dum b'a ra'i me tog dang 'dra na /
analyzed: dper na au dum b'a ra'i me tog dang 'dra na /
translated: It is like the appearance of the udumbara flower.

original: bcom ldan 'das de yang thugs las chung ngur bzhugs par dgongs kyi chos bstan par mi dgongs pas /üîΩkye ma 'jig rten 'di ni ma rung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yang thugs las chung ngur bzhugs par dgongs kyi chos bstan par mi dgongs pas / kye ma 'jig rten 'di ni ma rung ngo //

original: kye ma 'jig rten 'di ni rab tu ma rung ngo //
analyzed: kye ma 'jig rten 'di ni rab tu ma rung ngo //

original: ma la bdag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba gdab gor ma chag go snyam mo //üîΩde nas tshangs pa mi mjed kyi bdag po dper na skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i lag pa bskum pa las brkyang ba'am brkyang ba las bskums pa tsam du tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas mi snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: ma la bdag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba gdab gor ma chag go snyam mo // de nas tshangs pa mi mjed kyi bdag po dper na skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i lag pa bskum pa las brkyang ba'am brkyang ba las bskums pa tsam du tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas mi snang bar gyur te /
translated: I must certainly request the Blessed One to speak.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go //
translated: Then BrahmƒÅ, Lord of the SahƒÅ World, disappeared from the Brahma realm as quickly as a strong man might stretch out or bend his arm and appeared before the Blessed One.

analyzed: de nas de'i tshe tshangs pas tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /

original: ma dag dri ma rjes su 'brel ya 'byung //
analyzed: ma dag dri ma rjes su 'brel ya 'byung //

original: bdud rtsi sgo mo dbye bar mdzod cig chos //

original: rdul bral nyon mongs med pa bshad du gsol //
analyzed: rdul bral nyon mongs med pa bshad du gsol //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //

analyzed: tshangs pa nga yis tha ba kun //

analyzed: bcom nas tshegs chen gyis rtogs pa'i // chos 'di srid pa'i 'dod chags kyis //

analyzed: rgyun phyogs las ni bzlog pa'i lam //

analyzed: phung pos bsgribs pas mi mthong ngo //

original: tshangs pas gsol pa /
analyzed: tshangs pas gsol pa /
translated: BrahmƒÅ said:

translated: Blessed One, you have said that among beings born in the world and aging in the world, there are those with sharp faculties, those with middling faculties, and those with dull faculties.

original: nyon mongs pa dag gis kyang rgyud nye bar ma bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmthong bas thob pa ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba nyid yod mod kyi de'i rgyud nyon mongs pa dag gis nye bar ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag gis kyang rgyud nye bar ma bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmthong bas thob pa ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba nyid yod mod kyi de'i rgyud nyon mongs pa dag gis nye bar ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One who is liberated not in time is not agitated by affliction.üîΩOne who

original: dus kyi rnam par grol ba ni rgyud nyon mongs pa dag gis ma bstan pa yin mod kyi ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dus kyi rnam par grol ba ni rgyud nyon mongs pa dag gis ma bstan pa yin mod kyi ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: One liberated according to circumstances is not liberated by the power of concentration, although he is not taught by the afflictions.

original: dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba la ni gnyi ga yod do //
analyzed: dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba la ni gnyi ga yod do //
translated: One liberated regardless of circumstances has both.

original: mang po'i tshig ni zhes bya ba ni tshe'i 'du byed dag ces smos pa gang yin pa de ni mang po'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: mang po'i tshig ni zhes bya ba ni tshe'i 'du byed dag ces smos pa gang yin pa de ni mang po'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúmany‚Äù refers to the many moments of the formative forces of life.

original: de lta bas na tshe dang srog gi 'du byed kyi skad cig ma mang po rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshe dang srog gi 'du byed kyi skad cig ma mang po rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚Äúin regard to the many moments of the formative forces of life and of vitality.‚Äù

original: tshe'i 'du byed rgyud la yod pa mang po rnams la 'dor zhing byin gyis rlob pa'i phyir te rgyun gyis don mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang skad cig ma gcig ni gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir gcig la 'dor ba'am byin gyis rlob pa ni dgos pa med
analyzed: tshe'i 'du byed rgyud la yod pa mang po rnams la 'dor zhing byin gyis rlob pa'i phyir te rgyun gyis don mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang skad cig ma gcig ni gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir gcig la 'dor ba'am byin gyis rlob pa ni dgos pa med
translated: Because he abandons and blesses the many formative forces of life that exist in the stream of consciousness, because he accomplishes the meaning of the stream and because a single moment is not abandoned or blessed, there is no purpose in abandoning or blessing a single moment.

original: do // dus gzhan gyi bar du 'jug pa tshe'i rdzas gcig bu ni med do zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyi bar du 'dug pa'i ngang tshul can ni dus gzhan gyi bar du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: do // dus gzhan gyi bar du 'jug pa tshe'i rdzas gcig bu ni med do zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyi bar du 'dug pa'i ngang tshul can ni dus gzhan gyi bar du 'dug pa'o //
translated: But there is no single substance called life that endures for a period of time.

original: skad cig mi ma yin pa ste kha cig na re tshe'i rdzas de lta bu de med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //üîΩ'du byed mang po rnams la zhes bya ba 'di ni mdo sde ba rnams kyi phyogs yin te /
analyzed: skad cig mi ma yin pa ste kha cig na re tshe'i rdzas de lta bu de med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro // 'du byed mang po rnams la zhes bya ba 'di ni mdo sde ba rnams kyi phyogs yin te /
translated: Some say that the expression a period of time is used to indicate that there is no single substance called life.üîΩThe VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the expression many formations is used because there are many formations in a single moment to which the designation life is applied.

original: skad cig ma gcig kho na la gang dag la cho zhes gdags pa'i 'du byed de dag mang po zhig yod kyi tshe zhes bya ba'i rdzas gcig pu zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig kho na la gang dag la cho zhes gdags pa'i 'du byed de dag mang po zhig yod kyi tshe zhes bya ba'i rdzas gcig pu zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no single substance called life.

original: 'du byed de dag kyang phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid dam phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed de dag kyang phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid dam phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those formations should be regarded as having the nature of the five aggregates or the nature of four aggregates.

original: de lta ma yin na 'du byed smos pa mdzad par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'du byed smos pa mdzad par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Otherwise, the expression formations would not be used.

original: 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis srog dag byin gyis brlabs nas tshe dag btang ngo zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis srog dag byin gyis brlabs nas tshe dag btang ngo zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be said: The Lord blessed their life and extended their life.

original: 'chi ba la mnga' ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba @96a * //
analyzed: 'chi ba la mnga' ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba @96a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate mastery over death, means in order to demonstrate mastery over death.

original: la dbang ba nyid mnga'o zhes par ro //
analyzed: la dbang ba nyid mnga'o zhes par ro //
translated: The word mastery is understood.üîΩIt is not that he blessed only three months and not more, because there would be no purpose in training beyond that.

original: zla ba gsum kho na byin gyis brlabs te phyin chad ni 'dul ba'i don med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zla ba gsum bsdus pa ste zla ba gsum nyid zla ba gsum mo //
analyzed: zla ba gsum kho na byin gyis brlabs te phyin chad ni 'dul ba'i don med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zla ba gsum bsdus pa ste zla ba gsum nyid zla ba gsum mo //
translated: Three months is a summary, meaning only three months.

original: zla ba gsum phyin chad ni 'dul ba'i don med pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: zla ba gsum phyin chad ni 'dul ba'i don med pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: It is not that there would be no purpose in training beyond three months,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'i mjug ni shin tu bzang ldan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'i mjug ni shin tu bzang ldan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conclusion of the Buddha's deeds is extremely auspicious.

original: bskal pa las lhag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said more than an eon,

original: bskal pa ni bskal pa gcig rangs pa yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa ni bskal pa gcig rangs pa yin no //
translated: where an eon means a complete eon.

original: bskal pa bas lhag pa ni bskal pa bas lhag pa yin te /
analyzed: bskal pa bas lhag pa ni bskal pa bas lhag pa yin te /
translated: More than an eon means beyond an eon.

original: bskal pa bas thal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bskal pa bas thal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the term eon is ‚Äúthat which is blown by the wind.‚Äù

original: de yang bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: And in order to establish that, it is said, ‚Äúin order to establish the thesis.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na tshig tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshig tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be mere words.

original: phung po dang 'chi bdag gi bdud dag las zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re bdud ni bzhi ste lha'i bu'i bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / phung po'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
analyzed: phung po dang 'chi bdag gi bdud dag las zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re bdud ni bzhi ste lha'i bu'i bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / phung po'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
translated: With regard to the demons of the aggregates and of death, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: There are four demons: the demon of the sons of the gods, the demon of the afflictions, the demon of the aggregates, and the demon of death.

original: de la thun dang po la lha'i bu'i bdud las rgyal lo //
analyzed: de la thun dang po la lha'i bu'i bdud las rgyal lo //
translated: In the first watch of the night, he conquers the demon of the sons of the gods.

original: thun gnyis pa la lha'i spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs nas thun gsum pa la nyon mongs pa'i bdud las rgyal lo //
analyzed: thun gnyis pa la lha'i spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs nas thun gsum pa la nyon mongs pa'i bdud las rgyal lo //
translated: In the second watch, he surveys the world with his divine eye and in the third watch, he conquers the demon of the afflictions.

original: yul yangs pa can du srog gi 'du byed dag byin gyis brlabs nas tshe'i 'du byed dag bor te /
analyzed: yul yangs pa can du srog gi 'du byed dag byin gyis brlabs nas tshe'i 'du byed dag bor te /
translated: In Vai≈õƒÅlƒ´, he blesses the compositional factors of life and abandons the compositional factors of life.

original: phung po'i bdud las rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir phung po dag btang ngo //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud las rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir phung po dag btang ngo //
translated: In order to conquer the demon of the aggregates, he abandons the aggregates.

original: de dag btang nas nongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag btang nas nongs par 'gyur te /
translated: If you give them away, you will be at fault.

original: de bas na 'chi bdag gi bdud las rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir byin gyis brlabs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'chi bdag gi bdud las rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir byin gyis brlabs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, in order to conquer the demon of death, they are consecrated.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni dri ba las dri ba gzhan 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni dri ba las dri ba gzhan 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: This concludes the digression.

original: bcu gnyis gnyis zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis kho na rnam pa gnyis kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ngo //üîΩdad pa la sogs pa kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa la thug pa'i bar brgyad dang yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa gcig tu rnam par smin pa srog gi dbang po las gzhan pa dbang po bcu gnyis ni rnam par smin pa yang yin la
analyzed: bcu gnyis gnyis zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis kho na rnam pa gnyis kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ngo // dad pa la sogs pa kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa la thug pa'i bar brgyad dang yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa gcig tu rnam par smin pa srog gi dbang po las gzhan pa dbang po bcu gnyis ni rnam par smin pa yang yin la
translated: The twelve are twofold means that only twelve are twofold.

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa yang yin te /
translated: Eight faculties, from faith to the faculty of final knowledge, and the faculty of life force, which is not a faculty that is the result of evolution, are either the result of evolution or not the result of evolution.üîΩThe twelve faculties, from the eye faculty to the body faculty, are the result of evolution.

original: de la mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po la thug pa'i bar bdun gnyid log pa pas mngon par bsgrubs pa rgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni rnam par smin @96b pa ma yin no //üîΩyid dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yid la sogs pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gang dag yin pa de dag kyang rnam par smin pa ma yin la lung du ma bstan pa spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnasüîΩpa dang sprul pa ba'i ngo bo nyid gang dag yin pa de dag kyang ci rigs par rnam par smin pa ma yin no //üîΩci rigs par zhes bya ba'i khyad par smos pa ni spyod lam pa la sogs pa yid kyi nyid yin pas sdug bsngal gyi dbang po mi srid pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po la thug pa'i bar bdun gnyid log pa pas mngon par bsgrubs pa rgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni rnam par smin @96b pa ma yin no // yid dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yid la sogs pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gang dag yin pa de dag kyang rnam par smin pa ma yin la lung du ma bstan pa spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnas pa dang sprul pa ba'i ngo bo nyid gang dag yin pa de dag kyang ci rigs par rnam par smin pa ma yin no // ci rigs par zhes bya ba'i khyad par smos pa ni spyod lam pa la sogs pa yid kyi nyid yin pas sdug bsngal gyi dbang po mi srid pa'i phyir la /
translated: The seven faculties from eye to male organ that are established by one who is asleep are not karmic maturation.üîΩThe mental faculty, pleasure, and so on are not karmic maturation.

analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dag kyang kha cig tu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
