original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na ni spyod lam pa'i yid kyi dbang po dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na ni spyod lam pa'i yid kyi dbang po dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
translated: In the desire realm, the faculty of mind in the stage of ordinary action and the faculties of pleasure and equanimity that are concomitant with it are not karmic maturation.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni spyod lam pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba'i dbang po ni rnam par smin pa ma yin te sa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni spyod lam pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba'i dbang po ni rnam par smin pa ma yin te sa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: In the form realm, the faculty of feeling that is in the stage of ordinary action and concomitant with it is not karmic maturation, but it is karmic maturation in the formless realm.

original: sprul ba pa ni sa lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: sprul ba pa ni sa lnga pa yin te /
translated: The emanation mind is on five levels.

original: de la ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po kho na rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po kho na rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
translated: On that level, only the faculty of equanimity is not karmic maturation.

original: btsun pa go cha mtha' yas na re ni spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnas pa dang sprul pa ba rnams ni rtag tu btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: btsun pa go cha mtha' yas na re ni spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnas pa dang sprul pa ba rnams ni rtag tu btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Bhadanta Anantavarman says: The stage of ordinary action, the stage of creativity, and the emanation mind are always concomitant with the faculty of equanimity.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang spyod lam pa dang sprul pa pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang po la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i yid kyi dbang po la sogs pa rnam par smin
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang spyod lam pa dang sprul pa pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang po la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i yid kyi dbang po la sogs pa rnam par smin
translated: The mental faculty and so on that are different from the faculties that are virtuous, afflicted, the nature of demeanor, and the nature of emanating are karmic maturation because they arise from karmic maturation.

original: pa las skyes pa dag ni rnam par smin pa yin no //üîΩlhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhes bya bar grub po zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po dang mig la sogs pa bcu gnyis ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: pa las skyes pa dag ni rnam par smin pa yin no // lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhes bya bar grub po zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po dang mig la sogs pa bcu gnyis ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: The remaining faculties are not karmic maturation.

original: de dag nges par bzung ba kho nas lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag nges par bzung ba kho nas lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: The remaining faculties are established as not being karmic maturation because they are not included in the faculties that are definitely karmic maturation, such as the faculty of life force and the twelve such as the eyes.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: yid mi bde ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin te 'di ltar /üîΩde gcig ni /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin te 'di ltar / de gcig ni /
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is not karmic maturation because it is virtuous and nonvirtuous.üîΩAs will be explained, it is said:

original: rnam par smin bcas zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin bcas zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: One is karmic maturation.

original: dad la sogs /
analyzed: dad la sogs /
translated: Faith and so on

original: dge brgyad / ces 'byung bas rnam par smin pa ma yin te rnam par smin pa'i mtshan @97a * //
analyzed: dge brgyad / ces 'byung bas rnam par smin pa ma yin te rnam par smin pa'i mtshan @97a * //
translated: are not karmic maturation because they are not included in the three karmic maturations.

original: nyid / rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
analyzed: nyid / rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
translated: The defining characteristics of karmic maturation are:üîΩKarmic maturation is neutral.

original: sems can zhes bya zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that sentient beings are not karmic maturation because they are not included in the three karmic maturations.

original: gal te yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say mental dissatisfaction is not karmic maturation,üîΩthen this scripture would be contradicted.

original: lung 'di dang 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir las ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lung 'di dang 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir las ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To explain this, he says: Karma is threefold.üîΩFrom the perspective of experiencing concomitant states,

original: mtshungs par ldan pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas zhes bya ba myong bar 'gyur ba ni tshor ba ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas zhes bya ba myong bar 'gyur ba ni tshor ba ste /
translated: experience is feeling.

original: 'di la yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yod pas na yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las so //
analyzed: 'di la yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yod pas na yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las so //
translated: Since mental dissatisfaction is experienced here, it is karma to be experienced as mental dissatisfaction.

original: 'o na ni yid bde ba dang btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dag kyang zhes bya ba /
analyzed: 'o na ni yid bde ba dang btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dag kyang zhes bya ba /
translated: If that is so, then karma to be experienced as mental satisfaction and equanimity would also be karma to be experienced as mental dissatisfaction.

original: pha rol po'i bsam pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa tsam yin par smras pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba bzhin du yid bde ba dang btang snyoms dag kyang rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ba snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol po'i bsam pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa tsam yin par smras pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba bzhin du yid bde ba dang btang snyoms dag kyang rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ba snyam pa yin no //
translated: The opponent thinks that just as mental satisfaction is not karmic maturation because it is merely concomitant, so too mental dissatisfaction and equanimity are not karmic maturation.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa yin yang nyes pa med la rnam par smin pa yin yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba 'di la yid bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yod pas yid bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yin no zhes byas na yang nyes pa med
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa yin yang nyes pa med la rnam par smin pa yin yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba 'di la yid bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yod pas yid bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yin no zhes byas na yang nyes pa med
translated: There is no error in stating that it is concomitant but not karmic maturation and there is no error in stating that it is karmic maturation but not concomitant.

original: la / 'di la yid bde ba rnam par smin pa nyid du myong bar 'gyur ba yod pas na yid bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las so zhes byas na yang nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: la / 'di la yid bde ba rnam par smin pa nyid du myong bar 'gyur ba yod pas na yid bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las so zhes byas na yang nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no error in stating that it is karma to be experienced as mental satisfaction because it is experienced as mental satisfaction.üîΩThere is no error in stating that it is karma to be experienced as mental satisfaction because mental satisfaction is experienced as karmic maturation.

original: go skabs med pas na de ni de ltar shes so zhes bya ba ni gal te yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs pas yongs su dpyad na ste /
analyzed: go skabs med pas na de ni de ltar shes so zhes bya ba ni gal te yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs pas yongs su dpyad na ste /
translated: If one analyzes with reasoning that mental dissatisfaction is not karmic ripening,

original: de bas na go skabs med pas 'di skad du mtshungs par ldan pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas zhes rnam par 'chad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na go skabs med pas 'di skad du mtshungs par ldan pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas zhes rnam par 'chad par byed pa yin no //
translated: then since there is no opportunity for that, it is explained that the statement is made from the perspective of the experience of concomitant states.

original: de'i phyir yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, what reasoning is there for this statement that mental dissatisfaction is not karmic ripening?

original: yang na la lar ni mtshungs par ldan pa myong bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na la lar ni mtshungs par ldan pa myong bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: Or, in some cases, it is the experience of concomitant states.

original: la lar ni rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i go skabs med pas na de ni de ltar shes so //
analyzed: la lar ni rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i go skabs med pas na de ni de ltar shes so //
translated: In some cases, it is the experience of karmic ripening. Since there is no opportunity for that, it is understood that way.

original: gal te khyod 'o na ni thams cad du mtshungs par ldan pa myong bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: gal te khyod 'o na ni thams cad du mtshungs par ldan pa myong bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes smra na /
translated: If you say, In that case, it is the experience of concomitant states in all cases,

original: bsam pa 'das ma thag pa 'di la brtags nas yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bsam pa 'das ma thag pa 'di la brtags nas yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: What is the reason for saying that the immediately preceding thought does not ripen as mental dissatisfaction?

original: yid mi bde ba ni zhes bya ba ni @97b mi 'dod pa sems par byed pa la sogs pa kun tu rtog pa'i khyad par dag gis skyed par byed cing rnam par zhi bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni zhes bya ba ni @97b mi 'dod pa sems par byed pa la sogs pa kun tu rtog pa'i khyad par dag gis skyed par byed cing rnam par zhi bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is generated and pacified by the specific conceptual states of thinking about what is undesirable, etc.

original: yid bde ba yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa sems pa la sogs pa kun tu rtog pa'i khyad par dag gis skyed par byed cing rnam par zhi bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yid bde ba yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa sems pa la sogs pa kun tu rtog pa'i khyad par dag gis skyed par byed cing rnam par zhi bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Mental satisfaction is also like that, i.e., it is generated and pacified by the specific conceptual states of thinking about what is desirable, etc.

original: 'o na 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la yid mi bde ba ldog ste /
analyzed: 'o na 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la yid mi bde ba ldog ste /
translated: But if that is so, then mental dissatisfaction would not exist for those who are free from attachment, because they have abandoned the mental faculty.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la rnam par smin par gyur ba mig la sogs pa ni mi ldog gi yid mi bde ba ni ldog ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la rnam par smin par gyur ba mig la sogs pa ni mi ldog gi yid mi bde ba ni ldog ste /
translated: Eyes and so on that are karmic maturation for those free from attachment do not revert, but mental dissatisfaction does revert.üîΩThis is because a treatise declares:

original: bstan bcos las yid mi bde ba dang 'dod chags dang bral zhing mi ldan pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos las yid mi bde ba dang 'dod chags dang bral zhing mi ldan pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is free from attachment and not possessed.

original: mdo las kyang 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la ni zug rngu'i tshor ba gnyis bshad de /
analyzed: mdo las kyang 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la ni zug rngu'i tshor ba gnyis bshad de /
translated: Also a sutra explains that those not free from attachment have two painful feelings:üîΩOne experiences physical pain and mental dissatisfaction.

original: lus kyi sdug bsngal dang sems kyi yid mi bde ba yang so sor myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni zug rngu gcig ste /
analyzed: lus kyi sdug bsngal dang sems kyi yid mi bde ba yang so sor myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni zug rngu gcig ste /
translated: Those free from attachment have one painful feeling:üîΩOne experiences physical pain alone.

original: lus kyi sdug bsngal kho na so sor myong bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi sdug bsngal kho na so sor myong bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated because it is said in the sutras.

original: de dag gis yid bde ba lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi yid bde ba lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pa yang ci 'dra ba zhig yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gis yid bde ba lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi yid bde ba lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pa yang ci 'dra ba zhig yod par 'gyur /
translated: What kind of neutral mental satisfaction is there that is the karmic maturation of those free from attachment?

original: de dag gi yid bde ba ni snyoms par 'jug pas bsdus pas 'byung la de yang dge ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi yid bde ba ni snyoms par 'jug pas bsdus pas 'byung la de yang dge ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin te /
translated: Their mental satisfaction arises from meditative attainment and since that is virtuous, it is not karmic maturation.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi yid bde ba rnam par smin pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi yid bde ba rnam par smin pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, you must explain what kind of karmic maturation their mental satisfaction is.üîΩWhatever it is like, it exists.üîΩThis teaches that even though it is not ascertained, it definitely exists.

original: ci 'dra ba yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi chod kyang de ni yod pa kho na'o zhes ston par byed pa yin te de la rnam par smin pa'i go skabs yod du zin kyang yid mi bde ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabsüîΩna yang rung ste /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi chod kyang de ni yod pa kho na'o zhes ston par byed pa yin te de la rnam par smin pa'i go skabs yod du zin kyang yid mi bde ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabsüîΩna yang rung ste /
translated: Even though there is an opportunity for karmic maturation, mental satisfaction does not exist in the state of meditative attainment.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mi 'byung bas de'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mi 'byung bas de'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: Since it never occurs in that way, it is not a karmic maturation.üîΩThe mental faculty is the karmic maturation of both,

original: yid kyi dbang po ni gnyi ga'i rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro gnyi gar dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyi ga'i rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni gnyi ga'i rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro gnyi gar dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyi ga'i rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: because it is the karmic maturation of both virtue and nonvirtue in both fortunate and unfortunate reincarnations.

original: brgyad pa srog gi dbang po rnams bde 'gro na ni dge ba'i rnam @98a * //
analyzed: brgyad pa srog gi dbang po rnams bde 'gro na ni dge ba'i rnam @98a * //
translated: The eighth, the faculty of life force, is the karmic maturation of virtueüîΩin fortunate reincarnations.

original: par smin pa yin la zhes bya ba 'di ni spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: par smin pa yin la zhes bya ba 'di ni spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is a general statement.

original: de la ji ltar mtshan gnyis pa sdug pa ma yin par 'dod pa dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar mtshan gnyis pa sdug pa ma yin par 'dod pa dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the two sexual organs are asserted to be the karmic maturation of virtue?

original: bde 'gro na mi dge bas mtshan gnyis po de'i gnas rnyed pa yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩ'di'i gnas nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: bde 'gro na mi dge bas mtshan gnyis po de'i gnas rnyed pa yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩ'di'i gnas nyams pa yin te /
translated: The two sexual organs are obtained through nonvirtue in fortunate reincarnations.üîΩThe two sexual organs are obtained through nonvirtue in fortunate reincarnations.

original: de'i phyir 'di mi dge bas rnyed pa yin te ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos yin gyi mtshan gnyis ni dge ba kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di mi dge bas rnyed pa yin te ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos yin gyi mtshan gnyis ni dge ba kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is obtained by nonvirtue. It is a nonassociated formative force. But the two signs are the karmic maturation of virtue alone.

original: de gcig ni /
analyzed: de gcig ni /
translated: One of them

original: rnam par smin bcas zhes bya ba ni de gcig ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par smin bcas zhes bya ba ni de gcig ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: is called ‚Äúhaving karmic maturation.‚Äù One of them is called ‚Äúhaving karmic maturation‚Äù because it has karmic maturation.

original: de'i phyir ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don dang rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don dang rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúalone‚Äù and is applied in a different order.

original: gnas gzhan du sbyar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du sbyar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is applied in a different order, that is, in a different place.

original: de gcig rnam par smin bcas ni //
analyzed: de gcig rnam par smin bcas ni //
translated: One of them has karmic maturation.

original: zhes byas nas ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar bar mi 'gyur te tshigs su bcad pa bsdebs pa dang mthun par de skad ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes byas nas ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar bar mi 'gyur te tshigs su bcad pa bsdebs pa dang mthun par de skad ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is not applied in a different order after ‚Äúone of them has karmic maturation,‚Äù but is explained in this way to conform with the meter.

original: de ni lung du ma bstan pa yang med la zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba'i rigs pa ston par byed pa yin te //
analyzed: de ni lung du ma bstan pa yang med la zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba'i rigs pa ston par byed pa yin te //
translated: It is reasonable to understand that this is a teaching that it is only with a ripened result.

original: rnam par smin pa med pa'i dngos po ni gnyis su 'dod de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med pa'i dngos po ni gnyis su 'dod de /
translated: A thing without a ripened result is considered to be twofold:

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: indeterminate and uncontaminated.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par gyis bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par gyis bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not indeterminate because it is generated by a specific conception.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not uncontaminated because it is not equipoise.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni sa bon rul ba bzhin du rnam par smin pa 'byin par mi nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni sa bon rul ba bzhin du rnam par smin pa 'byin par mi nus pa ma yin no //
translated: An indeterminate state is not incapable of producing a ripened result, like a rotten seed.

original: zag pa med pa ni srid pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa 'byin par mi nus te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni srid pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa 'byin par mi nus te /
translated: An uncontaminated state is incapable of producing a ripened result because it is not moistened by craving,

original: sa bon ma brlan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon ma brlan pa bzhin no //
translated: like a seed that is not moistened.

original: shugs kyis na de ni mi dge ba 'am dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shugs kyis na de ni mi dge ba 'am dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: By implication, it is nonvirtuous or contaminated virtue.

original: de'i phyir yid mi bde ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin gyi rnam par smin pa med pa ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid mi bde ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin gyi rnam par smin pa med pa ni med do //
translated: Therefore mental dissatisfaction is only with karmic maturation, and it does not lack karmic maturation.

original: bcu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni bcu kho na rnam pa gnyis yin la rnam gnyis kho na bcu yin no zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: bcu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni bcu kho na rnam pa gnyis yin la rnam gnyis kho na bcu yin no zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúten are of two types‚Äù means that only ten are of two types and only those of two types are ten.

original: rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par @98b smin pa med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par @98b smin pa med pa dag yin no //
translated: Those of two types are those that are with karmic maturation and those that are without karmic maturation.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.

original: yid dang tshor gzhan dad la sogs //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩtshor zhes bya ba ni tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: yid dang tshor gzhan dad la sogs // zhes bya ba la / tshor zhes bya ba ni tshor ba yin no //
translated: The others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba smos pas ni yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa gzung ste /üîΩyid mi bde ba ni bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba smos pas ni yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa gzung ste /üîΩyid mi bde ba ni bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.üîΩThe others are mental satisfaction and so on.

original: dad la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dag bzung ngo zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dad la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dag bzung ngo zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: Faith and so on refers to faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: gzhan ni rnam par smin pa med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa dmigs kyis bstsal ba'i phyir srog dang gzugs can gyi dbang po bdun dang kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum ni
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam par smin pa med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa dmigs kyis bstsal ba'i phyir srog dang gzugs can gyi dbang po bdun dang kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum ni
translated: The others are like the indeterminate ones, which means that since mental dissatisfaction and so on are excluded as explained above, the seven physical faculties, the three faculties such as the faculty producing complete knowledge,

original: go rims bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa dag yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa dag yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: are established as being without karmic maturation because they are respectively neutral and uncontaminated.

original: dge ba brgyad ces bya ba ni brgyad ni dge ba kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba brgyad ces bya ba ni brgyad ni dge ba kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: The eight virtuous faculties are definitely virtuous alone.

original: yid mi bde ba dang / rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni rnam gnyis kho na yid mi bde ba yin la yid mi bde ba kho na rnam gnyis yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang / rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni rnam gnyis kho na yid mi bde ba yin la yid mi bde ba kho na rnam gnyis yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand the two‚Äù refers to the fact that regret and apathy are only mental factors that are not universally occurring, and that mental distress is only a mental factor that is both universally occurring and specific.

original: rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe two‚Äù refers to the two types of mental factors that are virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: dge ba yang yin la lung du ma bstan pa yang yin pa dang mi dge ba yang yin la lung du ma bstan pa yin zhes bya ba rnam gnyis gzhan yang yod na de ji ltar 'di skad du dge ba yang yin mi dge ba yang yin noüîΩzhes bya bar nges par gzung zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba yang yin la lung du ma bstan pa yang yin pa dang mi dge ba yang yin la lung du ma bstan pa yin zhes bya ba rnam gnyis gzhan yang yod na de ji ltar 'di skad du dge ba yang yin mi dge ba yang yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung zhe na /
translated: If there are other mental factors that are both virtuous and indeterminate, and also both nonvirtuous and indeterminate, why is it stated categorically that mental distress is both virtuous and nonvirtuous?

original: rnam par bshad pa'i sgo nas bye brag rtogs pa yin no //üîΩrnam pa gcig tu na yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa'i sgo nas bye brag rtogs pa yin no // rnam pa gcig tu na yid mi bde ba rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ste /
translated: The meaning of the term is understood through explanation.üîΩAlternatively, the phrase ‚Äúand the two‚Äù refers to the fact that mental distress is only a mental factor that has a karmic ripening.

original: de lta ba na 'di kho na rnam pa gnyis yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ba na 'di kho na rnam pa gnyis yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is only mental distress that is both virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: tshor gzhan ni yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa'i tshor ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshor gzhan ni yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa'i tshor ba bzhi ste /
translated: The other sensations are the four sensations other than mental dissatisfaction.

original: de ni bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mental dissatisfaction has already been explained.

original: rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: The three types are wholesome, unwholesome, and undefined.

original: rnam gsum ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam gsum ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three types are the three types of sensation.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni dge ba yin no //
translated: Those associated with nonattachment, etc., are wholesome.

original: chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mi dge ba yin no //
translated: Those associated with attachment, etc., are unwholesome.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni @99a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni @99a * //
translated: The others are undefined.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The others are undefined.üîΩThe eighth, the faculty of life force, is of one type.

original: gzhan ni rnam pa gcig ces bya ba ni brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang gzhan ni rnam pa gcig kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam pa gcig ces bya ba ni brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang gzhan ni rnam pa gcig kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: It is definitely to be held as being of one type only.

original: lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is undefined alone.

original: 'di'i don du 'di yar smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i don du 'di yar smos te /
translated: This is the meaning of the above statement.

original: de lta ma yin na de mi dge ba kho na yin pa'am dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin par yang dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de mi dge ba kho na yin pa'am dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin par yang dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be suspected that it is only nonvirtuous or only virtuous and neutral.

original: de lta bas na mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa gcig bu nyid rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir yang brjod de /
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa gcig bu nyid rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir yang brjod de /
translated: Therefore, it is also stated to establish the single aspect that is desired.

original: 'di la rnam pa gcig nyid gang zhig srid pa de yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rnam pa gcig nyid gang zhig srid pa de yin no //
translated: Whatever is possible in this regard is that very single aspect.

original: srid pa yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is possible?

original: lung du ma bstan pa yin no //üîΩdri med ma gtogs 'dod par gtogs //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yin no // dri med ma gtogs 'dod par gtogs //
translated: It is neutral.üîΩThe verse states, ‚ÄúIt belongs to the desire realm, except for the stainless.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa kho na ma gtogs pa 'dod par gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa kho na ma gtogs pa 'dod par gtogs pa yin no //
translated: It belongs to the desire realm, except for the stainless alone.

original: de ni de ldan pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni khams gsum ma gtogs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩpho mo'i dbang dang sdug bsngal dag //
analyzed: de ni de ldan pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni khams gsum ma gtogs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // pho mo'i dbang dang sdug bsngal dag //
translated: It is only not possessed by that, meaning it is only not possessed by the three realms.üîΩThe verse states, ‚ÄúExcept for the female and male faculties and the two lower types of suffering.‚Äù

original: ma gtogs gzugs gtogs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni pho dang mo ni pho mo'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs gzugs gtogs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni pho dang mo ni pho mo'o //
translated: The female and male are female and male.

original: de dag gi dbang po ni pho mo'i dbang po dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi dbang po ni pho mo'i dbang po dag yin no //
translated: The faculties of these are the male and female faculties.

original: sdug bsngal dag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid dag yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid dag yin te /
translated: The two kinds of suffering are the nature of the sensation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po de dag dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag dang 'dir sbyar ba dri ma med pa ma gtogs pa dbang po lhag ma rnams ni gzugs su gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po de dag dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag dang 'dir sbyar ba dri ma med pa ma gtogs pa dbang po lhag ma rnams ni gzugs su gtogs pa yin no //
translated: The remaining faculties, except for the stainless ones, are included in the form realm.

original: ga las 'byung zhes dris pa dang mdo bstan pa'i phyir gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de zhes bya ba ni rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: ga las 'byung zhes dris pa dang mdo bstan pa'i phyir gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de zhes bya ba ni rgyas par smos te /
translated: The question is asked, ‚ÄúFrom where?‚Äù and the sutra is taught. The phrase ‚Äúit is not possible‚Äù is explained in detail.

original: mdo 'di las so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di las so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that this is from this sutra.

original: pho'i ngo bo gzhan 'dod pa'i khams na pho rnams la yod pa gang yin pa ni yod do zhes bya ba ni nu ma la sogs pa dbyibs dang nga ro dang spyod pa gzhan pa nyid do //
analyzed: pho'i ngo bo gzhan 'dod pa'i khams na pho rnams la yod pa gang yin pa ni yod do zhes bya ba ni nu ma la sogs pa dbyibs dang nga ro dang spyod pa gzhan pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of a male, which exists in the desire realm for males, does exist. The meaning is that the shape of the breasts, etc., the voice, and the behavior are different.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po med do zhes bya ba ni lus dang ba'i phyir ba snun pa las byung ba de med la mi dge ba med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po med do zhes bya ba ni lus dang ba'i phyir ba snun pa las byung ba de med la mi dge ba med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang med do //
translated: The faculty of suffering is absent because the body is pure, since the faculty of suffering arises from the faculty of touch due to the impact of an external object, and that is absent because the body is pure.üîΩThe faculty of mental dissatisfaction is absent because the body is moistened by serenity, since the body is moistened by the serenity of meditative concentration and the mind is free from irritation.

original: zhi gnas kyis brlan pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba'i dbang po med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhi gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin @99b gyis khong khro ba dang bral bas rgyud la rtsub bag med pa de'i phyir yid mi bde ba med do //üîΩkun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyis brlan pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba'i dbang po med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhi gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin @99b gyis khong khro ba dang bral bas rgyud la rtsub bag med pa de'i phyir yid mi bde ba med do // kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: The faculty of suffering is absent because there is no basis for malice.

original: kun nas mnar sems ni 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems ni 'khrug pa'o //
translated: Malice is irritation.

original: de'i gzhi ni yul yin pas kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni yul yin pas kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi'o //
translated: Its basis is an object, hence the basis of malice.

original: kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi ni dgu ste /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi ni dgu ste /
translated: There are nine bases of malice:

original: bdag la gnod pa byas so byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi gsum dang / bdag gi mdza' bo la gnod pa byas so byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi gzhan gsum dang /
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa byas so byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi gsum dang / bdag gi mdza' bo la gnod pa byas so byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi gzhan gsum dang /
translated: The three bases of complete harm are: he has harmed me, is harming me, will harm me. The three other bases of complete harm are: he has harmed, is harming, will harm my friends.

original: bdag gi dgra bo la phan pa byas so byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi gzhan gsum mo //
analyzed: bdag gi dgra bo la phan pa byas so byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi gzhan gsum mo //
translated: The three other bases of complete harm are: he has benefited, is benefiting, will benefit my enemies.
